loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: La señora Maria Isabel tiene 49años. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida y esta  ubicada en su humilde vivienda, por lo que siempre le ha gustado cocinar y realizar deliciosos platillos, ya que también tenía que mantener a sus tiene 5 hijos, que actualmente trabajan de manera independiente. Pues no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos con Fundación por lo que ha sido una cliente muy responsable. Se siente contenta con este nuevo financiamiento para la elaboración de sus comidas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar aceite, frutas y carnes. Ella tiene la meta de mejorar las condiciones de su loca.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel is 49 years old. She makes and sells food out of her humble home. She has always enjoyed cooking and making delicious platters, since she also had to take care of her five children, who now work independently. This is not the first time that she has taken out a loan with the Foundation, since she has been a very responsible client. She is pleased with this new loan for ingredients for cooking food, such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, fruits, and meats. Her goal is to improve the condition of her store.

Translated from Spanish by Rachael Mossey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Libia Esther

texts.es:
Libia Carrillos O. vive en la ciudad de Bogotá en el barrio Los Nogales, con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 11 a 17 años, desde allí   tiene su negocio de confeccionar  ropa interior para damas, caballeros y para niños, el cual  comenzó hace 6 años, continuando con la   tradición familiar, porque Libia   aprendió este arte de su madre muy fácilmente y es justamente uno de sus talentos. 
Libia Esther es una mujer muy soñadora y progresista, por eso tiene una meta que es la de mejorar la calidad de su confección especialmente los acabado y como no tiene maquina especializada demora los tiempos de producción y debe recurrir a otros medios para que sus productos tengan un excelente acabado, así que se propuso comprar su maquina collarína  y para eso solicita su credikiva a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo porque quiere comprarla. Su desafío principal es poder brindarle a su familia el bienestar que ellos se merecen y por eso trabaja día a día y minuto a minuto para lograr este propósito constante.
texts.en:
Libia Carrillos O. lives with her husband and three children, ranging in ages from 11 to 17, in the Los Nogales neighborhood of Bogotá. There she runs her business where she makes undergarments for ladies, gentlemen, and children. She began six years ago, continuing the family tradition. She learned this art from her mother with no trouble and this is one of her talents. Libia is a woman with many dreams and a desire to move ahead. This is why her goal is to improve the quality of her products, especially the finishing touches. Because she doesn’t have a specialized sewing machine, it delays her production times and she must resort to other means so that her products have excellent finishing touches. She would like to buy a collar machine, so she is asking for a Kiva loan through, “Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.” Her greatest desire is to give her family the well being that they deserve. This is why she works, day by day, minute by minute, so that she can meet this goal at all times.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sewing machine

loans.name: Juana Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer de 46 años, comerciante desde hace varios años, con ganancias de venta de leña y nacatamales comenzó,  lo que  logro  crecer e invertir en una  pulpería que junto a Afodenic ha venido aumentando de inventario. Obteniendo mejores productos. Ganancias con las cuales ha apoyado a su familia.
Lo que quiere es mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio, para tener espacio para cada segmento.
Lo que comprara con este préstamo es granos básicos, golosinas, lácteos, caja de jabón, papel higiénico, leche de pote, productos enlatados y productos consumibles de cada día.
Ya que la demanda es mucha, y cuando tiene poco productos no logra el objetivo. 
Y tiene que cubrir muchos gastos.
texts.en:
Juana is a 48-year-old woman and has been a businesswoman for several years. It began with her earnings from selling wood and nacatamales, with which she was able to build and invest in a grocery store. Together with Afodenic, she has increased her inventory, obtaining better products. Her earnings from the grocery store have supported her family.

What she wants is to improve the infrastructure of her business to have space for each section. With this loan she will purchase basic grains, sweets, dairy products, boxes of soap, toilet paper, cans of milk, canned goods and other groceries for daily life. Since demand is high, she does not meet her goal when she has few products and she has many expenses to pay.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of basic grains, dairy products, cereals, sweets, and boxes of soap to increase investment in her business.

loans.name: Heidi Tania

texts.es: La señora Heidi Tania tiene 21 años es soltera y no tiene hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, los cuales distribuye de manera ambulante, pese a que también en su casa oferta sus productos. Actualmente, algo que le afecta al igual que a la mayoría de personas en el país ha sido las enfermedades. Ella dio inicio a este negocio desde hace 2 años en sociedad con una hermana, con el tiempo ella fue teniendo su propio capital hasta llegar a trabajar de manera individual como lo hace ahora. Ella empezó vendiendo muy poco, debido a que las personas no la conocían, sin embargo fue haciéndose de clientes y pudo establecer un buen negocio. Este crédito solicitado será invertido en compra de materia prima y ofrecer nuevos productos a los clientes. Su sueño actualmente es realizar unas mejoras a la vivienda, además que desea poner el negocio en un solo lugar es decir poner una tienda.
texts.en:
Heidi Tania is 21, single and has no children. She sells general merchandise, which she sells door-to-door, and she also sells her products from her home. Currently, something that has affected her and the majority of people in the country has been illnesses. She started this business two years ago in partnership with a sister, and with time she gained her own capital and has now been able to work individually. She started selling very little, since people didn't know her, but she has been gaining customers and has been able to establish a good business. The requested loan will be invested in the purchase of basic materials and to offer new products to her customers. Her dream now is to make improvements to her home, since she wants to have the business in one single location; to set up a store.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Genesis 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Juana Margarita is the coordinator of her group Genesis 2 & 3 (Genesis). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and four children. She says that her most difficult challenges are to improve her business and give her family a better life with the profits.  In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying to cook.

Juana Margarita is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for over two years, starting with her own resources (economics). She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying miscellaneous products like underwear, natural medicine, cosmetics and household products. She will use the profits to buy shool supplies for her children and she want to see her business improve because she want to help her family with better income and change their home and life.
 
This Esperanza associate began with us because she likes the facilities Esperanza offers to her clients and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally, her group is located in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production, the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy underwear, natural products, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: G.s. Piedra Viva Group

texts.es: La señora Ivana Jamileth tiene 23 años de edad, es madre soltera con 1 hijo de 5 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la hojalatería, es decir la elaboración de pailas, peroles, cucharones, todo de aluminio luego esta mercadería la traslada al mercado oriental y al mercado de Masaya en donde ya tiene los compradores a los cuales les entrega el producto. Este negocio surgió desde hace 4 años, con recursos propios muy limitados y luego fue incrementándolo, Este negocio lo aprendió de su papa quien le enseño lo necesario para sobrevivir. Otro integrante de este grupo es don Luis Guillermo el cual tiene 55 años vive su esposa y un hijo. El señor también se dedica a la elaboración de utensilios de cocina de aluminio, los cuales los elabora en su casa de habitación y luego los vende en Managua. El señor tiene 8 años de dedicarse a este negocio. El señor y la Señora Ivania solicitaron este crédito con el objetivo de invertir en materia prima para su negocio que sirva de fuente de ingresos para su familia en general.
texts.en:
Ivana Jamileth is 23, and a single mother of one child, age 5. She is a tinsmith; she makes pans, pots and ladles all out of aluminium, and later brings this merchandise to the eastern market and to the market of Masaya, where she already has buyers to whom she delivers her products. She developed this business 4 years ago, with her own very limited resources, and she has been growing it. She learned this business from her father, who taught her the necessary skills for survival. Another member of this group is Luis Guillermo, who is 55 and lives with his wife and one child. He also makes cooking utensils of aluminium, which he makes in his home and later sells in Managua. He has worked in this business for 8 years. He and Ms Ivania are requesting this loan with the goal of investing in basic materials for their businesses which will serve as a source of income for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es: La Sra. Marcela es comerciante, ella vive en la zona de Pura  Pura de nuestra ciudad, su esposo es transportista, tiene 2 pequeños hijos , ellos son la razón de su vida. Trabaja llevando mercadería hasta los pueblos de clima cálido de nuestra ciudad y vende la mercadería al mayor y al menor dependiendo la feria a la que asista, la ropa es de origen Chileno de buena calidad y de precios económicos, esta muy feliz de haber accedido a este crédito ya que su intención es mejorar su calidad de vida, el dinero del credito es para la compra de ropa de temporada ya que tine muchos pedidos, es muy trabajadora y responsable esta muy agradecida con la institucion por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Miss Marcela is a merchant. She lives in the Pura Pura zone of the city [La Paz, Bolivia]. Her husband is a carrier. They have 2 small children, which are her reason for living. She works, bringing merchandise to the villages in the warmer areas of the city and sells the merchandise wholesale and retail depending on the market that she is visiting. The clothing is of Chilean origin, of good quality and affordable. She is very happy to have gained access to this credit since her goal is to improve her quality of life. The money of this loan is for the purchase of seasonal clothing since she has many orders. She is very hard-working and responsible, and is very grateful to the institution for the opportunity that they are offering her.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Cheikh Ahmed Tidiane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Cheikh Ahmed Tidiane B. est âgé de 35 ans. Il habite à Daroukhane dans la localité de Guediawaye. C’est un célibataire sans enfants. Monsieur B. est un jeune vendeur de pièces détachées qui a choisi son activité par passion. Et c’est  dans le souci de se créer une source de revenu qui pourrait  l’aider pour sa subsistance. Il est vendeur de pièces  depuis des années et c’est une activité qui marche bien pendant les fêtes  et durant l’année scolaire.
Monsieur B. est membre de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis mars 2003 mais il n’a jamais bénéficié de crédit  au sein de l’institution. Actuellement il sollicite un crédit  de 200 000 frs qui sera destiné à acheter des pièces  détachées  qu’il va revendre. Selon  lui le financement pourra lui permettre de diversifier sa gamme de produits qu’il va offrir a sa clientèle. Par conséquent  ce sera l’occasion pour lui d’accroitre ses bénéfices, de constituer une épargne et d’assister ses parents.
texts.en:
Mr. Cheikh Ahmed Tidiane B. is 35 years old. He lives in Daroukhane, in the town of Guediawaye. He's single and without children. Mr. B. is a young spare parts reseller, who chose this business out of passion. Eager to obtain an income source that could help him provide for himself, he's been selling spare parts for many years. It is a good business during the holidays and during the school year. Mrs. B. has been a member of the Baye credit association since March 2003, but he never benefited from a loan within the institution. At this time, he's seeking a XOF 200'000 loan, to be used to buy spare parts for resale. According to him, the loan will enable him to diversify the product line he offers to his clientele. As a consequence, this will give him the opportunity to increase his profits, put money away, and support his parents.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts for resale

loans.name: Unidos Para Vencer 3 Group

texts.en:
Yamirkys is the coordinator of her group Unidos para vencer 3 (Unite to succeed). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her child. She says that her most difficult challenges are to work hard in her new project she just started and improve it (it is a small private school). In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying teaching others.

Yamirkys is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She has had her business for four months, starting with some savings. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying paints and other stuff to remodel the structure. She will use the profits to buy a bed and invest in the school by saving. Her dreams are to become a professional in education and improve her business until the project is a success.
 
This Esperanza associate began with us because she needed funds to continue investing in the school so her dreams could come true, She said 'I thought though Esperanza I can achieve and I can be more productive and be a bless to others' and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production, the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To remodel the school structure

loans.name: Ruben Angel

texts.es:
El  Sr. Ruben,  tiene como actividad la venta de carne de res y pollo a demas de tener una tienda de barrio muy surtida estas dos actividades la realiza junto su esposa la sra. Nieves, estas actividades se constituyen en la principal actividad de su familia.
La carniceria y la tienda son muy conocidas en la zona devido a sus bajos precios siendo muy queridos en la misma es una familia muy trabajadora y emprendedora, esta ocacion solicita credito para aumentar su capital de trabajo con la compra de mercaderia y un mostrador vitrina para carniceria agrandando de esta manera  su tienda y mejorando su calidad de vida, tiene un hijito de un año de edad, estan muy agradecidos con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Ruben's business is selling beef and chicken, and he also runs a very well-stocked neighborhood store. He operates these two businesses together with his wife, Nieves, and they are his family's main activity. The butcher shop and store are well-known and well-liked in the area, thanks to their low prices. The family is very hard-working and enterprising. On this occasion, Ruben is requesting a loan to increase his working capital, buying merchandise and a display case for meat. This will help him expand his store and improve his quality of life. He has a little 1-year-old son. Ruben and his wife are very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence placed in them in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise and a special display case for meat

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es: La señora Gladis, tiene 61 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos, los cuales ambas son ya mayores de edad y le ayudan con aportes económicos. La señora Gladis se dedica a la elaboración de nacatamales, además de esto en su casa vende leña, frijoles, hielo, refrescos todo esto lo vende de contado. Ella tiene ya más de cinco años de tener ese negocio, el cual dio inicio con el propósito de tener una fuente de ingreso segura, para mantenerse ella y su familia. El trabajo duro siempre lo aprendió de su mama, la cual le enseño a elaborar nacatamales y la mandaba a vender a la calle a ella y a sus hermanas, pues fue así que aprendió a ganarse el pan de cada día. Ella solicito este crédito con el propósito de invertirlo en el negocio para seguir trabajando, y así obtener mayores ingresos económicos. Su sueño es seguir trabajando y que Dios le brinde la salud necesaria para continuar trabajando en su negocio.
texts.en:
Gladis is 61 years old, married, and has 2 adult children who help her economically. Gladis makes nacatamales (a special type of large tamale often sold in Nicaragua), and in addition she sells firewood, beans, ice and soft drinks from her home, all on a cash basis. She has had this business for more than 5 years. Her goal in starting the business was to have a secure source of income to support herself and her family. She learned to always work hard from her mother, who taught her to make nacatamales and sent her and her sisters out into the street to sell. In this way, she learned how to support herself. She requests a loan to invest in her business so that she can continue to work and obtain better earnings. Her dream is to continue to work, that God provides her with good health so that she can continue to work in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Lester Ignacio

texts.es: El señor Lester Ignacio tiene 24 años de edad, tiene en su casa de habitación un negocio de servicios ópticos, los cuales también vende a domicilio, también realiza exámenes visuales, todo con lo que se relacione con la venta de lentes completos. Sus ventas, en su mayoría son por encargos, es decir que las personas le pagan un 50% al encargar un producto y el otro 50% cuando se entrega el producto. El inicio en este negocio desde hace 3 años y medio, cabe señalarse su esposa es optometrista por lo que fue él el que estableció el negocio primeramente y ahora es don Lester quien se encarga de administrarlo. El está solicitando este crédito con el objetivo de comprar materias primas para elaboración de lentes. Algo que él hace es mantener la oferta de su producto a un precio  que sea accesible a las personas. Su sueño es establecer otra sucursal en otro departamento y por supuesto llegar a obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Mr. Lester Ignacio is 24 years old and runs an optometry business from his home. There he sells [products], performs eye exams, and does everything related to the sale of eyeglasses. Most of his sales come from pre-orders. He receives a 50% deposit from his customers at the time of ordering, and the other 50% when he delivers the products. He started this business three years and half years ago. His wife is an optometrist. [Lester] started the business and now he manages it. He is asking for this loan in order to buy eyeglass making supplies. One of the things he does is to keep the cost of his products affordable to his customers. One day he would like to open another branch in another location and, of course, increase his revenue.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Estrellas De Sajama Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal “Estrellas de Sajama” está conformada por quince personas, catorce mujeres y un varón, este es su ciclo Nº27. La presidenta es la señora Leonor C. vda. de Gonzales.  La asociación es parte del centro focal de Cascada desde sus primeros años.

La señora Leonor, socia de 60 años de edad, viuda, tuvo diez hijos durante su matrimonio, actualmente tiene como negocio la venta de “rellenos” ( papa aplastada, amasada rellena de cebolla,  carne, un trozo de huevo hervido), ella aprendió este negocio por necesidad, su madre fue quien le enseñó, desde los quince años.  

Ingresó a Pro Mujer por invitación de una amiga.   El crédito le servirá para aumentar el capital de trabajo. Compra la mercadería por mayor  de la “Ceja -  La Riel” que se encuentra en la ciudad de El Alto, la venta de los rellenos es realizada en la Ceja de forma ambulante.

Conversando con la presidenta comenta que lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer es la capacitación y compartir con las compañeras.

En cuanto a la asociación comunal, tienen diferentes tipos de negocios de servicio y comercio, como ser, tejido de chompa macramé, venta de refresco, ferretería, macramé, taller de pintura, venta de libros, costuras de centros, venta de café, lavado de arena, venta de bolsas, cafetería, venta de golosinas, comercio, tienda de barrio y venta de helados.
texts.en:
The "Estrellas de Sajama" community group encompasses fifteen people, fourteen women and a man. This is their 27th cycle. The president is Leonor. The group has been a part of the Cascada focal center since its beginning. Leonor, a 60 year-old partner, is a widow. She had ten children during her marriage. Currently she sells "rellenos" (a savory pastry made of mashed potatoes filled with onions, meat and boiled eggs). She learned her business out of necessities, through her mother who taught her when she was 15 years old. She joined Pro Mujer through a friend's invitation. The loan will serve as working capital. She will purchase wholesale merchandise from "La Riel" store in the Ceja market in the town of El Alto. She is a street vendor at the Ceja market. The president says that training and sharing with friends is what she likes best about Pro Mujer. The group has different types of services and commerce such as macrame weaving, sale of sodas, hardware, macrame, painting, book sales, sewing, coffee sales, sand washing (for construction), sales of bags, cafeteria, sale of refreshments, commerce, general store and ice cream sales.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials, cooking oil, potatoes

loans.name: Mame Bouye

texts.fr:
Madame Mame Bouye Cisse est une jeune dame de 33 ans qui habite dans le quartier de Dagoudane dans la localité de Yoff. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants  dont l’âge varie entre 2 et 14 ans.
Madame Cisse  a choisi d’exercer le commerce sous l’influence de sa sœur et surtout a cause de  l‘aspect lucratif de l’activité. Elle pratique la vente de languîmes, salade, tomates fraiches et  concombres depuis qu’elle a quitté l’école primaire. 
Elle est sociétaire a la caisse de Yoff depuis juin 2009.Elle n’a jamais bénéficié  de prêt a l’IMCEC. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs pour renforcer son fond et mieux développer  son commerce. Avec l’accroissement de ses bénéfices  elle souhaite améliorer  les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mame Bouye Cisse is a young woman, 33 years old, who lives in the Dagoudane district in the town of Yoff [north of downtown Dakar]. She is married and the mother of three children, between 2 and 14 years of age. She has chosen this line of business thanks to her sister’s influence, and mainly because it was paying well. Ever since dropping out of primary school, she has been selling vegetables, [such as] lettuce, fresh tomatoes and cucumbers. She has been member of the Yoff mutual fund since June 2009. She never had a loan from IMCEC before. She is seeking a loan of 200,000 West African francs to bolster her business capital and to grow her business. She hopes to increase her revenues in order to improve the life conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her business capital

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Doña Esperanza tiene la edad de 57 años, comerciante de ropa  de segunda mano, también vende helados, frijoles cocidos, logrando así vender más.
Su vida no ha sido fácil, pues han logrado hacer un techo junto  con su esposo, ya que su trabajo es de carpintero.
Con los financiamiento que Afodenic le ha brindado ha  logrado aumentar sus productos, y por ende lograr cubrir sus necesidades de gastos básicos.

Con este préstamo lo que desea hacer es un baño y la compra de un inodoro, ya que no cuenta con las aguas negras, y quiere estar en mejor higiene sanitaria.
Comprará doscientos bloques, un metro de arena, hierro y cemento para comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Doña Esperanza is 57 years old and is a secondhand clothes merchant. She also sells ice cream and cooked beans to earn more. Her life has not been easy, but she has managed to build a roof together with her husband because he works as a carpenter. With the loans Afodenic has given her, she has managed to increase her products and therefore managed to cover her basic expenses. With this loan she wants to build a bathroom and buy a toilet because she has no sewage disposal system, and she wants to have more sanitary conditions. She will buy two hundred blocks, a meter of sand, iron and cement to begin the project.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a toilet and building supplies to make a bathroom

loans.name: Issa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Issa S. habite à Yoff Mbenguene à Yoff. Il est âgé  de 48 ans. Il est marié et père de 2 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre un an et demi et 6 ans. 
Monsieur S. a choisi son métier  non pas par passion mais par nécessité. Depuis 20 ans il est cuisinier aéroportuaire. 
Monsieur S.  est membre de la caisse de Yoff depuis aout 2003.Il a déjà  remboursé 2 prêts antérieurs. Il sollicite un crédit  de 100 000 frs. L’objet de ce crédit  est de rembourser une dette de 40 000 frs qu’il avait contracte et l’autre partie de l’argent sera destinée à compléter  le budget de la maison.son but est d’améliorer  le cadre  de vie sociale de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Issa S. lives in Yoff Mbenguene in Yoff [north of downtown Dakar]. He is 48 years old. He is married and the father of two children, one of whom is a year and a half and the other six years of age. Mr. S. has chosen his profession out of necessity rather than calling. He has been working as an airport chef for 20 years. Mr. S. has been a member of the Yoff mutual fund since August 2003. He has already repaid two earlier loans. He is now seeking a loan of 100,000 West African Francs. The purpose l of this loan is to repay a debt of 40,000 which he has accumulated and to use the rest of the money for the family budget. His goal is to improve the socioeconomic conditions of his family.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: social needs

loans.name: Lida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER - CUSCO”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Lida; ella tiene 49 años de edad y La socia es madre soltera, ella estudió la superior completa y es profesional en la carrera de Contabilidad, ella trabaja como contadora pública de forma independiente, La socia es padre y madre para sus hijos, ella siempre ha trabajado y ha educado a sus hijos incluso ahora que están cruzando la superior , la socia en esta oportunidad solicita el préstamo para poder comprar unos muebles para su sala y de este modo mejorar su casa para que su casa se sienta mucho más acogedora.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite comprar unos bellos muebles que la socia se enamoro de este modo ella mejora la calidad de vida en su hogar, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “NUEVO AMANECER – CUSCO” (New daybreak – Cusco) communal bank. She lives in the Huanchac district in Cusco province and department. Lida is 49 years old and is a single mother. She completed university studies and has a career in accounting. She works as a independent public accountant. She is both father and mother to her children. She has always worked and educated her children even now when they are studying at the university. She is seeking a loan to be able to buy some furniture for her living room and in this way improve her home to be more comfortable. She is infinitely grateful for the loan as it enables her to buy some beautiful furniture as she really enjoys this style and wishes to improve the quality of life in her home. She promises to make her payments in the stipulated timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy furniture - home improvements

loans.name: Luz De Los Cachorros Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Luz de los Cachorros inicia su tercer ciclo con 12 socias.
Rosa es la presidenta del Banco Comunal, durante el tiempo que es socia aprendió a ser responsable y a ahorrar, Rosa es soltera y tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 4 estudian, Rosa tiene un restaurante en un local alquilado que esta ubicado cerca del Mercado Magdalena, actividad que realiza todos los días desde la mañana hasta la noche, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos, Rosa solicita un préstamo de 600 soles para la compra de arroz, azúcar, gaseosas.
Uno de los hijos de Rosa ingreso a la Universidad y su deseo es que culmine sus estudios, y que sus demás hijos sean profesionales, también mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Luz de los Cachorros” is starting its third loan cycle with 12 members.

Rosa is the Communal Bank President. Throughout her time as a member, she has learned how to be responsible and establish some savings. Rosa is single and has six children, four of whom are in school. She manages a restaurant from a rented location near the Magdalena Market. Rosa works every day from morning to night with the help of her children. She is requesting a loan of 600 PEN to buy rice, sugar, and sodas.

One of Rosa’s children is about to enter the university, so she hopes they will all be able to finish their studies. She would like to see them become professionals and also hopes to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, and sodas

loans.name: Rosa Alicia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER - CUSCO”; La socia vive en el distrito D. Huanchac en la provincia  y  departamento D. Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Rosa; ella tiene 60 años D. edad y es natural D. Abancay, la socia tiene 4 hijos, ella se dedica a trabajar D. forma independiente desD. su hogar, La socia modificó un espacio que da a la calle en sus casa y lo convirtió en un acogedor cafetín, ella apoya aún a sus hijos con los nietos pero a su vez desea seguir en actividad para no aburrirse en casa metida, ella es un mujer con una fuerza sumamente increíble, la socia prepara unos deliciosos postres y junto a ellos acompaña con chocolates, cafés, leches frescas y trotas. La socia solicita el préstamo para mejorar su cafetín y comprar insumos para su negocio.

La socia valora y agradece el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad D. vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “NUEVO AMANECER – CUSCO” (New Dawn – Cusco) communal bank. She lives in the Huanchac district in Cusco province and department. Rosa is 60 years old and is originally from Abancay. She has 4 children. She works independently from her home, where she modified a space in her home that opens to the street and she converted it to a small café. She still supports her children with her grandchildren but at the same time wishes to continue with her café so as not to become bored at home. She is a woman of incredible strength. She prepares delicious desserts and also chocolates, coffees, fresh beverages and snacks. Rosa seeks a loan to improve her café and buy supplies for her business. She is infinitely grateful for the loan as it enables her to grow her business and improve her quality of life. She promises to make her payments in the stipulated timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve her café and buy supplies for her business

loans.name: Benilda Sabina

texts.es:
Benilda cría ganado vacuno en la sierra peruana (San Juan D. Iris) comenzó a los 24 años junto a su esposo quien tenía experiencia en criar estos animales por su familia.
Compraban ganado D. engorD. que significa que no estaban muy bien alimentados y ellos lo hacen engordar con pasto D. la sierra, alimento balanceado para luego venderlo cuando están gorditos en el camal D. la ciudad. Había meses que tenían problemas D. carencia D. pasto en la sierra debido a la falta D. lluvias.
El primer crédito que recibió lo invirtió en comprar tres reces, la leche que producen estos animales las venden a los mercados así mismo aprovechan sobre todo para la elaboración D. quesos. Gastaban mucho antes en movilidad ya que la carne era ofrecida en los mercados D. la capital, actualmente esto ha cambiado se podría decir que son ellos los proveedores, tienen compradores fijos en la capital y éstos compradores los expenden a los mercados. Este negocio D. ganado sirvió para educar a sus hijos quienes son profesionales en la actualidad y ahora éstos apoyan a sus padres, es una alegría para Benilda y su esposo haber logrado ello, además mejoraron su casita. El préstamo que recibirán lo invertirán para comprar Ciclozona, un medicamento muy efectivo que ayuda a desparasitar, evita la infección, resfrío y fiebre en los animales vacunos cuando atraviesan las bajas temperaturas.
texts.en:
Benilda raises cattle in the Peruvian Sierra (San Juan D. Iris). She started when she was 24 along with her husband who had experience from his family in raising cattle. They bought cows to fatten up and that meant that the cows weren’t well-fed: they nourished them with grasses from the Sierra, and balanced food so that they could later sell them when they were fatter in the center of the city. Some months ago they had a problem with grass scarcity in the Sierra because of the lack of rain. The first loan that she received was to buy more dairy cows. The milk that the animals produce is sold in the markets where it is used especially to make cheese. In the past they wasted a lot because of having to transport the cattle to the markets in the capital. Currently this has changed since they are the producers; they have their regular customers in the capital and these buyers sell it in the markets. The cattle business served to educate their children who are today professionals and now they are able to support their parents. It is wonderful for Benilda and her husband to have succeeded and they have also improved their house. This loan will be used to buy Ciclozona, an effective medicine that helps debug the cows and also to avoid infection, colds and fevers when they travel into cooler temperatures.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy medicine for the cattle

loans.name: Danilo Jose

texts.es: El señor Danilo José tiene  49 años de edad, es casado y actualmente tiene dos hijos uno mayor de edad y la otra hija tiene 8 años de edad. El señor se dedica a la compra-venta de ropa usada y nueva, los cuales distribuyen de manera ambulante en los departamentos. El señor inicio este negocio desde hace 7 años ante la falta de empleo, este fue con el objetivo de tener un ingreso económico ya que tenía una familia que alimentar. Actualmente posee bastante clientela en el departamento. El está solicitando este crédito con el objetivo de invertir en compra de ropa y seguir trabajando, para de esta manera también quedar bien con el préstamo. Este préstamo mejorara sus ganancias ya que puede invertir más y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Sr. Danilo José is 49 years old, married, and has two children, one who is already an adult and an 8 year old daughter. He buys and sells both used and new clothing. Danilo sells his merchandise as a street merchant in various departments. He started this business seven years ago because he could not find employment. His goal was to have a source of financial income by which to feed his family. He currently has enough customers within the department.

Danilo is requesting a loan so that he can invest in the purchase of clothing, continue working, and remain in good condition. The loan will improve his earnings so that he can invest more into his business and have a better income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more clothing

loans.name: Velia Julia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER - CUSCO”; La socia vive en el distrito D. Huanchac en la provincia  y  departamento D. Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Julia; ella tiene 51 años D. edad y La socia es madre soltera, ella estudió la superior incompleta debido a la falta D. economía para seguir sus estudios, La socia tiene 2 hijos y  tenía un restaurante, ella brindaba desD. desayunos y almuerzos, La socia tiene una excelente sazón, razón por la cual ella llevó en el negocio cerca D. 10 años y poco a poco a construido su casita y educado a sus hijos, La socia ahora cambio D. rubro y transformó su restaurante en una tienda D. abarrotes, ella solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería y D. este modo abastecer su negocio.
 
La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad D. vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This borrwer belongs to the “NUEVO AMANECER - CUSCO” ["New Dawn - Cusco"] communal bank. She lives in the district of Huanchac, in the province and department of Cusco. Her name is Julia, and she is 51 years old and a single mother. She has an incomplete higher education, due to the lack of funds to continue her studies. She has 2 children, and she used to have a restaurant where she served breakfast and lunch. She is very good at seasoning food, which is why she ran the business for nearly 10 years, gradually constructing her home and educating her children. She has now changed her field and transformed her restaurant into a general store. She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise in order to stock her business. Julia infinitely values and appreciates the loan offered to her, since it will permit her to expand her business and improve her quality of life. Accordingly, she is committed to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stocking her general store

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
La señora Doris P., tiene la edad de 49 años vive en el Barrio La primavera, es casada y su esposo es jubilado, ellos tienen 3 hijos mayores de edad, que trabajan  y el menor de 18 años estudia  la universidad, la señora Doris tiene un comidería que reparte su venta en las horas de almuerzo a las empresas o casas particulares, tiene 16 años de laborar de esta manera.

Fue gracias al apoyo de su esposo que logro la apertura de este negocio, siendo el día de hoy el sustento más importante de sus vidas, a futuro espera tener los recursos necesarios para comprar unas mesas y sillas con el objetivo de poner un comedor de venta de comida, por ahora solicita un préstamo para la compra de frutas, verduras, carnes, en sí materia prima con el fin de tener un  inventario amplio y aprovechar la demanda de consumo que se acerca para las fiestas en celebración  de los patrones de la ciudad capital Managua, la recuperación del capital será inmediata por  las fechas que se aproximan permitiéndole mejores condiciones económicas para la inversión a su negocio que ha futuro traerá bienestar socio-económico a la familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Doris P. is 49 years old, lives in the La Primavera neighborhood, is married, and her husband is retired. They have 3 grown children who work; the youngest is 18 and studies in the university. Doris has a catering business where she serves meals over the lunch hours to businesses or private homes. She has done this for 16 years. Thanks to her husband’s support she was able to open this business which today is the most important source of income for them. In the future she hopes to have the necessary resources to buy some tables and charis with the objective of opening a dining room and selling food. So she is seeking a loan to buy fruit, vegetables, meats and ingredients in order to have a broad inventory and take advantage of the demand for food as the holidays are approaching in the city of Managua. The recuperation of the money will be immediate because the upcoming holidays provide the best economic conditions so that the investment will bring economic well-being to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruit, vegetables, meats and ingredients in order to have a broad inventory

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes de 51 años, vive en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil), ella tiene un puesto de desayunos en la calle de venta de batidos de frutas, panes etc. 

Antes de comenzar con su negocio ella fue a un seminario llamado “el divino niño” esto la incentivo para tener su propio negocio, comenzó haciendo desayunos para su vecinos, poco a poco pudo conseguir un puesto para vender al aire libre. Ahora trabaja todos los días vendiendo desayunos como batidos de frutas, panes, tostadas etc. 

El préstamo lo quiere utilizar para comprar frutas, leche, panes para tener mas variedad en sus desayunos. En el futuro quiere tener su propio local en el centro de Duran.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 51 years old and lives in Primavera de Duran (a periurban area outside of Guayaquil that has a deteriorating ecosystem). She has a breakfast stand on the street where she sells fruit smoothies, baked goods, and other items.

Prior to starting her business, Mercedes attended seminary at “El Divino Niño” (The Divine Child). Afterwards she was motivated to have her own business, so she began selling breakfasts to her neighbors. Little by little, she was able earn enough to acquire a stand so that she could sell outdoors. Now she works every day selling breakfast items such as fruit smoothies, baked goods, toast, and other foods.

This loan will be used to buy fruits, milk, and baked goods so that she will have more variety to offer for breakfast. In the future, Mercedes wants to have her on shop in the center of Duran.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits, milk, and baked goods

loans.name: Ermitaña

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER - CUSCO”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Ermitaña; ella tiene 46 años de edad y La socia es natural del distrito de Quillabamba, la socia es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos, ella se dedica al comercio minorista, la socia  elabora helados artesanales al por mayor y desde hace 2 años atrás vende a domicilio yogurt, La socia es conocida en su barrio y tiene mucha clientela, pero aún así ella sale a buscar siempre mayor número de clientes en otros barrios, ella desea un día tener su propia heladería y cafetín, La socia está trabajando para insistir en su sueño y que este se haga realidad. La socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar ingredientes para realizar, sus helados y su yogurt.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “NUEVO AMANECER - CUSCO” ["New Dawn - Cusco"] communal bank. She lives in the district of Huanchac, in the province and department of Cusco. Her name is Ermitaña, and she is 46 years old. She comes from the district of Quillabamba, and she is a single mother with 2 children. She is in the retail trade. She prepares artisanal ice cream to sell wholesale, and for the past 2 years, she has sold yogurt for home delivery. She is well-known in her neighborhood and has many customers, but even so she is always going out to look for more customers in other neighborhoods. She hopes one day to have her own ice cream shop and small café. Ermitaña is working hard to stay with her dream and make it a reality. She is requesting the loan so that she can buy ingredients to prepare her ice cream and yogurt. Ermitaña infinitely values and appreciates the loan offered to her, since it will allow her to expand her business and improve her quality of life. Accordingly, she is committed to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying ingredients to make ice cream and yogurt

loans.name: Flora Del Socorro

texts.es:
Flora es una mujer trabajadora de 49 años de edad, gracias a su empeño y trabajo como pequeña comerciante, ha logrado a poyar a su familia.
Su negocio es la venta de tortilla, frijoles cocidos que día a día palmea para lograr vender los tres tiempos.
Pues cuando inicio lo hizo con un quintal de maíz, dinero poco que dio su esposo, dinero que trabaja como cadete de taxi.
Se gana poco, pero con este dinero logra poder pagar gastos básicos, gastos alimenticios y se equilibrar con los gastos con su esposo.

Con este financiamiento lograra comprar varios quintales de maíz para poder aumentar la venta de tortilla a si como leña, bolsas, pana entre otros para seguir aumentando sus ventas.
Que esta logrando por medio de Afodenic
texts.en:
Flor is a hard working, 49 year old woman. Thanks to her determination and work as a small businesswoman, she has been able to support her family. Her business is selling tortillas and cooked beans, which she makes every day, to sell three times per day. She began her business with a quintal (1 quintal = 46kg) of corn, a little bit of money from her husband, a taxi driver. She earned little, but with this money she was able to pay her basic expenses, food, and share paying the bills with her husband. With this financing she will be able to buy several quintales of corn to be able to increase her tortilla sales as well as firewood, bags, cloths, and more in order to continue increasing her sales. She is achieving this with the help from Afodenic.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy several quintales of corn to be able to increase her tortilla sales as well as firewood, bags, cloths, and more

loans.name: Luchando Por Un Sueño ["fighting For A Dream"] Group

texts.es:
Grupo conformado por siete personas seis mujeres y un varón todos ellos muy entusiastas por ello el nombre el sueño es salir adelante cada uno D. ellos con su propio negocio y dar lo mejor a los suyos.

Tal es el caso D. Sonia quien venD. en L. mañanas verduras y tubérculos (espinaca, papa, zanahoria, arveja, choclo, limón, lechuga u otros) en una calle muy conocida y transitada, nos cuenta que desD. niña acompañaba a su padre a vender estas verduras en un mercado, no le agradaba mucho esta idea tenía un poco D. vergüenza; pero esta idea cambió cuando sufre L. separación con su ex pareja debido a ello tuvo que trabajar por su niñita pequeña aún; esto lo hacía soL. porque su papa fallece y esto L. hizo tomar esta decisión D. seguir trabajando como le enseñó su padre. 

No era fácil en un principio porque no había muchos compradores y a veces L. mercadería se malograba en el camino debido a las huelgas nacionales o deslizamiento D. tierra y barro en L. zona (alud) y había pérdida D. mercadería que traía D. L. sierra hasta L. ciudad se malograba, pese a ello persistió y siguió trabajando mucho hasta hacerse conocida en el barrio donD. venD. esto le ayudó a mantener a su madre e hija a quien le da lo mejor para su educación, compró un pequeño terreno en un asentamiento humano que va empezar a construir más adelante, por el momento ha plantado una casita D. madera. Tener un puesto propio en una D. sus metas muy lejanas que espera alcanzar con los ingresos D. este trabajo, necesita seguir invirtiendo en este negocio para lograr uno D. sus objetivos para ello requiere del préstamo.
texts.en:
This group is maD. up of seven people, six women and one man. All of them are very enthusiastic. For them, the name of the dream is getting ahead in the businesses they run and doing their best for their loved ones. This is the case with Sonia, who sells vegetables and root crops in the mornings (spinach, potatoes, carrots, peas, corn, limes, lettuce and others) on a well-known and busy street. She tells us that since she was a girl, she accompanied her father when he sold these vegetables at a market. She didn't like this idea very much because she was a bit shy, but her attituD. changed when she went through a separation from her former partner, and due to this, she had to work for the sake of her daughter who was still very young. She did this alone, because her father had died, and this led her to the decision to work as her father had taught her. It was not easy at first, because there were not many buyers, and sometimes the merchandise was ruined because of the national strikes or landslides and mudslides (avalanches) in the area, so that the products she carried from the mountains to the cities were spoiled. However, she persisted and kept working hard until she became well-known in the neighborhood where she sells her products. This has helped her to support her mother and her daughter, whom she tries to give the best education possible. She has bought a small plot of land in a settlement that will soon be constructed. For the moment, she has set up a small wooden house. Having a sales stand of her own is one of her distant goals, which she hopes to achieve with the income from this work. She needs to keep investing in this business to achieve her goals, and it is for this reason that she needs the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying vegetables and root crops

loans.name: Nancy Karina

texts.es: Nancy, tiene 31 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos y una casa propia. Ella y su esposo se han dedicado a la venta y servicio de materiales electricos, el negocio esta situado en otro municipio retirado de su vivienda, tienen una amplia experiencia en el negocio ya que tienen 10 años de laborar en ella. Nancy atiende el negocio con su calido trato y logra el retorno de sus clientes. Por ello esta en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito ya que su negocio tiene mucha demanda y necesita comprar material para darles un mejor servicio y poder tneer mas ganacias. El sueño de Nancyes darle una mejor vivida y educación a sus hijos, y sabe que lo puede conseguir luchando cada día y trabajando.
texts.en:
Nancy is 31 years old, has two children, and lives in her own home. She and her husband sell and service electrical equipment. Their business is located in another town away from their home. Nancy and her husband have ten years of experience running their business. She is in charge of the day-to-day management and warmly welcoming her customers, which encourages them to return.

Nancy is requesting a loan because her business is in great demand. She needs to buy materials so that she can provide the best service and generate the most revenue. Her dream is to provide her children with an education and a better life. She knows that she has to continue struggling and working each day.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of electrical supplies

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER - CUSCO”; El socio vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
El socio es el Sr. Pablo; el socio  tiene 65 años de edad y El socio es natural de Arequipa el socio es casado y tienen 4 hijos, él estudió mecánica y hoy en día se dedica a la tapicería, el socio recubre todos tipo de asientos para autos en general, él trabaja en este negocio desde el año 2000, El socio tiene una tapicería y junto a su esposa se dedican a este negocio y el socio le ha enseñado a su esposa el trabajo, él dice que con este negocio el está terminando de construir su casita y mejorar su calidad de vida, también este negocio les permite dar a sus hijos una muy buena educación y bienestar. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales y telas para tener en su taller.

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "Nuevo Amanecer - Cusco" (New Dawn - Cusco) communal bank. He lives in Huanchac District, in Cusco Province and Department. The member is Pablo; he is 65 years old and is a native of Arequipa. He is married and has four children. He studied mechanics and currently works in upholstery. Pablo recovers all types of seats for cars in general. He has worked in this business since the year 2000. He has an upholstery shop and works together with his wife, and he has taught her the job. Pablo says that with this business he is finishing construction on his house and improving his quality of life. This business also allows him to give his children a very good education and welfare. He is asking for the loan to buy materials and fabrics to have in his workshop. Pablo infinitely values and appreciates the loan granted to him because it allows him to expand his business and improve his quality of life. He also promises to make his payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase upholstery materials

loans.name: Xiomara Del Carmen

texts.es:
Xiomara es una mujer de 53 años de edad, comerciante de una pequeña pulpería que ha venido invirtiendo con dinero propio de su salario como maestra.
Pues ha logrado mantener estable su negocio, solo que abecés no tiene el capital para seguir invirtiendo.
Es por eso nace la iniciativa de adquirir un financiamiento que logre las expectativa de aumentar en inventario, logrando a si ventas altas.
Con este préstamo invertirá en granos básicos, que es el alimento principal, lácteos, carne, golosinas, gaseosas, entre otros. 
Sus planes es jubilarse, y dedicarse tiempo completo a su negocio.
texts.en:
Xiomara is a 53-year-old woman. She is the businesswoman of a small grocery store in which she invested with the money that she earned herself as a teacher.

She has been able to keep her business stable, but at times she does not have the money to continue investing.

This is how the initiative came about to obtain funding to achieve the hope of expanding her inventory and thus having high sales.

With this loan she will invest in basic grains, which is part of the main diet, dairy products, meat, sweets, and sodas among other things.

Her plan is to retire and dedicate herself full-time to her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic grains, dairy products, meat, sweets, sodas and other items to be able to increase sales.

loans.name: Ana Yensi

texts.es: La señora Ana Yensi G. L., tiene 24 años es  casada  y su esposo se dedica al comercio, ellos habitan en una casa humilde en el Barrio San Pedro, ellos son una pareja de recién casados que han comenzado sus días a labrarse su porvenir, así mismo como el de su futuro hijo que viene en camino, es para su hogar que solicitan un préstamo para la compra de  materiales de construcción tale como cemento, laminas de zinc, bloques, con este material edificaran un muro trasero que les brindara una mejor seguridad por las lluvias que caen en este invierno y los proximos, asi como tranquilidad de la familia de brindarles comodidad a toda su pequeña familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana Yensi G. L. is 24 years old and married. Her husband works as a merchant. They live in a modest house in the San Pedro neighborhood. This couple is recently married and has started to carve out their future. In addition, they are expecting a child.

Ana is requesting a housing loan to buy construction materials such as cement, sheets of zinc, blocks, and other materials to build a rear wall that will provide them better protection from the rain during this winter season and in the future. This will give her peace of mind as she tries to provide every comfort for her young family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to build a wall at the back of her house

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER - CUSCO”; El socio vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
El socio es el Sr. Rolando; el socio tiene 46 años de edad y el es padre soltero, el socio es separado tiene 3 hijos, El socio alterna su labor de papá con el comercio de compra y venta de automóviles, el socio se dedica a comprar de la frontera de Perú autos de segunda y los trae hasta la ciudad del Cusco y aquí los vende, el es socio de Arariwa desde hace 7 años y le gusta reunirse con sus amigos aquí y compartir las reuniones y el intercambio de experiencias, él socio ahorra dinero y suele sacar de diferentes financieras para poder aumentar a su capital de la venta de los autos y viajar a comprar otro. Él socio también tiene una flota de vehículos dedicados a prestar el servicio de taxis. El socio solicita el préstamo para aumentar a su capital y viajar a traer autos para la importación de vehículos.

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Rolando is a member of the Communal Bank “Nuevo Amancer – Cusco” (New Dawn – Cusco). He lives in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

Sr. Rolando is a 46 year old single father. He is separated from his spouse and has three children. Rolando divides his time between being a father and running his business buying and selling automobiles. He buys secondhand cars near the Peruvian border and brings them back to Cusco to sell. Rolando has been a member of Asociación Arariwa for seven years and enjoys attending the meetings, where he gets to gather with his friends and share their experiences. He has used a number of loans to increase his capital for his auto sales business and to pay for his travel expenses when acquiring inventory. In addition, he owns a fleet of vehicles used for providing taxi services. The loan he is requesting will be used to increase his capital so that he can travel and bring back more imported vehicles.

Rolando values and greatly appreciates the loan that has been provided since it will allow him to increase his business and improve his quality of life. Therefore, he promises to complete his payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase his operating capital for buying secondhand cars to sell & pay for travel expenses

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elsa Emerita

texts.es: Elsa Emerita tiene 54 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos ya mayores de edad. Su actividad es la de mercadería en general. Inicio a este negocio hace 26 años, sin embargo ya tenía 2 años de estar vendiendo de forma ambulante cuando logro establecer su negocio en el mercado. Pues esta no es la primera vez que solicita financiamientos en Fundación, ya que ha sido un gran aporte para su negocio. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de calzado, perfumes, cosméticos, cremas y tratamientos. Por lo que sueña con mantener este negocio activo.
texts.en:
Elsa Emerita is a 54 year old single mother with two adult children. She has been selling general merchandise for 26 years. The first two years, she had to work as a street vendor before acquiring a business space at the market. This is not the first time Elsa has applied to Fundación Leon 2000 for a loan, which has been a great help to her business.

The proceeds from the loan will be invested in the purchase of shoes, perfumes, cosmetics, crèmes, and treatments. Her wish is to keep her business active.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoes, perfumes, cosmetics, crèmes, and treatments

loans.name: Las Prosperas De Carabayllo Group

texts.es:
LA SRA MICAELA JADE TIENE 29 AÑOS DE EDAD, TIENE CUATRO HIJOS PEQUEÑOS. ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO "LAS PRÓSPERAS DE CARABAYLLO", INTEGRADO POR 8 PERSONAS RESIDENTES DEL DISTRITO DE CARABAYLLO. SUS COMPAÑEROS LA ELIGIERON PRESIDENTA DE LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA DEL GRUPO.

LA SRA. MICAELA JADE SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE MAZAMORRA Y COMIDA; TODAS LAS TARDES SE UBICA EN LA PUERTA DE SU CASA CON SUS MESITAS Y ASÍ EMPIEZA A TRABAJAR. EMPEZÓ VENDIENDO UN POCO DE MAZAMORRA Y FUÉ SU MAMÁ QUIEN LA ANIMÓ. MOTIVÁNDOLA DE QUE DEBÍA TENER UN INGRESO EXTRA PARA APOYAR CON LOS GASTOS DE LA CASA, HACE UN AÑO HA INCREMENTADO EL NEGOCIO Y AHORA VENDE COMIDAS.

CON SU TRABAJO PUEDE APOYAR A SU PAREEJA CON LOS GASTOS FAMILIARES ASÍ COMO GASTOS DEL COLEGIO DE SUS HIJOS.

SU PROXIMA META ES PONER UNA BODEGA MUY SURTIDA, CONSIDERA QUE SI SIGUE TRABAJANDO MUY DURO ES UNA META QUE NO DEMORARÁ MUCHO EN LOGRAR.

EL PRÉSTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA Y COLOCACIÓN DE UN TOLDO QUE CUBRA EL ESPACIO DONDE SIRVE LA COMIDA Y MAZAMORRAS, ASÍ TAMBIÉN UNA PARTE LA DESTINARÁ A LA COMPRA DE MESAS Y SILLAS PARA PODER ATENDER A SUS CLIENTES Y SE SIENTAN MAS CÓMODOS AL DEGUSTAR LOS EXQUISITOS POTAJES QUE ELLA PREPARA.
texts.en:
Sra. Micaela Jade is 29 years old and has four small children. She is part of the group “Las Prósperas de Carabayllo”, which consists of eight individuals who reside in the district of Carabayllo. Her fellow members elected her to be President of the group’s Board of Directors.

Sra. Micaela Jade sells “mazamorra” (corn porridge) and food every afternoon on the doorstep of her house where she has small tables set up for her business. She began selling porridge after her mother convinced her that she needed to earn extra income to help with the household expenses. Over the past year, she has increased her business and now sells other foods.

Through her work, she has been able to assist her husband with the family expenses and her children’s school expenses. Her new goal is to open a well-stocked grocery store. Micaela plans to continue working very hard, so she believes it will not take her long to achieve this goal.

The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase and install a canopy to cover the space where she serves food and porridge. Part of the money will be used to buy tables and chairs so that her customers can be more comfortable while enjoying the tasty food that she prepares.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables, chairs, and a canopy for the space used in operating a food business

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es: Maria es casa con Jose tiene 2 hijos los cuales aun son D. edad escolar. doña Maria venD. D. casa en casa Ropa tipica y en sus tiempos libres borda Servilletas y también las venD.. Ella solicita el crédito para poder comprar mas mercaderia para poder ofrecerles a sus clientas mas variedad. Ella sueña con tener su propio local y asi tener mas variedad y mas clientela.
texts.en:
Maria is married to Jose. They have two children who are of school age. Doña Maria sell traditional clothing door to door. In her spare time, she makes embroidered napkins that she also sells.

She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise so that she can offer her customers more variety. Her dream is to have her own store where she can maintain a wider inventory and accommodate more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more clothing

loans.name: Ninoska Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora Ninoska, desde hace 10 años, ella tiene 23 años de edad, es casada y tiene 1 hijo de siete años de edad. La señora se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, negocio que tiene ya 4 años de desempeñarse a esta actividad. este negocio empezó primeramente como una necesidad de obtener mejores ingresos ya que el salario de su compañero de vida no llenaba la necesidad familiar, por lo que decidió ayudarle a su esposo dedicándose a la venta de ropa. Luego ella noto que el negocio era rentable, por lo que ha continuado siempre con el mismo. El crédito será invertido en la compra de ropa nueva. Algo que ha afectado últimamente es la oferta de mercadería de otras personas ya que el mercado cada vez se hace más pequeño. Sin embargo ella tiene como desafío continuar con el negocio. Su sueño es comprar un tramo en el mercado.
texts.en:
Sra. Ninoska is 23 years old, married, and has a seven year old child. She has been selling new clothing for the past four years. Ninoska began her business primarily because she needed more income since her husband’s salary did not meet the needs of their family. At that point, she decided to help her husband by selling clothing. Later she noticed that this business was profitable so she continued doing the same things.

This loan will be used to buy new clothing. Something that has affected her lately is an increase in the supply of merchandise from other merchants while the market for these products is getting smaller. Despite that challenge, she continues with her business. Her dream is to acquire a vending space at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase new clothing

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes inició como microempresaria a L. edad D. 35 años, fue sus hijos que L. motivó a trabajar D. esta manera, el sueldo D. su esposo ya no alcanzaba para mantener a todos y cada vez L. necesidad era más sobre todo cuando se enfermaban sus hijos pequeños y no contaban con un seguro. Se las ingeniaba para preparar jugos D. frutas y golosinas en un pequeño kiosco bastante usado que adquirió.
Sus ventas eran regulares al comienzo fue mejorando con el tiempo, haciéndose conocida por personas que hasta L. fecha son clientes fijos.
Los ingresos le permitieron aumentar mercadería a su negocio como: papel higiénico, detergentes, más golosinas, gaseosas surtiéndolo D. a poquito su kiosco. Este trabajo ayudó mucho en L. educación a sus hijos quienes son profesionales en L. actualidad; así también vendió su kiosco viejo y adquirió uno nuevo, mejoró su casa. Espera lograr más adelante tener su propia bodega en un lugar céntrico como Chosica, que es una ciudad muy comercial. Este préstamo será para comprar gaseosas y piqueos.
texts.en:
At the age of 35, Mercedes became a small businesswoman because of her children. Her husband’s salary is not enough to support them all. Since they do not have insurance, they are in great need whenever her small children get sick. Mercedes prepares juices and sweets from a small kiosk that has been put to great use since acquiring it.

Since the beginning, she has generated regular sales that have improved over time. She has become fairly known among all of her established customers to date. Her earnings enabled her to expand her inventory of merchandise to incluD. toilet paper, detergents, candy, and sodas that she keeps on hand in her small kiosk. She also was able to sell her old kiosk, acquire a new one, and make improvements to her house. Mercedes hopes to get ahead even further by opening a grocery store in a centralized area such as Chosica, a city that has plenty of business activity. Her loan will be used to buy sodas and snacks.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sodas & snacks

loans.name: Irma Carolina

texts.es: Doña Irma tiene 32 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, y tiene casa propia. Ella tiene un café internet en su domicilio, ella es una mujer luchadora y entregada al servicio de sus clientes, con la ayuda de su esposo ella tuvo la idea de poner su propio negocio hace 5 años y su grna seuño es brindarles una mejor educación a sus hijos. Irma tiene que recurri a un crédito ya que necesita incrementar su negocio y poder comprar mas computadoras e impresoras es por ello necesita más capital .
texts.en:
Doña Irma is 32 years old, married, has three children, and lives in her own house. She operates an Internet café at home. Irma is a determined woman who seeks to provide service to her customers. She came up with the idea for this business five years ago and her husband helped her with getting it started. Her greatest wish is to provide her children with a better education.

Irma has returned to request a loan because she needs to expand her business. She seeks the necessary capital to buy more computers and printers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional computers & printers

loans.name: Maritza Magda

texts.es:
Maritza es madre de familia de cuatro hijos, comerciante ambulante pues tiene once años de haber establecido su pequeño negocio, con el cual ha logrado ayudar a su familia.
Sus productos que vende son anteojos  y accesorios de celulares, el cual se ubica en una plaza de centro en donde hay varios negocios y transita mucha gente.
Gracias a su tenacidad y apoyo que Afodenic esta dando mediante el financiamiento, se ha hecho posible el aumento de la inversión ya que ha logrado aumentar la variedad de lentes.

Con este préstamo comprara doscientas gafas para dama y caballeros, cien controles, estuche de celulares, y gafas para niños, todo esto lo compra a proveedores en el mercado oriental que le sale a buen precio, logrando darle un precio mejor al cliente, y obteniendo mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Maritza is a mother of four children and a street vendor. She established her small business eleven years ago, and it has allowed her to help her family. She sells sun glasses and cell phone accessories. She sells her products in a town square where there are several shops and lots of people pass by. Thanks to her tenacity and the support that Afodenic is giving her with the loan, she has been able to increase her investment in her business and offer a greater variety of sun glasses for sale. With this loan, she will purchase two-hundred women's and men's sun glasses and one-hundred remote controls, cell phone cases and children's sun glasses. She buys all these items from purveyors in the eastern market, where she gets good prices. This enables her to offer better prices to her customers, which gives her a better profit.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will invest in men's and women's sun lasses, cell phone accessories and remote controls for TVs, enabling her to increase her sales

loans.name: Amigas Unidas Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formó en el Barrio San Lorenzo de la Ciudad de Caaguazú son 17 mujeres que se reunieron con el fin  de formar un grupo solidario en donde la responsabilidad es  conjunta. Ellas son independientes en sus labores como: vendedoras de ropas,venta de zapatos, venta de comidas, modista, tienen despensa, venta de frutas y verduras, etc. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Maria, quien es una mujer luchadora y muy activa, trabaja mucho para mantener unido a su grupo, realizando actividades de integración y tambien para recaudar fondos.
Ella tiene un negocio en su casa donde ofrece articulos de usos del hogar, cuentan con buena cantidad de clientes. 
Su marido trabaja y tambien la ayuda en su negocio y todos sus hijos se encuentran estudiando, es una familia muy unida y trabajadora.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de articulos varios para su negocio como azucar, harina, fideos, aceites, carbón y otros.
texts.en:
This committee was established in the neighborhood of San Lorenzo in the city of Caaguazú. The group consists of 17 women who gathered to form a solidarity group in which they share joint responsibility. They work independently in their own businesses selling clothing, shoes, food, handmade clothing, groceries, fruits, vegetables, and other products.

One of the members is Sra. María. She is a determined and active woman who has worked hard to maintain unity in her group by organizing teambuilding and fundraising activities. María has a business in her home where she offers household goods to her many customers. Her husband works and helps with the business while all of her children attend school. They are a united and hardworking family.

María is requesting a loan to buy various products for her business such as sugar, flour, noodles, oil, charcoal, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, flour, noodles, oil, charcoal, and other items

loans.name: Ines Epifania

texts.es:
Inés de 62 años, vive en el Suburbio de Guayaquil(zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales), ella vende productos Yambal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes).

Realiza su trabajo sola para poder ayudar con los gastos familiares ya que su esposo es albañil y no tienen muchos ingresos, trabaja desde muy temprano ofreciendo los productos a sus vecinos y amigos, vende perfumes, cremas, desodorantes, ropa. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos Yambal como perfumes, cremas, desodorantes. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y darle una buena a su hijo.
texts.en:
Inés is 62 years old and lives in Suburbio de Guayaquil (an urban area where most of the residents are informal merchants). She sells products manufactured by Yambal, a company that offers women entrepreneurs the opportunity to start their own independent sales businesses.

Inés works alone so that she can help with the family expenses. Her husband works as a mason and does not earn much money. She begins her work early offering products to her neighbors and friends. Inés sells perfumes, crèmes, deodorants, and clothing.

With this loan she plans to buy more Yambal products such as perfumes, crèmes, and deodorants. In the future, Inés wants to finish the construction of her house and provide good things for her child.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase perfumes, crèmes, and deodorants

loans.name: Isidra Francisca

texts.es:
Isidra de 44 años, vive en el Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y las casas están ubicadas en montañas), ella vende ropa desde hace años para poder ayudar con los gastos de su casa. 

Realiza su trabajo sola desde muy temprano,  ayuda con los gastos familiares ya que su esposo es albañil y no tienen muchos ingresos, vende blusas, camisas, pantalones etc. No tiene horario fijo porque sus ventas las hacen por pedido. 

Ella quiere el préstamo para poder comprar ropa y con las ganancias asegurar su vejez. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa, y poder readecuarla.
texts.en:
Isidra is 44 years old. She lives in El Paraíso de Guayaquil (a suburban area, with dirt roads and houses on the mountainside). She has been selling clothes for years to help with the household expenses. She does her work alone, starting very early. She helps with the family expenses a lot because her husband is a bricklayer and doesn't make a lot of income. She sells blouses, pants, etc. She doesn't have a set schedule because she sells to order. She wants the loan to be able to buy clothes and with the earnings save for her old age. In the future, she wants to finish building her house and remodel it.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La Sra. Ana María se dedica a la venta de verduras en las ferias de la zona sur , cliente que es bastante responsable con sus obligaciones así lo demostró todo este tiempo , también podemos indicar que la cliente es muy trabajadora ya que este ultimo tiempo mostro crecimiento en su actividad con la que sostiene a su hogar conformado por 4 integrantes y es la única que percibe ingresos en su hogar y por lo tanto la única que mantiene a su familia, por todo lo mencionado se le dio la tasa kiva, con el dinero del crédito comprara mercadería como cebolla por quintales, zanahoria, yuca, haba, espinaca, etc. Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindad en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Ana María sells vegetables at markets in the south and is constantly demonstrating how responsible she is. She is also very hardworking and has already seen her business grow, which allows her to support her 4-person household. She is the only family member with an income, and thus its sole provider. Because of her work she was awarded a Kiva loan. She will use the loan to buy merchandise such as onions, carrots, yucca, haba (type of bean), spinach, etc. She is grateful to Emprender (Kiva Field Partner) and Kiva for giving her the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Fausto

texts.es: El Sr. Fausto tiene el rubro de plomero independiente,  su trabajo lo realiza por toda la zona sur y es muy conocido por su buen trabajo y responsabilidad , con la actividad que realiza mantiene su hogar ya asume todos los gastos ya que es el único que tiene ingresos ya que la esposa no trabaja y los hijos estudian por todo lo mencionado don fausto califica para tasa Kiva, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara para la compra de una computadora para su hijos ya que la necesitan para que les ayude en sus estudios, esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza en la otorgación del credito.
texts.en:
Mr. Fausto works as an independent plumber; he works in the entire southern zone and is well known because of his quality work and responsibility.
