With his work, he supports his home and assumes all household expenses since he is the only one with an income; his wife does not work and the children go to school. For all these reasons, Mr. Fausto qualifies for a Kiva loan; the money from the loan will be used to buy a computer for his children since they need it to help them with their schoolwork. He is very grateful with Emprender and Kiva for the trust and the granting of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a computer

loans.name: Catalino Albelino

texts.es: Catalino tiene 44 años su actividad económica es una pulpería. El es un hombre muy responsable y que disfruta de su negocio. Hace más de 7 años que tiene este negocio por lo que siempre está buscando la manera de diversificar su actividad, para que sus clientes siempre asistan a su vivienda pues siempre está buscando la forma. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como golosinas, refrescos, jugos, galletas y granos básicos. El deseo de Catalino es tener su propio medio de transporte para trasladar sus cosas.
texts.en:
Catalino is 44 years old and runs a store from his home for a living. He is a very responsible man and enjoys his business. He has had his store for more than 7 years and is always looking for ways to diversify to keep his customers coming. He will use the loan to buy candy, soft drinks, juice, cookies and basic grains. Catalino would like to one day have is own means of transportation in order to move his things.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase candy, soft drinks, juice, cookies and basic grains for his store

loans.name: Bolivia

texts.es: La Sra. Bolivia esta casada con el señor Pedro, ellos tienen tres hijas de las cuales dos asisten a primaria, la Sra Bolivia se dedica a la venta de comida y su esposo trabaja como chofer de micro de la línea 86, ellos se levantan muy temprano para atender a su familia y luego comenzar a trabajar, la Sra Bolivia esta vendiendo salchipapas, hamburguesas y pollo frito todos los días por las noches de 18:00 a 23:00, durante el día ella se dedica realizar sus compras necesarias para su negocio y luego a ayudar a sus hijas con las tareas del colegio. El crédito que ella necesita es para comenzar la construcción de un cuarto en un lote que compraron gracias al esfuerzo de su trabajo y el de su esposo, actualmente ellos viven en anticrético. Ella se caracteriza por ser persona responsable y muy trabajadora, es cliente antigua de Emprender y es por ello que es la segunda vez que accede a un credito KIVA.
texts.en:
Bolivia is married to Pedro. They have three daughters, and two of them go to elementary school. Bolivia sells food, and her husband drives a small bus on route 86. They get up very early to see to their family, and then they start to work. Bolivia sells “salchipapas” (flatbread stuffed with meat, cheese, or vegetables), hamburgers, and fried chicken every evening from 6:00 until 11:00. During the day she shops for the things she needs for her business. Then, she helps her daughters with their homework from school. She needs the loan to start building a room on a lot. She and her husband bought the lot thanks to their work efforts. They currently live in “anticrédico” (a special type of rental arrangement in Bolivia). She is a responsible and very hard-working person. She has been a client with Emprender for a long time. This is the second time that she has accessed a loan from Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
La señora Eusebia Olmeddo es una señora que se dedica a la venta de pezcado, posee un pequeño puesto en donde concurren varías personas cada día, es así que  ella decidio formar un pequeño comité de mujeres emprendedoras con sus vecinas de la cuadra, invito a las más responsables, y actualmente se encuentran con muchas ganas de seguir adelante en sus trabajos diarios, son 17 señoras independientes en su trabajos, que recibiran un capacitaciones de acuerdo al ciclo donde se encuentran. 
Las mismas desean contar siempre con el apoyo crediticio de la Fundación Paraguaya, que les ayuda muchisimo para el emprendimiento de cada una de  ellas en las actividades que realizan.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de pezcado.
texts.en:
Eusebia Olmeddo sells fish. She has a small stand, which various people frequent everyday. She decided to form a small group of enterprising women with her neighbors on the block. She invited the most responsible people. They now have a great desire to get ahead in their daily work. There are 17 women in the group, and they work independently. They will get trainings according to the cycle they are in. They want to always count on the loan support from the Fundación Paraguaya. It helps them so much in each one of their endeavors. She is requesting the loan to buy fish.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fish

loans.name: Mauricio Josue

texts.es: El señor Mauricio José es casado y tiene 3 hijos los cuales son menores de edad. El señor posee su negocio que es la venta de mercadería en general. Los cuales luego sale a distribuir a pie y también ofrece en su vivienda. Don Mauricio dio inicio a su negocio hace 6 años, cabe señalar que este negocio fue por su esposa, ya que ella tuvo la idea de mejorar los ingresos de su hogar. El crédito será invertido en la compra de materias prima para su negocio. Su meta principal es tener una tienda en donde pueda ofrecer sus productos.
texts.en:
Mauricio José is married and has three young children. He sells general merchandise which he sells on foot as well as from his home. Mauricio has been in this business for 6 years and it should be noted that he started this business because of his wife who suggested the idea in order to increase the household income. The loan will be used for the purchase of raw materials for his business. His main goal is to have a store where he can sell his products.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Investing in her business

loans.name: Risueñas De Calimaya Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama “RISUEÑAS DE CALIMAYA” y esta formado por 11 integrantes y dentro de ellas esta la señora Teresa S.C. doña “Tere” para los vecinos y nos cuenta que su crédito lo invertirá en la compra de maíz para la elaboración de tortillas, también nos platica que desde que era niña su mama le enseñó a hacer las tortillas a mano ya que a la edad de los 11 años, se tuvo que encargar de realizarlas para el consumo de la familia ya que su papá enfermó y ya no la pudo apoyar para que siguiera estudiando. Ahora la señora “Tere” lucha día a día en su negocio para apoyar a sus dos hijos que estudian el bachillerato, ya que ella quiere darles la oportunidad que ella no tuvo, y así puedan estudiar una carrera y triunfar en la vida.

   En este mismo grupo se encuentra la señora María de la Luz R.G. que cuenta con un taller de costura, la señora comenta que durante 13 años trabajo para otras personas y su mayor anhelo era tener su propio taller la primer maquina la obtuvo en un apoyo del gobierno, la segunda se la gano en una rifa que se llevo acabo en la iglesia de la comunidad, y la tercera es una ver de 5 hilos que la compro. Y el crédito lo destinará para comprar telas y poder hacer pans, la señora comenta que su negocio ha sido un millón de esfuerzos y dedicación ya que ha sido su fuente de ingresos en la actualidad, y con esto aporta a los gastos de la casa ya que con lo que gana su marido no es suficiente.


Los otros integrantes del grupo son:
PRESIDENTA: 
Rosa María V.R. 
TESORERA: 
Beatriz Adriana R.S.
INTEGRANTES: 
Aida R.R.
Teresa S.C.
Adriana E.G.
Laura R.C.
Maricela R.C.
Nayely J.A.
María de la Luz R.
Noelia H.R.
texts.en:
This group is named “Risueñas de Calimaya” (Cheerful Ones from Calilmaya). It is comprised of 11 members. Teresa S.C., “Tere” to her neighbors, tells us the she will use the loan to buy corn to make tortillas. She also says that her mother taught her to make tortillas by hand when she was very young. When she was 11 years old she had to make them for her family. When her father got sick he could not pay for her to continue in school. Tere struggles day to day in her business. She does this to support her two children who are in high school. She wants to give them the opportunity that she did not have. That way they will be able to study for a career and triumph in life. María de la Luz R.G. has a seamstress shop. She tells us that for 13 years she worked for other people. Her greatest wish was to have own shop. The first machine she got was with help from the government. The second machine she won in a raffle in the community church. The third is a five thread overlock that she bought. The loan is to buy fabric and to be able to make bread. She comments that she has put a million efforts and dedication into her business. It has been her source of income. She contributes to the household expenses because her husband does not earn enough. The other members of the group are: PRESIDENT: Rosa María V.R. TREASURER: Beatriz Adriana R.S. MEMBERS: Aida R.R. Teresa S.C. Adriana E.G. Laura R.C. Maricela R.C. Nayely J.A. María de la Luz R. Noelia H.R.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn to make tortillas, buy fabric, and supplies to make bread

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: El Señor Santos, tiene 2 hijos nacido el primero de Diciembre de 1986 em Santa Cruz, Andrés Ibáñez, el señor es mototaxista, se dedica a esta actividad casi 10 años es su actividad principal, tambien se dedica  ha la agricultura, ha obtenido su tierra mediande compra. Son 194226 Hectareas en la cual siembra Maiz, Sandia, Maní y otros productos. y con esta actividad mantiene a su familia ya que su esposa se dedica a labores de casa y al cuidado de sus dos hijos, es una persona responsable y trabajador siempre pensando en el bienestar de su familia, con el dinero del credito el Sr. Santos desea contratar mano de obra para que le ayuden en la cosecha de sus productos para luego comercializarlos en el mercado de el Torno esta muy agardecido con Emprender por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Santos, who has 2 children, was born on the 1st of December 1986, in Andrés Ibáñez, Santa Cruz. Santos drives a motorcycle-taxi, and this has been his principal activity for 10 years. He also is engaged in agriculture and has bought some land that he farms. He has 194,226 hectares on which he sows corn, watermelon, maní (a basic root crop), and other products. With this activity, he maintains his family, while his wife dedicates herself to household work and caring for their 2 children. He is a responsible person and worker, always thinking about his family's well-being. With this loan, Santos will hire laborers to help in harvesting his crops, which can then be sold in the local market in Torno. He is very grateful to Emprender for the credit opportunity it offers.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: HIRING WORKERS TO HELP HARVEST HIS CROPS

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Es una mujer de 46 años, casada con nueve hijos quienes le ayudan a realizar las actividades que le generan ingresos, su esposo trabaja en otras actividades y es por eso que el no le puede ayudar en su negocio, pero el esposo de doña Alicia provee todo para el hogar, es por eso que ella puede dedicarse a la siembra y cosecha de tomate, maíz y hongo chino, doña Alicia tiene conocimiento del tratamiento que esto debe llevar ya que ha recibido capacitaciones al respecto. Ella sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales y que cuando sean ya mayores se independicen. Ella necesita mas capital para invertir en la siembra.
texts.en:
She is a 46-year old married woman with nine children who help her to complete the work to generate income. Her husband works in another business and as a result, he cannot help her with her business. However, Alicia’s husband provides everything for the home. This is why she is able to work planting and harvesting tomatoes, corn, and Chinese mushrooms. Alicia has knowledge of the care that they should receive since she has received training on the topic. She dreams that children will become professionals and that they will become independent when they are older. She needs more capital to invest in planting.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Darling Junieth

texts.es: La Señora Darling Junieth tiene la edad de 22 años. Actualmente es casada. Solamente tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. La actividad económica de Darling es la venta de mercadería en general.  Comenzó este negocio en compañía de su Mama,  hace 5 años ya que desde muy joven  aprendió este negocio y decide seguir adelante con la actividad. Por lo que ahora solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será utilizado para la compra de camisas, pantalones, faldas y camisolas. Por lo que necesita diversificar para que sus clientes tengan mayores oportunidades de comprarles sus productos. Su mayor deseo es ampliar su negocio de tal forma que le permita mejorar la situación económica de su familia y brindarles a su hijo la mejor educación posible.
texts.en:
Sra. Darling Juneith is 22 years old, married, and has a child under her care. Darling’s business involves selling general merchandise. She started this business with her mother five years ago. Darling learned the business when she was younger and decided to continue with it. For this reason, she is now requesting a loan to use as operating capital to buy shirts, trousers, skirts, and camisoles. She needs to diversify so that her customers will have greater opportunities to buy her products. Her greatest wish is to expand her business so that she can improve her family’s financial situation and provide her child with the best education possible.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: La Buena Amistad Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Eleoteria cocina muy rico, durante mucho tiempo apoyo  preparando los alimentos a un comedor D. su zona en los Olivos, es así como le nació la idea D. preparar algunos alimentos para ofrecerlos entre sus conocidos, empezó con los tamales que preparaba cada fin D. semana  y los vendía.  Después ofrecía sus servicios para cocinar en eventos como cumpleaños, bautizos, aniversaR.  etc. poco  a poco se ha hecho conocida tal es así que muchos requieren D. sus servicios  y recibe muchos contratos lo que ella mas desea es tener su propio restaurante y administrarlo el lugar ya lo tiene solo le falta capital para implementar el local  que es en su propia casa por lo pronto seguirá ahorrando para lograrlo muy pronto, con su préstamo comprara sus ingredientes como condimentos, maíz  y otras especies para preparar los alimentos.

Su grupo se llama “LA BUENA AMISTAD” ella es la tesorera  un arduo trabajo que desempeña D. la mejor manera  ya tiene en el grupo mas D. 4 años  junto a todas sus compañeras.


*La Sra Eleoteria es la tercera  D. las paradas esta con chaleco negro y chompa roja,en la foto aparecen 12 por que hay 1 pasiva que tambien es miembro del grupo.
texts.en:
Sra. Eleoteria is a very good cook. For a long time, she helped in the preparation of meals in a restaurant in her neighborhood in Los Olivos. From this was born the idea of preparing some meals to offer to her acquaintances. She began with tamales, which she prepared each weekend and then sold. Later, she offered her services for cooking for events such as birthdays, christenings, anniversaries, etc. Little by little she has become well known so that a lot of people request her services, and she receives a lot of contracts. What she wants most is to own and manage her own restaurant. She already has a place for it in her house, and only lacks capital in order to start. For the time being, she will continue saving in order to attain her goal. With her loan she will buy ingredients for preparing meals such as condiments, corn, and other things. Her group is called “La Buena Amistad” (Good Friendship). She is the treasurer, a difficult job that she performs very well. Sra. Eleoteria is in the third row in the black vest and red sweater. Twelve members appear in the photo because one of the group members has chosen to keep maintain her savings in the group's account during this loan cycle. She is not included on the list of group members because she is not taking out a new loan during this cycle.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Spices and corn to prepare food

loans.name: Valerio

texts.es: El señor Valerio nacido el 9 de Diciembre de1976 en Chuquisaca, casado con doña Natividad  también de Chuquisaca tienen dos hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar,Hace 16 años que tiene sus tierras en Pakay donde alli trabaja en la siembra de yuca,maiz,camote. En sus ratos libres trabaja de taxista en la ruta Santa Rita / Pakay . Todo lo que cosecha lo lleva al Torno a la venta, con el dinero del prestamo contratara mano de obra para que preparen el terreno para la siembra y tambien para la compra de semillas, es una persona responsable y muy trabajador, esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Valerio was born on December 9, 1976, in Chuquisaca. He is married, and his wife, Natividad, is also from Chuquisaca. They have two school-aged children. For the past 16 years, Valerio has had fields in Pakay where he works growing yuca, corn and sweet potatoes. In his off hours, he works as a taxi driver on the Santa Rita / Pakay route. He takes all of his harvest to Torno to sell. With the funds from the loan, he will hire laborers to prepare the fields for planting, and he will also buy seeds. He is a responsible and very hard-working person, and he is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence placed in him in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Preparing his fields for planting

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: La Señora Rosa Argentina tiene 39 años, es una mujer casada. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica es la venta y elaboración de comida. Hace más de 10 años que posee este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es en el mercado, Por lo que sus inicios surgen con muy poco capital, pero con muchas ganas de salir adelante ya que tenía que pagar las cuentas de su vivienda y además proporcionarles a sus hijos estudios y alimentación. Poco a poco fue incrementando su inventario con las pocas ganancias que su negocio le generaba, sus clientes recurrían a su negocio ya que la atención de Rosa es muy buena y además atiende a sus clientes con una sonrisa en sus labios. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite y maíz, refrescos, bolsas, platos y cubiertos. Su mayor sueño es que cada uno de sus hijos logren finalizar sus estudios y que sigan adelante con esta actividad que les ayudo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Argentina is 39 years old; she is a married woman and has 2 children under her care. She sells and makes food as a source of income and has had the business for over 10 years. Her business is located in the market. In the beginning, she had very little capital but had the will to get ahead since she had to pay the household expenses and give her children a good education and food. Little by little she increased her inventory with very little earnings but her customers kept coming back since Rosa’s attention to her customers is very good and she always greets them with a smile on her lips. The loan is for work capital to buy rice, sugar, beans, oil and corn, refreshments, bags, plates and utensils. Her biggest dream is that each of her children will be able to finish their studies and that they will continue with their respective jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: work capital

loans.name: Arminda

texts.es: La señora Arminda tiene 53 años de edad, es una madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos un joven de 24 y una señorita de 23, ella nos cuenta que crio a sus hijos sola, trabajando duro cada día y dandole a sus hijos todo lo que necesitan, actualmente sus hijos ya son casados y ahora ella vive sola, y tiene una tienda llamada Tienda Mirna la tienda tiene 6 años de existir, doña Arminda ya no trabaja, solamente se dedica a su tienda, y su tienda le da para poder mantenerse, sin embargo sus clientes ahora le piden otros productos que no tienen y para poder complacer a sus clientes es que solicita este crédito para poder surtir mas su tienda y no perder a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Arminda is 53 years old and is a single mother; she has 2 children, a 24 year old young man and a 23 year old young woman. She tells us that she raised her children by herself working hard everyday and giving her children everything they needed. At present, her children are married and Mrs. Arminda lives by herself and has a store called Tienda Mirna, the store is 6 years old and she only works in the store since it provides enough to sustain her. Her customers now ask her for products that she does not have and to please them she needs the loan to stock her store and she won’t loose her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in merchandize.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es: La señora Felicia, nacida en Comarapa, Viuda  del Sr. Angel(+), con tres hijos, dos mayores y un menor D. edad, tiene su terreno en el cual siembra yuca, camote. Ella tiene 59 años, nacida el 14 D. enero D. 1951, hace 4 años que murio su marido y fue un golpe para ella pero salio adelante, pero ella sigue trabajando en la agricultura con peones y su hijo menor administra el trabajo, el dinero del credito lo utilizara en el contrato D. mano D. obra para preparar la tierra para la siembra y tambien para la compra D. semillas, tiene casa propia en tarumá, la Sra. Felicia es muy fuerte y muy trabajadora esta muy agradecida con Emprender y con kiva por la confianza brindada.
texts.en:
Mrs. Felicia born in Comarapa, widow of Mr. Angel Sr., has three children, 2 are adults and one is underage. She has a plot were she grows yucca and sweet potato. She is 59 years old, and was born January 14, 1951, four years ago her husband died and it was a huge blow for her but she carries on and keeps working in agriculture with some workers and the help of her youngest son who manages the work. The loan will be used to hire workers to prepare the land and sow the field as well as buying seeds. Mrs. Felicia has her own home in tarumá and is a very strong and hard worker. Mrs. Felicia is very thankful to Emprender (Kiva’s field partner) and Kiva for the trust given to her.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For small plots of land and to grow products like sweet potatoes

loans.name: Ricardo Elias

texts.es:
Ricardo de 35 años, vive en el Suburbio de Guayaquil(zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales),  el tiene un taller mecánico desde hace años. 

Cuando comenzó con su taller fue con la motivación de mantener a su familia, el tenia su taller en la calle pero con los bueno ingresos que obtuvo pudo readecuar su casa y ubicar el taller de mecánica, ahora trabaja desde las 08h30am hasta las 17h00pm le ayudan dos personas. 

Con el préstamo el quiere comprar herramientas y repuestos para su negocio, en el futuro quiere ampliar su negocio en otro lugar y readecuar su casa.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 35 years old, and lives in the Guyaquil suburb (an urban area, the majority of the people are in the informal business) he has a mechanics’ shop for some two years.

When he began his workshop it was with the incentive to support his family, he had his workshop in the street but with good earnings he was able to refit his home and locate the mechanic’s shop, he now works from 08h30am until 17h00pm he is helped by two people.

With the loan he wants to buy tools and spare parts for his business, in the future he wants to expand his business in another place and to remodel his home.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tools and spare parts.

loans.name: Siempre Adelante Group

texts.es:
“ SIEMPRE ADELANTE “ es un grupo formado por 8 socias la presidenta del grupo  es Juana  quien  por mucho tiempo trabajo en Venezuela al  llegar al Perú decidió invertir sus ahorros en el rubro D. venta D. comidas ella  contaba con experiencia  en la preparación D. alimentos ahora tiene un puesto D. venta D. comida y productos D. la selva  su negocio se llama “ la rica palomita” allí venD. platos típicos como pescado a la plancha ,tacacho, juanés etc. Tiene trabajando en su negocio 10 años  con el fruto D. su trabajo ella logra mantener  a sus 04 hijos darles buena educación y buena calidad D. vida.
El dinero D. su préstamo lo usara para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio comprando mas productos entre pescados, carnes y otros ingredientes, también quiere ampliar su puesto D. venta y hacerlo mas granD..

* La Sra. Juana es la quinta D. la derecha (parada)esta con anteojos.
texts.en:
“Siempre Adelante” (Ahead Always) is a group composed of 8 members. The group's president is Juana who for a long time, worked in Venezuela. Upon returning to Peru, she decided to invest her savings in making and selling meals. She can count on long experience in food preparation and now has a post where she sells meals and products from the forest. Juana's business is called “The Rich Little Dove”. Here she sells typical dishes, including grilled fish and other local delicacies. Juana has done this for 10 years and her earnings support her 4 children, providing them with a good education and quality of life. The money from her loan will be invested in her business, purchasing foods, including fish, meat, and other ingredients. Also, she wants to expand her sales post, making it larger. In the above picture Juana is 5th from the right, wearing glasses.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING FOOD PRODUCTS FOR PREPARING TYPICAL DISHES IN HER RESTAURANT

loans.name: Luna Nueva En Huiloapan Group

texts.es:
Esta foto fue tomada en la casa D. Concepción F., un integrante del grupo Luna Nueva en Huiloapan, que está ubicado en el Estado D. Veracruz en México. Se ve el negocio D. la señora que se dedica a la venta D. antojitos y frituras junto con el resto D. sus compañeras en la foto. Ella se dedica a este negocio desD. hace 4 años. Solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para su venta D. antojitos y así poder incrementar sus ventas. Sus clientes la consideran una persona responsable y luchadora ya que empezó vendiendo dulces afuera D. su casa y actualmente venD. también antojitos y ha tenido que ampliar su negocio hacia la calle con una lona pues requiere D. más espacio. Al momento D. solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta D. iniciar este nuevo crédito que le permitirá seguir haciendo crecer su negocio. Tiene 57 años, estudió hasta el 3er. año D. secundaria, es soltera y tiene en total 5 hijos (4 mujeres y 1 varón). Quiere este crédito para comprar insumos para su venta D. antojitos y frituras para poder vender más y hacer crecer su negocio. También espera en un futuro asociarse con su hija para rentar un local y poder poner una fonda (negocio D. comida) ya D. manera formal y D. esta forma mejorar su calidad D. vida.
Jacinta A. es la presidente del grupo. Tiene 39 años, estudió hasta la primaria, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Ella se dedica a venta D. ropa que inició hace 2 años. Solicita el préstamo para comprar más ropa para vender y hacer crecer su negocio.
El grupo esta conformado por 11 D. integrantes. Los otros integrantes son:
Teresita D. Jesús G. (Venta D. Antojitos), 
Concepción C. (Venta D. Ropa),  
María Antonia F. (Venta D. Antojitos),
Elvia Yuridia M. (Venta D. Zapatos), 
Verónica R. (Venta D. Zapatos), 
Bertha F. (Venta D. Tamales), 
Ofelia M. R. (Venta D. Flor), 
Estela A. (Venta D. Oro) y 
Ana María D. Jesús A. (Venta D. Flor).
texts.en:
This photo was taken at Concepción F.’s house. She is a member of the “Luna Nueva” (New Moon) group in Huiloapan, which is in the state of Veracruz in Mexico. She sells snacks and fried food. She can be seen together with the rest of her colleagues in the photo. She has been in this business for four years. She is requesting the loan to buy supplies for her snack sales in order to be able to increase her sales. Her customers consider her to be a responsible and tenacious person. She started selling sweets outsiD. of her house. Now she also sells snacks. She has had to expand her business with a canvas towards the street because she needs more space. Upon requesting this loan she feels happy to start a new loan, which will allow her to keep growing in her business. She is 57 years old, and she went to school until the third year of high school. She is single, and she has five children (four girls and a boy). She wants this loan to buy supplies for her snack and fried food sales. She wants to sell more and make her business grow. In the future she also plans to work with her daughter in order to rent a place and be able to set up a “fonda” (food business) in a formal way. This way she will improve her quality of life. Jacinta A. is the president of the group. She is 39 years old, and she has an elementary school education. She is single and does not have children. She started selling clothes two years ago. She is requesting the loan to be able to buy more clothes to sell and make her business grow. The group is comprised of 11 members. The other members are: Concepción C. (Sells Clothes), María Antonia F. (Sells Snacks), Elvia Yuridia M. (Sells Shoes), Verónica R. (Sells Shoes), Bertha F. (Sells Tamales), Ofelia M. R. (Sells Flowers), Estela A. (Sells Gold) y Ana María D. Jesús A. (Sells Flowers)

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for her snack sales

loans.name: Silvia Maria

texts.es: Silvia María tiene la actividad económica de pulpería. Hace más de 19 años que se dedica a este negocio pues ella no tenía un medio de ingreso para sustentar a su familia. Ella siempre ha sido una mujer muy responsable, siempre se ha preocupado por proporcionarle a su familia los ingresos necesarios, pues siempre está esforzándose para mejorar su calidad de vida.   Este no es el primer financiamiento que solicita por lo que es así que su negocio ha podido mejorar así podrá comprar golosinas, refrescos naturales, jugos, detergentes y granos básicos. Ella desea ampliar su negocio para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Silvia María has a general store. Since she didn’t have a source of income to sustain her family, she began her business some 19 years ago. She has always been a very responsible woman and has been concerned in giving her family the income needed since she is always working hard to improve their quality of life. This is not her first loan and her business has been able to improve and plans to buy candy, natural drinks, juices, detergents and basic grains. She wants to expand her business to improve her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital.

loans.name: Las Ilusiones Group

texts.es: Las tres integrantes de este grupo las Ilusiones, son mujeres que han trabajado muy duro toda su vida, desde pequeñas se dedican a la elaboración de tejidos de telar de cintura y luego se dedicaron a trabajar para propietarios de negocios de telar de pedal y costura de monederos y telas tipícas; pero se enteraron de las oportunidades que da la venta de productos de Omnilife, empezaron a participar en platicas y ahora ellas crearon su negocio de la venta de este producto han notado que se adquiere buenas ganacias y oportunidades de ganar promociones, y esto ha hecho que ellas tengan la necesidad de realizar un prestamo para comprar mas mercadería cda una tiene su sector de venta y han logrado tener ya varios clientes. Su mas grande deseo es tener una vida de prosperidad siempre y para bien de sus hijos.
texts.en:
The three members of the “Ilusiones” (Hopes) group are women who have worked hard their entire lives. Since a very early age they have woven items using waist looms and then were employed by weaving firms that use pedal looms to make coin purses and typical fabrics. They became aware of the opportunities available as Omnilife products salespeople; they took training courses and now have set up their own business to sell these products. They have noted that profits are good and promotional opportunities exist. This has necessitated their request for a loan to buy more merchandise. Each one of them has her own sales territory and has managed to secure several regular customers. Their greatest wish is to have a prosperous life always for their children’s wellbeing.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Vilma Yannet

texts.es: Vila tiene 41 años D. edas, es casada, tiene 3 hijos y tienen casa propia, La hija mas granD. se graduo el añpo pasado y ya tiene trabajo lo que significa una gran alegria para doña Vilma, Doña Vilma tiene tres negocios el principal es la costura donD. lleva 18 años y le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene el apoyo D. su esposo y ahora D. su hija mayor, también tiene una pequeña tienda y librería que le ha incrementado ganancias por la buena atención que les brinda a sus clientes. El negocio esta situado en su domicilio. Su principal sueño es ampliar mas su negocio y es por eso que solicita crédito.
texts.en:
Vilma is 41 years old, she is married and has 3 children and has her own home. Her eldest daughter graduated last year and has a job which brings great joy to Mrs. Vilma. She has three businesses, the main one is sewing where she has worked for 18 years and it has gone very well since she has the support of her husband and now of her eldest daughter. Mrs. Vilma also has a small store and a bookstore that have increased her profits due to the good service that she provides to her customers. The business is located in her home. Her dream is to expand her business and that is why she needs the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her businesses.

loans.name: Veronica De Los Angeles

texts.es: La señora Verónica De Los Ángeles ella tiene 36 años, tiene dos hijos menores de edad, son estudiantes. La señora Verónica se dedica ofrecer el servicio de nintendo ubicada en su casa de habitación. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace 4 años, ella empezó con muy pocos productos, pero esto no la desanimo a salir adelante. Sin embargo con el tiempo logro comprar productos como golosinas, refrescos, y pan así sus clientes juegan y compran sus productos. Su crédito será invertido en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercancías, discos, controles y televisor. Su sueño es agrandar su negocio y la pulpería en la cual venda todo tipo de artículos, que puedan brindar mayores ingresos a su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Verónica De Los Ángeles is 36 years old, and has 2 underage children, they are students. Mrs. Verónica’s business is located in her home and she rents Nintendo games. She began this business 4 years ago and had a few products to sell but it did not discourage her from getting ahead. Later, Mrs. Verónica was able to buy products like candy, refreshments and bread, as her customers play and buy her products. The loan will be used to buy a greater quantity of merchandize such as disks, controllers and a television. Her dream is to expand her business and to have a small store where she would sell all types of merchandize that will give her family greater income.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: work capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase two high-speed floor machines and a carpet cleaner

loans.name: Jose Ovidio

texts.es:
Don Ovidio tiene 67 años, es casado vive con su hijo y esposa en su casa propia, el tiene mucha expereincia en el aspecto comercial ya que desde muy pequeño se inicio vendiendo ropa usada.
Don Ovidio vive en una comunidad muy grande, es sueño de don Ovidio es tener una empresa de costuras y manejar su propio capital. El tiene un local de rpa usada en el cual tiene 3 años de estar y también tiene 3 lineas de taxi, Don Ovidio solicita un crédito para poder incrementar su mercaderia y ofrecer nuevas cosas en su tienda de ropa usada, el lugar donde se ubica el local de don Ovidio no tiene mucha competencia y gracias a esto los ingresos son mucho mayores.
texts.en:
Don Ovidio is 67 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and son in their own home. He has a great deal of business experience because he began to sell used clothing when he was very young. Don Ovidio lives in a very large community. His dream is to have a business that makes clothing and to manage his own capital. He has been selling used clothing from his current store for three years. He also has three taxis. Don Ovidio requests a loan to increase inventory and offer new items at his store. Because he does not have much competition near his store, his income is much higher than it might be.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supply his store with more merchandise

loans.name: Cecilio

texts.es: Cecilio tiene 64 años esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, pues han sido muy importantes para su negocio.  La actividad económica a la que se dedica es ofrecer los servicios de carpintería, hace más de 16 años que se dedica a esta actividad, por lo que  anteriormente se dedicaba a ofrecer los servicios de vigilante, pero este trabajo era muy peligroso y fue por medio de un amigo que decidió iniciar, ya que era un trabajo más accesible para él y su familia. El destino del financiamiento es para comprar madera, clavos, pega, brocas y sierras. El desea proporcionarle mejoras a su local del negocio y mantenerlo siempre activo.
texts.en:
This isn't the first time that Cecilio, 64, has applied for a loan and past loans have been very important for his business. He has operated a carpentry business for more than 16 years. Before that, he worked as a security guard but the work was very dangerous and he decided, with the help of a friend, to set up his own business, something that has better suited both him and his family. Cecilio will use the loan to buy wood, nails, glue, locks and latches. His goals are to improve his shop and always stay active.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Unidas Triunfaremos Group

texts.es:
La Sra. María siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabajadora  durante mucho tiempo trabajo en el sector publico  ella es bachiller D. derecho por lo tanto siempre fue bien remunerada  así  podía vivir cómodamente, lamentablemente los cambios D. gobierno la afectaron perdiendo su trabajo  debido a su edad avanzada le fue muy difícil volver a conseguir un buen trabajo ella es viuda y con un hijo por mantener busco la manera D. ganarse la vida  es así que una señora le enseña  el negocio D. venta D. productos D. belleza justamente D. los productos que ella usaba cuando podía comprarlos,  D. a pocos y con solo 100 soles que tenia  compro algunos productos los que  empezó a vender  D. puerta en puerta actualmente tiene trabajando en el negocio 5 años ella busca personas y les enseña a trabajar tiene a su cargo 95 personas  D. las que ella cobra un porcentaje  por la cantidad D. personas que maneja sus ganancias son  buenas D. manera que pueD. solventar sus gastos y vivir bien. Sus prestamos la ayudan para comprar sus materiales D. trabajo como catalogos, probadores etc. Y también para solventar  sus viajes para capacitar a sus vendedoras.
María es la tesorera del grupo “UNIDAS TRIUNFAREMOS”  ella esta feliz por que su trabajo le ha dado estabilidad económica y confianza en ella misma, para mas adelante quiere incorporar a mas personas  para que siga superándose.

* La Sra. Maria esta con chompa morada y chalina crema.
texts.en:
María has always been a very hard working person in the public sector. She graduated with a degree in law so has always earned a good salary that allowed her to live comfortably. Sadly, however, a change in government led to her losing her job and, due to her advanced age, it was very difficult for her to find new employment. She is a widow with a son to support. She looked for a way to earn a living and an acquaintance of hers taught her about the cosmetics sales business, ironically the same brand of cosmetics she herself used when she could afford them. Gradually and with just the 100 soles she had on hand she bought some products and started to sell them door-to-door. She has now been in this line of work for 5 years. She recruits others to work and now has a team of 95 salespeople under her leadership. She earns a percentage of their sales. Because of the large number of people she supervises, her earnings are substantial and she is able to cover her expenses and live well. The loans help her buy her work tools like catalogues, samples, etc. They also help defray travel costs associated with her trips to train her saleswomen. María is treasurer of the “UNIDAS TRIUNFAREMOS” (Together We Will Triumph) group. She is happy because her work has provided economic stability and has led to her trusting in herself. For the futures, she’d like to incluD. more salespeople to her team so that she can continue to succeed. * María is wearing the purple sweater and cream scarf.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for work-related travel expenses and to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: José Manuel

texts.es:
José Manuel Batín R. vive en el barrio Olaya Herrera de Cartagena  y es un hombre muy trabajador que siempre ha buscado alternativas de nuevos ingresos, porque conoce muy bien el oficio de albañil pero como es una actividad muy estacionaria,  ha buscado la forma de salir adelante mediante su negocio de vender de todo un poco llamado "Comercios punto Combo", usted lo puede ver diariamente vendiendo en su bicicleta pan que distribuye en su barrio y en las zonas aledañas pero también diariamente puedo encontrarlo comercializando, muchas líneas de productos como son los de la canasta familiar: plátano, pastas alimenticias tubérculos y otros. Cuando se inició como negociante fue apoyado con un capital de trabajo de su familia y vendía queso y lácteos, pero gradualmente con el crédito  que   recibió de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo  agregó otros productos y quiere seguir ampliar su negocio a otras zonas de Cartagena, por eso acude a su credikiva con el cual comprará panes de molde, piñita y rellenos además de tubérculos, banano, pastas alimenticias en mayor volumen.
José Manuel es muy conocido en su barrio y tiene muchos clientes, el sueña con ver a sus 2 hijos convertidos en profesionales y continuar con la Fundación que le ha brindado la posibilidad de aumentar su capital de trabajo y así mismo ha podido arreglar su casa. Su mayor desafío es transformar su negocio en una gran almacén de víveres con local y todo.
texts.en:
José Manuel Batín R. lives in Cartagena's Olaya Herrera neighborhood. He is a hard-working man who is always looking for ways to increase his income. He is a skilled construction worker but construction jobs are seasonal so he started a business selling a little of everything. He calls the business "Comercios punto Combo" (Merchandise-dot-Combo). You can see him every day on his bicycle, selling bread around the neighborhood and in the surrounding area, too. Along with that, he works every day selling the basic products that every household needs: bananas, pastas, potatoes, etc. He started the business with working capital that he borrowed from his family. He was selling cheese and dairy products then but, gradually, with loans from the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, he added other products and expanded his business to other parts of Cartagena. He has approached Kiva for a loan so that he can buy wholesale supplies of products such as bread, pinita and potato and banana fillings. Jose Manuel is well known in the neighborhood and he has a lot of customers. He goals are to see his 2 children in good careers and to continue working with the Fundacion that has done so much to help him improve not only his business, but his house too. His biggest challenge is to grow his business so that he has his own shop and everything.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Satelital Group

texts.es:
Durante mucho tiempo Gloria se dedico a la costura de prendas de vestir , fue una amiga que la animo a ingresar al mundo de la venta de cosméticos  por catalogo, empezó vendiendo muy poco a sus amigos y familiares.  de esto ya ha pasado 1 año y medio lo que ha logrado hasta ahora es increíble, actualmente es directora y tiene a su cargo 34 personas que ella misma entrena y capacita con el fin de que conozcan el negocio y puedan desarrollarse como ella lo hizo ,ella gana el 10% de las ventas de las personas que tiene a su cargo ala vez que también conserva sus clientes .con sus ganancias ha podido implementar su casa con artefactos que antes no tenia también puede darle a su hijo una mejor educación en un buen colegio también apoya a su esposo que actualmente esta desempleado lo que ella mas quiere es seguir superándose  y lograr tener el máximo cargo dentro dela empresa de cosméticos para la cual trabaja de modo que sus ingresos aumenten su préstamo le servirá para pagar cuentas pendientes de sus productos .

* Gloria es la segunda de la derecha esta con ropa negra
texts.en:
Gloria has made clothing for a long time. A friend encouraged her to enter the world of catalogue cosmetics sales. She started selling a very small amount to her friends and family. She has been selling cosmetics for a year and a half already and what she has achieved up until now is incredible. She is now a director and has 34 people under her whom she herself trains and prepares so that they will know the business and be able to develop themselves as she has. She makes 10% of their sales and she also has her own customers. With her earnings she has been able to outfit her home with fixtures that she did not have before, and she has been able to give her child a better education in a good school. She also supports her husband who is currently unemployed. She most desires to continue to improve and to achieve the highest position in the cosmetics company. In order for her income to increase, her loan will be used to pay outstanding bills for her products. * Gloria is the second from the right, in black clothes

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay outstanding bills for beauty products

loans.name: Mujeres Decididas E Independientes Group

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 03 hijos es separada D. su esposo, a pesar que sus niños son pequeños ella tiene que trabajar  para darles una mejor calidad D. vida, ella recuerda  cuando compraba ropa para ella y sus hijos  en un mercado D. su zona  poco tiempo después ella empezó a trabajar en gamarra una zona D. fabricantes D. ropa es ahí donD. se dio cuenta que lo que ella pagaba por la ropa que compraba era el doble así descubrió que los mismos confeccionistas  le dejaban la ropa a menos precio por eso deciD. dedicarse al negocio D. venta D. ropa y empieza comprando a los comerciantes que ella conocía ellos mismos la animaron a hacerlo debido a su carisma como todo negocio al  principio fue difícil por que no tenia capital.
El conocer la entidad  le fue D. mucha ayuda por que el dinero D. su primer préstamo lo invirtió para comprar algunas prendas como polos, pantalones y blusas. Su negocio le ha dado muchas satisfacciones como por ejemplo tener algunas comodidades en su hogar comprarse artefactos que no tenia, con su préstamo recién desembolsado podrá comprar mas ropa para vender  aprovechando  estas fechas donD. hay mucha venta  mas adelante quiere tener otro negocio que tenga que ver con el rubro D. comida o abarrotes  para eso esta trabajando y ahorrando. Carmen es la tesorera del grupo “ MUJERES DECIDIDAS E INDEPENDIENTES”  grupo formado por 8 socias vecinas del mismo lugar.

La Sra. Carmen esta con blusa celeste a cuadros tiene anteojos, es la ultima D. la fila.
texts.en:
Carmen has 3 children and is separated from her husband. Since her children are young, she has to work to give them a better quality of life. She remembers buying clothing for herself and her children in a market in their area shortly after starting work at Gamarra [the largest commercial center in Lima] making clothing. It was then that she noticed that what she paid for the clothing she bought was twice their original price. She also discovered that the clothing makers got the clothing for less. For this reason she decided to open a business selling clothing. She started buying from the merchants whom she knew, and they encouraged her to do it because of her charisma. As in all businesses, at the beginning it was difficult because she did not have capital. Knowing the business was very helpful because she invested the money from her first loan to purchase some garments such as polos, pants and blouses. Her business has given her much satisfaction, as for example she can have various comforts in her home, buying fixtures that she did not have. With this recent loan she will be able to purchase more clothing to sell, taking advantage of the dates where there are many sales. In the future she wants to have another business that has to do with the area of food or groceries. She is working and saving up for this. Carmen is the treasurer of the "Mujeres Decididas e Independientes" ["Resolute and Independent Women"] group, maD. up of 8 members who are neighbours in the same area. Carmen is in the blue checkered blouse and has glasses; she is the last in the line.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of winter clothing for sale

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El Sr. Juan B. de 68 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Catalina Tapari de 53 años de edad, tienen varios hijos, todos son ya mayores de edad.
   Don Juan comenzó con este rubro aproximadamente en el año 1.993; con el capital que  recibieron por la venta de un terreno, con el cual abrieron las puertas de su despensa y copetín para la comunidad, en la actualidad en su negocio ya tiene  su clientela formada.
   El invertiría este crédito en comprar más mercaderías (Fideos, arroz, gaseosas, vinos, azúcar, aceite, leche, etc.) para tener más variedades de cosas y así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juan B., age 68, is married to 53 year old Catalina Tapari. They have several children, and all of them are adults. Juan started his business in approximately 1993. He used the money he received from selling a piece of land, and he opened the doors of his general store and snack bar to the community. He now has a regular customer base. He will use the loan to buy more merchandise (noodles, rice, soft drinks, wine, sugar, oil, and milk, etc.). He will do this to have a greater variety of things and to satisfy his customers’ demand.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more merchandise (noodles, rice, soft drinks, wine, sugar, oil, and milk, etc.)

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: Don Alberto X. tiene 39 años tiene 5 hijos, los dos mayores de edad le ayudan con las ventas por la mañana y por la tarde estudian. Alberto tiene 15 años de tener su negocio y da gracias a Dios y a Fape / kiva por el apoyo que le han brindado los ultimo 2 años con creditos ya que con ellos a podido incrementar su negocio de ropa. El crédito que Don alberto solicita es para comprar nueva mercaderia y ampliar su negocio. El sueño de Don Alverto es abrir un nuevo local con nueva mercaderia y optener mejores ganancias para poder da un mejro futuro a sus hijos para que sigan estudiando y sena personas de bien.
texts.en:
Mr. Alberto X. is 39 years old and has five children, two of them are adults who help him sell in the morning and attend school in the evening. Alberto has had his business for 15 years and he thanks God, FAPE, and Kiva for the loan support he has gotten over the past two years. They have allowed him to expand his clothing business. The loan that Alberto is asking for is for new merchandise and business expansion. Alberto’s dream is to open a new shop with new merchandise. He wants to increase his revenue so that he can improve his children’s future. He wants them to continue to study and become well off.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El  señor Luis tiene 49 años y esta casado con la señora Basilica Martinez de 44. Ambos tiene 2 hijos que aun viven con ellos y están estudiando.
    El cliente  emprendió su pequeña microempresa hace un poco más de 4 años, pero desde hace mucho tiempo es comerciante, ya que se dedica también a la venta de mercaderías en forma ambulante. Es ayudado muy de cerca por su cónyuge.
Solicito el crédito para la compra de mercaderías como pantalones, camisas, remeras ya que en esta época estan de oferta. 
Más adelante desea ampliar el negocio con venta de artículos de bazar mercería.
   EL cliente  espera un futuro mejor para nuestro país con mucho trabajo y progreso .
texts.en:
Luis is 49 years old and married to Basilica who is 44. In addition, they have 2 children who still live with them and are studying. A little over 4 years ago, he started his micro-enterprise, but he has been a merchant for a long time, selling merchandise on foot. He is closely assisted by his wife. Luis requests a loan to buy merchandise such as pants, shirts, and t-shirts that are presently available. Later, he wants to expand the business to include dry-goods articles. Luis hopes for a better future for his country, with a great deal of work and progress.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING PANTS AND SHIRTS TO SELL

loans.name: Gloria Ines

texts.es:
Gloria Castellón (vestida de color rosado en la fotografia que aperece con su asesora de credito) es una mujer trabajadora que vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su cónyuge y su hijo de 28 años que  aun estudia; ella tiene un negocio donde ofrece servicios que embellecen la imagen de  damas caballeros y niños.

Gloria  inició su negocio siendo muy joven cuando aprendió el oficio de belleza, que al principio fue a domicilio y gradualmente implementó su infraestructura  donde también comenzó a vender productos cosméticos embellecedores de imagen como aun lo hace. Entre su oferta de servicios también está el manicure, pedicure corte, blower  y tintura de cabellos, que realiza con las mejores técnicas y por eso lo hace con gran excelencia, así  su clientela de San Fernando, el barrio donde está ubicada y los alrededores la  esperan y siempre la buscan.

Este es su segundo crédito con   la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo , organización que la ha apoyado y desde ese momento  ha logrado mejorías en  los servicios que ofrece, además de que su hogar tiene mejores ingresos producto de su trabajo y puede ayudar un poco  a sus padres y a su hermana, esta última, en condición de discapacidad. Su credikiva lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para tratamientos de cabello y de rostro y también para mejorar su vivienda y darle mejor imagen al local donde tiene su negocio.

Su sueño es justamente continuar creciendo y cada día aumentar su nivel de vida y el de su familia al lado de su cónyuge y su único hijo.
texts.en:
Gloria Castellón (seen dressed in pink in the photograph, and appearing with her loan advisor) is a hard working woman who lives in the city of Cartagena, along with her husband and 28 year old son who attends school. She runs a business where she offers beauty services to ladies, gentlemen, and children. Gloria started when she was very young and learned the beauty business. She started working from her home, but gradually she built up her infrastructure and also began selling beauty products. Among her services are manicures, pedicures, haircuts, styling, and coloring. She uses the best techniques and experience, so her customers in her neighborhood of San Fernando, and the surrounding neighborhoods, wait for her and constantly seek her. This will be her second loan through “Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,” which has supported her and made it possible for her to realize the improvements that she now exhibits in her service. Her place also provides improved revenue, the product of her hard work, and she can afford to help her parents and sister. Her sister is disabled. She will use the money from this Kiva loan to buy hair and face treatment supplies, and also to improve her home to give her workspace a better image. She hopes continue growing the business and improve her and her family’s lot in life, alongside her husband and her only son.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies and inventory

loans.name: Favio Jose

texts.es: El señor Favio José, tiene  44 años de edad, es casado y actualmente tiene tres hijos ya mayores de edad. El señor brinda el servicio de taxi. Por lo que siempre busca la forma de ganarse la vida, ya que él es un Padre responsable a pesar de que sus inicios fueron muy difíciles por lo que anteriormente era chofer de otro taxi, poco a poco con el paso del tiempo es que obtuvo su propio taxi. Hace mas de 13 años que tiene el ha ofrecido este servicio a diferentes clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para la realizarles mejoras a su taxi, ya que así le podrá ofrecer a sus clientes más comodidad a sus clientes. El deseo de Favio es obtener otro taxi.
texts.en:
Mr. Favio José is 44 years old. He is married and has three adult children. Favoio provides taxi services and is constantly on the lookout for new ways to earn a living, because he is a responsible father. He had a very difficult beginning. He used to drive a different taxi, but little by little, as time went by he was able to buy his own taxi. He’s been offering these services to different customers for more than 13 years. He is asking for this loan so that he can make some improvements to his taxi and make it more comfortable for his customers. Favio would someday like to be able to acquire another taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make improvemets to his taxi

loans.name: Gloria Matilde

texts.es:
Gloria de 61 años, vive en el Suburbio de Guayaquil(zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales), ella es costurera y confecciona ropa. 

Hace 15 años atrás ella cose ropa para poder mantener a sus hijos cuando eran pequeños, poco a poco con esfuerzo a podido tener dinero para mantenerse estable económicamente porque no cuenta con otro ingreso ya que esta separada. Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta 22h00pm. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar ropa y utensilios para coser mejor, en el futuro quiere arreglar mejor su casa, y poder readecuar el espacio que tiene para taller de costura.
texts.en:
Gloria is 61 years old and lives in the suburbs of Guayaquil (an urban zone where most of the residents are part of the informal economy). She is a seamstress and has been making clothing for 15 years. She began doing this so that she could support her children when they were very young. Little by little, and with lots of effort, she’s been able earn enough money to maintain herself economically; she does not have any other source of income because she is separated. She works from 8:00 am to 10:00 pm. [Gloria] would like to use the money from this loan to buy clothing and utensils that will allow her to improve her sewing. In the future she wants to make some improvements to her house and make better use of her workshop space.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sewing machine

loans.name: Unidos Alcanzaremos Nuestras Metas Group

texts.es:
Juan es un joven de 26 años su familia tiene un negocio de fumigación “JMW “el apoya en la parte de ventas ofreciendo los servicios  a muchas empresas e instituciones, con su trabajo el puede solventar su carrera  en la universidad   actualmente esta en la mitad  de sus estudios siendo esta su segunda carrera ya que culmino otra de derecho. por otro lado también se ayuda dictando clases particulares a estudiantes de colegios , con la culminación de su carrera el quiere seguir apoyando el negocio de su familia y expandirlo apoyando con los conocimientos adquiridos mediante su profesión, su préstamo le servirá para comprar algunos extintores  para cumplir con su clientela, el grupo del  cuales el presidente  se llama “ UNIDOS ALCANZAREMOS NUESTRAS METAS “  grupo formado por 8 jóvenes   entusiastas y trabajadores.

* Juan M. es el trecero de la foto el mas alto
texts.en:
Juan is a young man of 26 years. His family has a fumigation business called "JMW". He helps in the area of sales, offering services to many companies and institutions. With his work he is able to support his university career. He is currently in the middle of his studies, as this is his second degree since he already completed his law degree. He also helps give certain classes to university students. When he finishes his degree he wants to continue helping his family with their business, expand it, supporting it with the knowledge acquired from his degree. His loan will be used for the purchase of some fire extinguishers for his customers. Their group, of which he is president, is called "Unidos Alcanzaremos Nuestros Metas" ["Together We Will Meet Our Goals"], and made up of 8 young enthusiastic and hard-working people. * Juan M. is the third in the photo, the tallest

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of fire extinguishers for his business

loans.name: Benedicta Isabel

texts.es:
Benedicta Ballesta es una mujer que vive en Turbaco, Municipio D. Cartagena y se dedica a las confecciones y ventas D. mercancía.
Su negocio inició desD. muy niña porque siempre ha sido muy creativa y dedicada a esta actividad; adquirió su primera máquina D. coser con sus ahorros y ha levantado a sus hijos que son muy educados y ya formados en la universidad, justamente haciendo lo que mas le gusta: la confección, y así mismo quiere apoyar a sus dos nietos en las edades D. 6 y 8 años a su cargo.
En su negocio confecciona ropa D. todo estilo y afirma que es necesario seguir trabajando para continuar afianzándose en el mercado. Este es su segundo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y recurre a la línea credikiva, porque quiere comprar materias primas e insumos para confeccionar vestidos para damas, que tiene encargados y surtirse un poco D. mercancías que le han solicitado sus mejores clientes. DesD. su primer crédito siente que maneja mejores inventarios y es mas oportuna en dar respuesta a sus clientes, igualmente ha aumentado su utilidad y esto la ayuda en los gastos D. sus pequeños nietos.
Tiene como meta adquirir maquinaria con mayor tecnología D. tal manera que disminuya los tiempos D. producción y aumenta la calidad D. sus prendas en cortos plazos, además D. disminuir los  costos operacionales  D. su negocio pues tiene que pagar por la tarea D. fileteo. Este justamente es su mayor desafío: adquirir una máquina collarína a corto plazo.
texts.en:
Benedicta Ballesta lives in Turbaco, within the city of Cartagena, and she makes and sells various items. Her business really began when she was a little girl because she’s always been creative and dedicated to this activity. She was able to acquire her first sewing machine with her savings, now that she has finished raising her children who are well educated and established in university. She did it by doing what she loves the most, making things. Now she wants to do the same for her two grandchildren, ages 6 and 8, whom she cares for. As part of her business, she makes clothing of every style and she agrees that she needs to continue to work in order to continue to solidify her position in the market. This will be her second loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she is returning to the Kiva loan queue because she needs to buy dressmaking supplies and materials. She has some orders to fill and also wants to have a variety of items on hand that her best customers have requested. Since having received her first loan, she has been able to keep a better inventory and is able to respond quicker to her customers’ requests. Her profits have also increased, and this helps her pay her grandchildren’s expenses. Her short term goal is to acquire a more modern sewing machine, so that she can decrease her production times and improve the quality of her clothing. Even though this reduces her business’ operating costs she has to pay for overlocking [An overlock stitch sews over the edge of one or two pieces of fabric.] Her greatest challenge so getting a collar machine is a short term goal.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sewing machine

loans.name: Blancia Julia

texts.es: Blanca Julia tiene 40 años, tiene dos hijos y todos estudian. Su actividad económica de es la venta y elaboración de tortillas. Por lo que tiene mucho tiempo de ser cliente de Fundación, ya que para ella es muy importante mantenerlo activo. Hace más de 21 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que inicio con muy poco capital. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda, a pesar de ser muy humilde tiene suficiente clientes. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de maíz, leña, cal, comal entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Blanca Julia is 40 years old. She has two children and both attend school. She makes and sells tortillas and has been working with Fundación for a long time and feels that it’s important to continue. She’s been in this business, which she started with very little working capital, for more than 21 years. Her business is located within her home. Although it’s small, she has plenty of customers. She will use the money from this loan as working capital with which to buy dried corn, firewood, salt, and a griddle, among other things.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es: La Srta. D. H. Luz Maria vive en el Caserío Santa Dominguita, junto a sus padres y abuelos. trabaja como obrera de campo en parcelas de la zona desde hace varios años. Tambien trabaja en un laboratorio dental, ya que ha estudiado dicha carrera. Solicita financiamiento para continuar con la construcción de la vivienda de sus abuelos y terminar su carrera profesional. Su sueño es poder tener su titulo profesional y tener una vivienda digna para su familia. La Srta. Luz Maria D. H. agradece el apoyo que le podamos brindar a trávez de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Srta. Luz Maria D. H. lives in the village of Santa Dominguita with her parents and grandparents. She has been working for several years as a field laborer at different farms in the area. Luz also works at a dental laboratory since she is studying for a degree in that field.

She is requesting a loan in order to continue the construction of her grandparents’ house and to pay expenses related to finishing her professional degree. Her dream is to complete her professional degree and to have a decent home for her family. Srta. Luz is grateful for the support that has been provided by granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Continue the construction of her grandparents' house & pay for her educational expenses

loans.name: El Bello Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Brenda  trabajaba en una financiera  como supervisora, al casarse cambiaron muchas cosas  cuando llegaron los hijos  tubo que dedicarles mas tiempo esto  la obligo a dejar el trabajo, ya en casa pudo juntar algo D. dinero D. lo que su esposo le daba y pensó hacer algo en su propia casa,  el hermano D. Brenda es mayorista D. huevos fue el que le dio la idea D. venderlos en su misma casa  así empezó su negocio  vendiendo huevos por menor  solo por kilos sus principales compradores eran sus vecinos y algunas personas que  pasaban por la puerta D. su casa, en la actualidad también los venD. por mayor tiene muchos clientes  reparte a tiendas, restaurantes y otros negocios, D. otro lado también se ayuda con otro negocio D. venta D. celulares esto le deja ganancias extras además D. ser un negocio rentable  ella  quiere dedicarse a este negocio por completo  es un  proyecto que espera concretar  junto a  su esposo que siempre la apoya para eso están ahorrando para hacerse D. un capital.
Su préstamo actual le servirá para abastecerse D. mercadería  para su negocio D. venta D. huevos y seguir trabajando para lograr sus objetivos.

* La Sra Brenda esta con polo rojo
texts.en:
Brenda worked in a financial firm as a supervisor. When she got married, many things changed. When her children arrived, she had to dedicate more time to them, and she was obliged to leave her job. At home, she was able to save some of the money that her husband gave her and she thought of doing something in her home. Her brother is an egg wholesaler, and he gave her the idea of selling eggs in her own home. This is how she started her business selling eggs retail, only by the kilo. Her main buyers were her neighbours and those who passed by the door of her home, but she now also sells them wholesale. She has many customers; stores, restaurants and other businesses. She also helps with another business, cell phone sales. This gives her external earnings. On top of having a profitable business, she wants to dedicate herself fully to this business. It is a project that she hopes to fulfill with her husband who always supports her. She is saving for this to store up capital. This loan will be used to proviD. merchandise for her egg sales business and to continue working toward her goals. * Brenda is in the red polo.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of eggs

loans.name: Virginia Maria

texts.es:
Virginia C. P. es una joven mujer que vive con su cónyuge en el barrio Olaya de la ciudad  de Cartagena  y es muy emprendedora , tanto es que ya tiene su propio negocio de Variedades, donde vende mercancías como detalles para el hogar, papelería, bolsas de regalo, adornos etc.  Su suegra al verle su capacidad le cedió este negocio que lo tenia desde hacia 7 años, cuando decidió radicarse en Turbo Antioquia y Virginia le dio un vuelco total  agregándole papelería útiles escolares, y artículos de miscelánea lo cual le dio un valor agregado al mismo.
Su principal meta es terminar sus estudios universitarios de enfermería y hacer crecer su negocio agregándole servicios de Internet  y videojuegos,  porque con sus utilidades ella sabe que mejoraran sus condiciones familiares y se preparará para cuando vengan sus hijos. Con su credikiva comprará útiles de papelería, detalles para el hogar, y se preparará para el día del amor y la amistad, época de mayor volumen de ventas.
Virginia es una joven muy feliz y su negocio está ubicado en una zona  donde se desarrollan actividades musicales que la deleitan por ser muy autóctonas de la cultura Caribe..
texts.en:
Virginia C. P. is a young woman who lives with her husband in the neighborhood of Olaya in the city of Cartagena. She is a very enterprising woman who has her own variety business where she sells merchandise such as home furnishings, stationery, gift bags, decorations, and other products. Her mother-in-law noticed her abilities, so she left her this business seven years ago when she decided to relocate to Turbo Antioquia. Virginia jumped at the opportunity and promptly began adding stationery, school supplies, and sewing supplies to bring more value to the store.

Her main goal is to finish her university studies in nursing and then grow her business by providing Internet services and video games. The additional income will be useful to improve her family’s conditions and prepare for the day when she has children. With her Kiva loan Virginia plans to buy writing supplies and home furnishings in preparation for the Day of Love and Friendship (the South American equivalent to Valentine’s Day) since her sales increase during this time.

Virginia is a happy young woman. Her business is located in an area that promotes the development of musical activities that originate from native Caribbean culture.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase writing supplies & home furnishings

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es: Mario Antonio tiene 55 años. Su actividad económica es un taller de carpintería. Hace más de 34 años que se dedica este negocio. Por lo que esta no es la primera experiencia con créditos, pues ha sido una gran experiencia. Inicio desde muy joven con este negocio pues su familia necesitaba de ingresos para mejorar su condición familiar. Mario siempre ha sido un hombre muy responsable, y le ha gustado ganarse el dinero de una manera muy decente y trabajadora.  El sueña con aumentar su negocio. el financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima necesaria ya que tiene muchos pedidos.
texts.en:
Mario Antonio is 55 years old and his economic activity is to operate his own carpenter shop. Mario has been dedicated to this business for more than 34 years. Therefore, this is not his first experience with loans – he has had great experience with them. He began the business when he was very young because his family needed income to improve their condition. Mario has always been a very responsible man and he has enjoyed earning money in a decent and hard-working manner. He dreams of augmenting his business. This loan is for buying necessary primary materials to fulfill the many work requests he has received.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING NECESSARY PRIMARY MATERIALS TO FILL CUSTOMER ORDERS AT HIS CARPENTER SHOP

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CHOQUEQUIRAO”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Teresa; ella tiene 58 años de edad y La socia es madre soltera ella tiene 4 hijos, tres de ellos dependen de la socia aún, ella alterna sus diferentes actividades con la confección y venta de ropas artesanales, ella misma compra la materia prima y elabora las prendas y las vende, ella vende en la cuesta de San Blas, desde hace 20 años, La socia comprara materia prima para elaborar sus ropas, ella hace bolsos de telas pintadas y chalinas, mantas, ponchos, pantalones de bayetas, casacas entre otros. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales y fabricar las prendas.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This partner belongs to the "Choquequirao" community bank; she lives in the Huanchac district in the province and department of Cusco. The partner is Mrs Teresa; she is 58, and a single mother of 4 children, three of whom still depend on her. She alternates her different activities with the making and selling of clothing. She buys the material herself and makes the clothing and sells it. She has sold on the San Blas hill for 20 years. She purchases the material to make her clothing. She makes bags from painted cloth, and scarves, blankets, ponchos, cloth pants, and jackets, among others. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of materials to make her clothing. She infinitely values and appreciates this loan since it will allow her to expand her business and improve her quality of life. She promises to repay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase materials for clothes making

loans.name: Melissa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CHOQUEQUIRAO”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Melissa; ella tiene 32 años de edad y La socia es soltera ella trabaja en el colegio de varones Ciencias, ella es secretaria, la socia también tienen un trabajito extra ella es artesana y elabora anillos, aretes, brazaletes y diferentes adornos, La socia está ahorrando para comprar un automóvil. La  socia solicita el préstamo para amortizar la compra de su nuevo automóvil, ella dará una primera parte y para ello tenía un dinero ahorrado y le falta un poco.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Melissa belongs to the "Choquequirao" community bank; she lives in the district of Huanchac in the province and department of Cusco. She is 32, single, and works in a men's science college. She is a secretary. She also has another small job: she is an artist and makes rings, earrings, bracelets and different accessories. She is saving to buy a car. She is requesting this loan to amortize the purchase of her new car; she will give the first part for which she had some money saved, but she needs a bit more. She infinitely values and appreciates this loan as it will allow her to expand her business and improve her quality of life. She also promises to repay the loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: initial car payment

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CHOQUEQUIRAO”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Luisa; ella tiene 49 años de edad y La socia es madre soltera ella tiene 1 hijo, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, la socia compra materiales de arcilla, pigmentos y mucho más para la elaboración de pequeños ajedrez hechos en cerámica y la cajita de madera, Ella trabaja en este negocio desde hace 8 años y está situada en la plazoleta de San Blas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para la elaboración de artesanía.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This partner belongs to the "Choquequirao" community bank; she lives in the district of Huanchac in the province and department of Cusco. The partner is Mrs Luisa; she is 49, and a single mother of 1 child. She alternates her housework with a retail business. She purchases materials: clay, pigments and much more to make small ceramic chess pieces and wooden boards. She has worked in this business for 8 years and sells from the small plaza of San Blas. She is requesting this loan to purchase materials for her craftwork. She infinitely appreciates and values this loan since it will allow her to expand her business and improve her quality of life. She promises to repay the loan on time.
