Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for the purchase of materials for craftwork

loans.name: Aura Maria

texts.es:
Aura  María B. Sánchez, es una mujer de 68 años que vive en Cartagena en el barrio los Corales, ella se dedica a las confecciones desde que inició su curso de bordados y gradualmente ha ido agregándole nuevas técnicas, que le han permitido mejorar cada día su talento y nuevas formas de generar mas ingresos aprovechando su cautiva clientela, a quien le vende productos cosméticos, de decoración etc. a través de su guía especializada.

Aura una vez emprendió su negocio ingresó a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización con la que ha obtenido  6 créditos y ha mejorado su capacidad productiva, pues antes confeccionaba a las personas, pero ellas le llevaban  su tela y otros materiales, es decir trabajaba  sobre medidas; Hoy gracias a su crecimiento puede confeccionar comprando materia primas e insumos y proponiendo diseños que ella crea de acuerdo a la moda. Con su credikiva comprará materiales para confeccionar muñecos y adornos navideños en una gran proporción, pues ya tiene pedidos de pequeñas misceláneas y con el resto comprará productos de su revista, que ya tiene encargados por sus clientes.

Su negocio ha cambiado su vida, porque ahora es más independiente, con ello ha logrado aportar a su hogar y a la manutención de sus hijos. Su sueño es tener un almacén propio ubicado en su propia casa, donde pueda exhibir sus productos traídos del exterior y trabajar con diseños infantiles.
texts.en:
Aura María B. Sánchez is a 68 year old woman who lives in the Corales neighborhood of Cartagena. She's been manufacturing since she began embroidering and has gradually been adding new techniques. This has allowed her to improve her talent each day. It has also given her new ways to earn income. She has charming customers, to whom she sells cosmetics, decorative items, etc; through her specialized guidance. As soon as Aura started her business, she began working with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, where she has received six previous loans that have allowed her to improve her production capabilities. She used to do work on request for various people who would deliver their fabrics and materials to her. Today, thanks to her growth, she can buy her own supplies and materials and make whatever she thinks is in style. She will use some of the money from this Kiva loan to buy bulk supplies to make dolls and Christmas ornaments. She already has requests for some miscellaneous items. She will use the rest of the money to buy products from her catalog, as she already has some customer orders. Her business has changed her life because it's made her more independent. It has allowed her to contribute to her household and support her children. Her dream is to have a store out of her home, where she can show the products she has for resale and work with children's designs.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CHOQUEQUIRAO”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Mery; ella tiene 39 años de edad y La socia es casada, su esposo es docente en la universidad, ella tiene 2 hijos y se dedica a la artesanía, la socia tiene un stand en Pisac, populoso distrito de artesanos, La socia elabora cuadros, y otros adornos en cerámica desde el año 1997, ella junto a sus esposo han construido su casita con todo el esfuerzo de su trabajo. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materia prima para su negocio.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the "Choquequirao" community bank; she lives in the district of Huanchac in the province and department of Cusco. The partner is Mrs Mery; she is 39 and married. Her husband is a teacher at the university. She has 2 children and is an artist. She has a stand in Pisac, a crowded artists' district. She has made paintings and ceramic decorations since 1997. She and her husband built their little home together with all their hard work. She is requesting this loan to purchase basic materials for her business. She infinitely appreciates and values this loan, since it will allow her to expand her business and improve her quality of life. She promises to repay the loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of basic materials for her business

loans.name: Yaoska Mercedes

texts.es: Yaoska Mercedes es madre luchadora y soltera, tiene 1 hijo menor de edad a su cargo. La señora es dueña de un ciber, en donde trabaja todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, pues siempre está buscando la forma de salir adelante con su hijo.  Ella ya tiene 2 años con este negocio a pesar de los difíciles problemas que han enfrentado ya que ha tenido que dar a componer varios equipos. Ella está muy feliz con el trabajo que realiza pues sin él no tendría lo necesario para  comer todos los días. El financiamiento es para la compra de nuevas computadoras y ciertos productos necesarios.
texts.en:
Yaoska Mercedes is a struggling single mother with one young son who depends on her. She owns a cybercafé where she works every day from 7:00 AM to 9:00 PM. She is constantly looking for new ways to get ahead with her son and has had this business for two years, despite the difficulties she’s faced with having to repair some equipment. She is very happy with the work she does, because if it wasn’t for it, she would not be able afford to eat every day. She will use the money from this loan to buy new computers and other needed products.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Zoila Blanca

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CHOQUEQUIRAO”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Zoila; ella tiene 56 años de edad y La socia es casada ella tiene 2 hijos, ella trabaja en el INPE, instituto nacional y penitencial del estado; ella está aún en servicio y ayuda a sus hijos en sus estudios superiores, La socia está mejorando su casita comprando algunos nuevos muebles. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar un par de muebles.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite mejorar su casita y su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the "Choquequirao" community bank; she lives in the district of Huanchac in the province and department of Cusco. The partner is Mrs Zoila; she is 56, married, and has 2 children. She works in the INPE, a national institute and the state penitentiary. She is in service and helps her children in their higher studies. She is improving her small house through buying various new furniture. She is requesting this loan to purchase some furniture. She infinitely appreciates and values this loan, since it will allow her to improve her small home and her quality of life. She also promises to repay the loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of furniture

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CHOQUEQUIRAO”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Alejandrina; ella tiene 44 años de edad y La socia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar y trabaja en su propio negocio, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su casa y cada cierto tiempo la socia arregla y aumenta mercadería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería y así implementar su negocio.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the "Choquequirao" community bank; she lives in the district of Huanchac in the province and department of Cusco. The partner is Miss Alejandrina; she is 44, lives with her partner and has 2 children. She does housework and works in her own business. She has a small grocery store in her home and at fixed times she organizes and purchases merchandise. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of merchandise with which to expand her business. She infinitely appreciates and values this loan since it will allow her to expand her business and improve her quality of life. She also promises to repay the loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of merchandise to expand her business

loans.name: Junia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CHOQUEQUIRAO”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Junia; ella tiene 43 años de edad y La socia es casada ella tiene 2 hijos, La socia es contadora de profesión, ella alterna sus actividades con la contabilidad, La socia  trabaja en la distribuidora rio negro, La socia desea mejorar su casita y también pagar una mensualidad de su hijo en la universidad, ella pagará con su sueldo poco a poco la deuda. La socia solicita el préstamo para pagar una mensualidad de su hijo y para mejorar su casa con una parte.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Introducing Junia, a member of the “Choquequirao” Communal Bank (Choquequirao is a ruined Incan city; the name is Quechua for “cradle of gold”). He lives in the Huanchac district, located in the province and department of Cusco. Junia is 43 years old, she is married and has 2 children. She is an accountant, and she alternates her accounting activity with a job in a supermarket in Rio Negro. She desires to improve her house and also to pay a university installment for her son. She will repay her debt little by little with her wage. The loan she is requesting will be used to pay a monthly installment for her son and to make improvements in her house. She is really thankful and endlessly values the loan she has been granted, as this allows her to improve the quality of her life; at the same time she commits to complying with paying her dues at the set deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay a monthly installment for her son and to make improvements in her hous

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “CHOQUEQUIRAO”; El socio vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
El socio es el Sr. Juan; el tiene 34 años de edad y el socio es conviviente el tiene 2 hijos, el socio es empleado del INC en Pinaya, Esta institución lo obliga a viajar y a hacer de su trabaja toda una experiencia enriquecedora, ya que este instituto cuida el patrimonio cultural de Cusco y están encargados de preservar los bienes y de descubrir nuevos hallazgos Inkas y pre Inkas. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar una camisa y para sus pasajes.

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite  mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Introducing Juan, a member of the “Choquequirao” Communal Bank (Choquequirao is a ruined Incan city; the name is Quechua for “cradle of gold”). He lives in the Huanchac district, located in the province and department of Cusco. Juan is 34 years old and he lives with his live-in partner and two children. He works for the INC (Instituto Nacionál de Cultura - National Institute of Culture) in the Pinaya office: he travels a lot because of his job, and he makes enriching experiences during his journeys, as this institution takes care of the cultural heritage of Cusco, and it is in charge of the preservation of cultural premises and goods and to discover new findings of the Incan and pre-Incan periods. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a shirt and for his journeys. He is really thankful and endlessly values the loan he has been granted, as this allows him to improve the quality of his life; at the same time he commits to complying with paying his dues at the set deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a shirt and for his journeys.

loans.name: Hector Rosendo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “CHOQUEQUIRAO”; El socio vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
El socio es el Sr. Hector; el tiene 48 años de edad y El socio es casado y tiene 2 hijos, El socio es docente de profesión él trabaja como profesor en el colegio de varones particular la Merced y en la Universidad Nacional. El socio está terminando los acabados de su casa, para lo cual aún está necesitando comprar con urgencia accesorios para los baños. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar accesorios para sus 2 baños.

 El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Introducing Hector, a member of the “Choquequirao” Communal Bank (Choquequirao is a ruined Incan city; the name is Quechua for “cradle of gold”). He lives in the Huanchac district, located in the province and department of Cusco. Hector is 48 years old, he is married and has two children. He is a professor: he teaches at the Colegio La Merced, a private school for boys, and at the National University. To complete the renovation of his house, and to do so he urgently needs to buy bathroom accessories. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy accessories for his 2 bathrooms. He values and is endlessly thankful for the loan he has been granted, as this will help him improve his living conditions; at the same time, he commits to complying with paying his dues at the set deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy accessories for his 2 bathrooms

loans.name: Miguel Geronimo

texts.es: Miguel Geronimo tiene 43 años. Su actividad económica es la compra y venta de ropa. Hace más de 12 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que siempre le ha dado lo necesario a su familia. Miguel tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación pues no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos. Pues siempre está pendiente de los que sus clientes le solicitan y tiene bastantes pedidos el destino del crédito es para la compra de trajes, pantalones faldas y trajes.
texts.en:
Miguel Geronimo is 43 years old. He has been buying and selling clothes for more than 12 years in order to provide for the needs of his family. Miguel has worked with Fundación Leon 2000 for a long time, so this is not the first time he has received a loan.

He is always concerned about what is customers are requesting and that he receives enough orders. The loan will be used to buy dresses, trousers, and skirts.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dresses, trousers, and skirts

loans.name: Celfida Del Carmen

texts.es: Celfida del Carmen tiene 36 años de edad tiene 1 hijo menor de edad a su cargo. Ella se dedica a la venta de tiste y frijoles cocidos, que son muy solicitados por su clientes y vecinos, pues desde muy joven le ha gustado trabajar fuerte.  Ella tiene 2 años de dedicarse a este negocio, el cual dio inicio buscando una fuente alternativa de ingresos para su familia. Su crédito será invertido en la compra de frijoles y tiste. Su meta es continuar invirtiendo en el negocio para tener una fuente ingresos fija.
texts.en:
Celfida del Carmen is 36 years old and has 1 dependent child in her care. Her work is selling tiste [a traditional drink made from corn and cocoa] and cooked beans, which are very popular among her customers and neighbors. Since she was very young, she has enjoyed working hard. She has operated this business for 2 years; she started it because she was looking for an alternative source of income for her family. Her loan will be invested in buying beans and tiste. Her goal is to continue investing in the business so that she can receive a steady source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nicanora

texts.en:
Nicanora A. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Masinadyahon, Brgy. Binicuil, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:  pig fattening, a general store and an eatery businesses.  Her husband, Cezar A., is 73 years old.  They have eight children who are 32 to 50 years old. 

Nicanora joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1989 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Nicanora has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12,000, thus, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 18th loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500, which she intends to use as additional working capital so that she can continue to save up for the future of her family.  Nicanora A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Melve

texts.en:
Melve G. is a 49-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  a general store and a fishing business. She lives in St. Peter Village, Brgy Aguisan, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1996 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and fishing businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000. Melve is now borrowing PHP 17,000 to use as additional working capital.  This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Melve aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.
"

loans.use: Additional wolrking capital

loans.name: Buenaventura

texts.en: Buenaventura P. is from the village of Delusom. She is 58 years old, married and has 3 adult and 1 school-aged children. To make a living, Buenaventura owns and operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Buenaventura has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from these activities. In 2008, Buenaventura joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Buenaventura has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Buenaventura is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Buenaventura from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en: Warlita D. C. is from the village of Sapang Ama, Sapang Dalaga. She is 50 years old, married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Warlita owns and operates a business selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Warlita has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2006, Warlita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Warlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,950 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Warlita is requesting a new loan of 14,950 PHP which will be used to invest in a general store. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Warlita from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in a new general store business

location.town: Sapang Ama Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase blocks of paper and phone cards

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Tonui

texts.en:
Tonui is a hardworking farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He is 30 years old and married with two children, ages 2½ and 6. His eldest child is attending school. 

Tonui has been farming for the last three years and has employed one farmhand. His main products are milk and tea, which he sells to the local market. He also operates a retail shop in the same area.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will help him educate his children and take them to a better school. He faces, however, the challenge of a lack of artificial-insemination services, which leads to less improved breeds.

In five years time, he hopes to have increased his farm. He also hopes that Juhudi will make bigger loans available in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Langat

texts.en:
Langat is 32 years old. He is married and has been blessed with three children, ages 2, 4 and 9. Two of the children are currently attending school. 

Langat has been operating his mixed farm for 10 years and has employed one farmhand. His farm produces pineapples, tea, bananas and milk, which he sells to the local market. He is also employed and earns a salary.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 60,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase a dairy cow. He says that this cow will increase his milk production and he will be able to provide his family with enough milk for consumption. His biggest challenges have been drought, which leads to low production, and unreliable casual laborers.

In the future, he would like to purchase motorbikes to be used in transporting farm produce to the market. He says that Juhudi loans have improved his livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Franz

texts.es: El Sr. Franz, nacido en la provincia Cordillera en Santa Cruz 4 de octubre de 1984 casado con doña Leidy con 3 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, agricultor hace 10 años que compro una parcela de 19 hectareas en el Porvenir a 85 Km de la provincia cordillera municipio de Cabezas, en la cual vive y trabaja de la agricultura, Siembra Maiz, sorgo, Frijol tambien tiene su ganado vacuno, el trabaja o hace sembrar con tractor, el dinero del credito lo utilizara para el preparado de la tierra para la siembra comtratara mano de obra y alquilara el tractor, es joven y muy trbajador, esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada enn la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Franz was born on October 4th, 1984, in the Cordillera province in Santa Cruz. He is married to Leidy, and they have three school age children. He has been a farmer for ten years. He bought a parcel of land that is 19 hectares. It is located in Porvenir, which is 85 kilometers from the Cordillera province in the Cabezas municipality. He lives and does his farming work there. He grows corn, sorghum, and beans. He also has cattle. He works or plants with a tractor. He will use the loan to prepare the land for planting. He will hire workers for the labor and rent the tractor. He is a very hard-working young man. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their trust by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor cost to prepare the land for planting and cost of renting a tractor

loans.name: Rosario 	Virginia

texts.es: La Señora Rosario dedicada a la venta de hamburguesas, vende todas las noches pero realiza la preparación de sus hamburguesas todos los días, ya hace  dos años atrás que vende y tiene una venta considerable para mantener a sus hijas, ya ella se encuentra sola como madre y padre para sus hijas, por los años de uso del carrito que tiene para este negocio este  actualmente se encuentra deteriorado y es necesario cambiar por otro nuevo y este es el motivo para el cual la señora necesita el crédito, es muy trabajadora y responsable y esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgación del credito.
texts.en:
Rosario sells hamburgers. She sells them every night, and she prepares the hamburgers everyday. She started selling two years ago. She makes considerable sales in order to support her daughters. This is because she is alone, and she is mother and father to her daughters. The cart that she has for her business is now falling apart from years of use. She needs to get a new one. That is why she needs a loan. She is very hard-working and responsible. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their trust by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy another cart for selling hamburgers

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es: El Señor Vicente dedicado al trabajo dela Carpintería  cuenta con maquinas necesarias para realizar los trabajos, el cliente requiere de material para realizar sus pedidos en su trabajo, el Señor tiene una experiencia en su trabajo desde hace 5 años atrás, con este trabajo puede mantener a su familia y hacer estudiar a sus  hijos que en algunas ocasiones lo ayudan a terminar los trabajos requeridos pero en este momento le falta madera para concluir un trabajo importante que le surgió y necesita cumplir con estos pedidos  es por este motivo que el cliente requiere el crédito, para la compra de madera para realizar muebles, es muy trabajador y responsable siempre pensando en el bienestar de su familia, esta muy agradecido con la institución por la oportunidad que le brindan en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Vicente works in carpentry. He has the necessary machines to do the work. He needs the material to make the orders he has in his work. He has a lot of experience in his work. He has been doing it for five years. With this work he is able to support his family and educate his children. Sometimes they help him finish his work. However, he does not now have the wood to finish an important job that has come up, and he needs to fill the orders. That is why he needs the loan to buy wood to make furniture. He is very hard-working and responsible. He is always thinking of his family’s well-being. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their trust by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood to make furniture

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: La Sra. Beatriz, es cliente antigua se dedica al oficio D. la panaderia y reposteria más D. veinte años, ella vive en la zona sur y realiza trabajos D. reposteria como empanadas, pasteles, queques, tortas, que lleva a las pastelerias y snacks D. la zona central, ella vive con sus dos hijos, quienes ya son profesionales, y constantemente viajan, ella juntamente con su hermana se dedican a esta actividad, la Sra. quedo viuda hace 15 años y se dedico a trabajar en la reposteria, con dicha actividad saco adelante a sus hijos, ahora como cliente nuestra es nuy responsable en sus pagos, y este prestamo lo destinará a la compra D. harina y otros materiales e insumos que necesita para su actividad, al margen tambien reparte víveres a credito y va cobrando cada mes o semanalmente segun D. como acomoda los productos, es muy trabajadora.
texts.en:
Beatriz is an old client of ours, who for more than 20 years has operated a bakery and pastry shop. She lives in the southern zone of the city and bakes meat pies, pastry, cakes, and makes sandwiches which she delivers to pastry and snack shops in the center of the city. Beatriz lives with her 2 children, who are already professionals and constantly travel. She works with her sister in this activity. Beatriz was left a widow 15 years ago and dedicates herself to her pastry shop. By means of this activity, she has advanced her children. As a client, Beatriz is very responsible in her payments, and this loan will be used to buy flour and other ingredients necessary for her bakery. On the siD., she also sells groceries on credit and collects monthly or weekly, according to the product, whichever proves convenient. Beatriz is very hard-working.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING FLOUR AND OTHER SUPPLIES FOR HER BAKERY

loans.name: Wilfredo Rene

texts.es: El Sr. Wilfredo es cliente antiguo de la Institución, Anteriormente fue cliente Kiva, ahora solicita un incremento leve en su credito para compra de motor para el transporte que tiene y que lo trabaja en el trufi 1 por las noches, el Sr. Wilfredo es de ocupacion Mecanico, es una persona muy  activa, juntamente con su esposa quien le colabora en la venta de lubricanres, el vive con su esposa y sus dos hijas que se encuentran estudiando en colegio, generalmente se encuentran todos en el taller y tienda, pero ambos con el trabajo que realizan durante muchos años adquirieron un terreno donde estan construyendo su casita, el cliente es muy responsable en sus pagos, y esta muy agardecido con la institucion por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is an old client of our institution. He has borrowed from Kiva in the past, and now he is requesting a new loan in order to buy a motor for his means of transport, which he needs since he works at night for La Paz's urban transportation system. Wilfredo is a mechanic and a very active person. He also collaborates with his wife in selling lubricants. He lives with his wife and their 2 daughters who are still in school. Generally, Wilfredo and his wife may be found in the shop or the store. The two of them, with the work they have done over many years, have been able to acquire land where they are now constructing a small house. Wilfredo is very responsible in his payments, and is very grateful to our institution for the loan opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING A MOTOR FOR HIS CAR

loans.name: Virginia Leandra

texts.es: La Sra. Virginia es cliente desD. el año 2000,ella es una persona muy responsable y cumplida, comenzó trabajando con grupo solidario D. tres personas, posteriormente se disolvio el grupo, solicitando un credito individual, ella destina sus créditos para aumento D. mercadería, se pueD. evidenciar en su negocio que esta surtido en varios productos y por la ubicación que tiene es bastante concurrida, ya que es una tienda en el camino D. acceso a dos zonas Coqueni y Santa Fé, ella vive con su esposo y sus hijas una D. ellas casada y que a veces cuida D. su nieta, y la otra hija es estudiante, con el dinero del credito comprara frutas, verduras, galletas, refrescos, abarrotes, dulces, etc. esta muy agradecida con Emprender y kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion dle credito.
texts.en:
Virginia has been a client since 2000; she is a very responsible and dependable person. She began working with a solidarity group of three people; later, the group dissolved and requested individual loans. Virginia has used her loans to increase her stock of merchandise. This is reflected in her business, which is well-stocked with a range of products. Thanks to its location, it receives a lot of traffic, since it is a store on the access road to two areas, Coqueni and Santa Fé. Virginia lives with her husband and her daughters. One of her daughters is married, and Virginia sometimes takes care of her granddaughter. The other daughter is a student. With the funds from the loan, Virginia will buy fruits, vegetables, cookies, crackers, soft drinks, candy and other assorted grocery items. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence placed in her in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise such as candy, soft drinks, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Soo

texts.en: Soo and her husband started their dry cleaning business 12 years ago in Queens, New York. After moving to the United States in the early '70s, Soo knew that, with her experience in the dry cleaning business, she would one day open up her own storefront. With the help of their two children, their dry cleaning business became a staple in their community. With the economic recession, Soo’s business suffered from increased prices. With increases in oil, supplies and energy resources, Soo was forced to increase prices in her store. However, with strategic cutbacks and determination, her business was able to keep its doors open. Today, Soo has her third loan with ACCION USA. This loan will allow her to buy a new dry cleaning machine. Without this machine, Soo was forced to send many of her clients to a different dry cleaning business. This loan will allow her to retain more of the clients that come into her store and offer more specialized services. Soo and her husband dream of eventually opening a dry cleaning business in Manhattan. With the confidence of having weathered the worst of the economic crisis, Soo is optimistic about their business’s future. Soo says her greatest success with owning her own business has been sending her eldest son to a university in New York. About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA Have you ever thought about how the cute new café on your corner or the salon you frequent every month got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis”. Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education. Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild the economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: To purchase a new dry cleaning machine

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: La Sra. Angela es cliente antigua, ella se dedica a la venta de repuestos y accesorios de transporte, en la zona chasquipampa y en la Feria de la ciudad de El Alto, ella trabaja solo con Emprender, la señora vive con su esposo y sus hijos pequeños que se encuentran en edad escolar,los creditos que saca los invierte en la compra de mercadería, como llantas, tapa aros, parrillas, etc. el esposo se dedica a la compra y venta de autos, y de esa manera él la traslada a la Feria de la 16 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto. es una cliente responsable y puntual en sus pagos, esta muy agardecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Angela is a longstanding client. Her business is selling spare parts and accessories for vehicles, in the area of Chasquipampa and at the market in the city of El Alto. She works individually with Emprender. She lives with her husband and her young children, who are of school age. She has invested her loans in buying merchandise, such as tires, hubcaps, grilles, etc. Her husband's work is buying and selling cars. He transports her to the "July 16" market in the city of El Alto. Angela is a responsible client who is punctual with her payments. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence placed in her in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying auto parts for her business

loans.name: Angel Brady

texts.es:
Angel tiene 21 años de edad, es soltero y vive en casa de un familiar ubicada en el distrito de Chpén, una zona agrícola de regular movimiento comercial perteneciente a la provincia del mismo nombre, se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a brindar servicios de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para brindar servicio de transporte). El brinda su servicio por los diversos sectores de su distrito desde muy temprano por la mañana hasta muy avanzada la tarde, gracias a los ingresos que percie de esta actividad solventa sus gastos personales y ayuda a sus familiares.

El continuo uso que le otorga al vehículo y el estado accidentado de las calles de la ciudad donde vive han hecho que su unidad móvil sufra algunos daños que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le permitan arreglar los daños, dar mantenimiento e implementar su herramienta de trabajo con mas accesorios.

Angel es una joven tranquilo y responsable, en la zona donde vive las personas que lo conocen le consideran alguien de confianza y que siempre está dispuesto a ayudar cuando se le necesita.
texts.en:
Angel is 21 years old and single. He lives with a relative in the district of Chepén, an agricultural zone and a regular trade route located in the province of the same name. It lies in the region of La Libertad, one hour from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. Angel works providing cargo and passenger transportation services on a moto-taxi (a vehicle consisting of a motorcycle with an attached cabin to provide transportation services). He provides his service across the various areas of his district, starting very early in the morning and finishing very late in the evening. Thanks to his income from this work, he is able to cover his personal expenses and help his family members. The continuous use of his vehicle, and the poor condition of the roads in the city where he lives, have led to some damage to his mobile unit which requires urgent repair so that his moto-taxi will operate properly. For this reason, he has decided to request a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa, in the amount of 2000 Peruvian new soles, which will allow him to repair the damage, carry out maintenance, and equip his working vehicle with more accessories. Angel is a well-mannered and responsible young man. In the area where he lives, the people who know him consider him someone they can trust and someone who is always willing to provide help when needed.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairing and maintaining his moto-taxi

loans.name: Saúl

texts.es:
Saúl es un padre de familia de 55 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos en el caserío Colera, una zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito agrícola caracterizado por dedicarse principalmente al cultivo de plantas frutales, las frutas que producen son procesadas para luego ser exportadas al extranjero. Pertenece a la provincia de Piura, ubicado en la región del mismo nombre, situada a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de 20 años a la crianza y venta de animales menores: el cría aves de corral y ovejas en diversos corrales situados cerca a su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentan el lugar en donde vive. Esta actividad le provee de ingresos estables los cuales utiliza en el sostenimiento de los gastos familiares. Adicionalmente tiene una mototaxi (motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para utilizarla en actividades de transporte de carga y pasajeros) y también se dedica a la agricultura.

Saúl desea mejorar la alimentación de los animales que cría para así poder obtener mayores ingresos al momento de venderlos, siguiendo su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de alimento balanceado.

Saúl es un padre bastante responsable y trabajador, el siempre ha dado lo mejor de si para poder sacar adelante a su familia. Su anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para mejorar la calidad de vida de los suyos.
texts.en:
Saúl is a 55-year-old father of the family who lives together with his wife and two children in the village of Colera. It is a rural area of the district of Tambogrande, an agricultural district characterized for its work mainly with the cultivation of fruit plants. The fruits that they produce are processed to later be exported abroad. Tambogrande belongs to the province of Piura, located in the region of Piura, more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo.

For more than 20 years he has worked in the rearing and sale of younger animals. He raises fowl and sheep in various farmyards located close to his home. When these animals have achieved a good point of development, he sells them to the businessmen that frequent the area where he lives. This business provides him with stable income, which he uses toward family expenses. Additionally, he has a mototaxi (a motorcycle that has a cab attached to use in the transportation of cargo and passengers) and he also works in agriculture.

Saúl wants to improve the feeding of the animals that he raises to be able to obtain more income upon selling them. Continuing with his goal, he has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for the first time of 1500 PEN, which he plans to invest in the purchase of feed.

Saúl is a very responsible and hardworking father. He has always given the best of him to be able to help his family succeed. His hope is to continue growing as a businessman to improve the quality of living of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of feed to improve his business of raising and selling animals.

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es: El Sr. Gonzalo es cliente nuevo que se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir de señoras, especialmente embarazadas, el realiza trabajos de vestidos, polerones, pantalones etc, y distribuye en la zona sur, en las tiendas, tambien dichas tiendas le proporcionan los modelos de trajes o ropa que necesitan, el St. Gonzalo vive con su esposa y sus hijas que se encuentrtan en edad escolar, el generalmente se encuentra en su casa, en el taller que tiene instalado allí, la esposa se dedica a trabajar de empleada del hogar por la zona sur. El crédito que solicita lo empleara en la compra de telas y otros materiales que necesita para sun trabajo, este oficio lo realiza desde hace mas de trece años.
texts.en:
Mr. Gonzalo is a new client. He makes ladies’ garments, specializing in maternity wear. He also makes work clothes, sweatshirts, trousers, etc. which he distributes to the stores in the Zona Sur. In turn, these stores provide him with suit or clothing models as needed. Mr. Gonzalo lives with his wife and school aged daughters. Usually, he is at home in his workshop. His wife is a domestic worker in the Zona Sur. He will use the loan to purchase fabric and other materials for his work. He has worked in this trade for over thirteen years.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabic

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: La Sra. Paulina es cliente antiguo lleva trabajando en Emprender desD. el año 2004 primero trabajo en grupo solidario y tiempo despues desidio trabajar D. manera individual.  La señora vive en casa propia, la actividad a la que la cliente se dedica es a la venta D. ropa D. niños y ropa juvenil la cual la realiza por las mañana en la Calle Tumusla un mercado muy conocido D. la ciudad D. la Paz, la venta la realiza por mayor y al por menor. la Sra. Paulina es una persona emprendedora con ganas D. salir adelante y responsable en sus pagos el prestamo lo invertira en la compra por mayor D. pantalones D. corderoy y jeans para niños, esta muy agardecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada el la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Paulina is a former client and she has been working with Emprender since 2004. She first worked in a solidarity group and after, she decided to work individually. She lives in her own home and she works selling clothing for children and young people. She sells the clothing in the mornings on Tumusla Street, a well-known market in the city of La Paz. She sells both wholesale and retail. Paulina is a very enterprising person with the desire to get ahead, and she is responsible with her payments. She will use the loan to invest in the purchase of wholesale corduroy pants and jeans for children. She is very grateful for Emprender and Kiva for the trust provided in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Carlos Romeo

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 54 años de edad reside en el municipio de Santa Elena, Departamento de Usulután, es casado, vive con la esposa y su pequeño hijo de 6 años de edad, tiene un comedor y vena de pupusas.
El negocio surgió gracia a la ayuda de la esposa quien siempre se ha dedicado a la venta de pupusas, el negocio lo maneja el y tiene dos empleadas que les apoyan con las actividades, el horario de atención es de 6:00am- 6:00pm actualmente no cuenta con dinero por lo solita un préstamo para invertirlo en compra de silla y mesas para el local y dar una mejor atención a los clientes, también en la compra de materiales para elaboración de comida. esto contribuirá al crecimiento del negocio, mejorar los ingresos familiares.
Las aspiraciones son tener un local amplio para el negocio y generar las condiciones para mejorar las condiciones de vida de la familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is 54 years old, he is married and has a 6 year-old son, and they live in the Santa Elena community, located in the Usulután department. He owns a restaurant where he sells papusas (a traditional Salvadoran dish made of thick, hand-made corn tortilla filled with a blend of either cheese, vegetables or meat). He was able to open the restaurant thanks to wife’s help, as she has always engaged in selling papusas. He manages the restaurant and has two employees helping him with the various activities; working hours are from 6 am to 6 pm. As he cannot count on much money right now, he is requesting a loan to buy chairs and tables for the restaurant, thus better tending to his customers; he will also buy ingredients to prepare food. This will contribute to the growth of his activity and to the improvement of the family income. He wishes to widen the space of his restaurant and to create the conditions to improve the living conditions of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chairs and tables for his restaurant and ingredients to prepare meals.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La Señora Margarita  es un cliente que ya saco varios créditos en la institución, ella tiene dos actividades la primera es la venta de ropa en la zona 16 de julio su negocio que ahora esta activo es la venta de maquinas ella compra maquinas por parte primero compra la cabeza y luego el motor, ella se dedica tanto  a la venta como también al armado, este trabajo es considerado duro por el gran peso que tiene las maquinas, su esposo es importador de maquinas industriales por lo cual el no se encuentra en su casa, ellos tienen dos hijos que son aun pequeños, la labor de la señora margarita es sacrificado por el esfuerzo que realiza la cliente, el crédito será invertido en la compra de maquinas japonesas, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada  en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Margarita is a client that has already taken out several loans with Emprender. She works in two areas. The first is in clothing sales in the 16 de julio zone. Her business that is currently active is in the sales of machines. She purchases machines by part; she first purchases the head and then the motor. She works both in sales and in the assembly. This job is considered to be hard because of the heavy weight of the machines. Her husband is an importer of industrial machines and as a result, he is not at home. They have two children that are still young. Margarita sacrifices a great deal of effort for her work. The loan will be invested in the purchase of Japanese machines. She is very grateful for Emprender and Kiva for the trust provided in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of Japanese machines.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: El Sr. Luis Alberto  y su esposa la Sra. Lenny llevan 12  años de casados, ellos viven en la  zona de Guaracachi 4° anillo Barrio, "21 de enero", de la cuidad de Santa Cruz, viven en una casa Familiar (suegra)  la cual viven con sus tres hijos  2 que están en el colegio y uno que es bebe. El sr. Luis Alberto y su  esposa vivieron 3 años en España ya que  reunieron capital para comprarse un microbus, trabaja de transporte  urbano de la linea 40 hace 5 años.  la Sra. Lenny trabaja de promotora de cosméticos de belleza   para ayudar en los gastos familiares . El credito que se le otorgo al cliente será destinado para la compra  de una bomba Hidraulica para mejorar su micro, esta muy agardecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindad en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Señor Luis Alberto and his wife, Señora Lenny, have been married for 12 years. They live in the zone of Guaracachi in the 4th ring Neighborhood, "21st of January", city of Santa Cruz. They live in a Family house (mother-in-law) where they live with their three children, 2 of whom attend school and one that is a baby. Señor Luis Alberto and his wife lived in Spain for 3 years where they raised the capital to buy a microbus. He has worked in urban transportation, line 40, for 5 years. Señora Lenny promotes beauty cosmetics to help with the family expenses. The loan that is offered to the client will be used to purchase of a hydraulic pump to improve his microbus. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust shown to him in offering the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a hydraulic pump for his microbus

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma tiene 53 años D. edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos, vive junto a su familia en el caserío La Coruña, una zona rural que pertenece al distrito D. TambogranD., un distrito agrícola dedicado principalmente al cultivo D. frutas, pertenece a la provincia D. Piura y se encuentra ubicado en la región del mismo nombre, a mas D. tres horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a labores asociadas a la agricultura desD. que era muy joven, como la mayor parte D. agricultores D. la zona se dedica a la siembra D. arboles frutales, ella siembra limón en una pequeña parcela D. terreno y cuando lo cosecha los ofrece en venta a las diversas plantas procesadoras D. la zona, las cuales manufacturan sus productos para luego exportarlos al extrajero. Esta es una fuente importante D. ingresos para su familia. Adicionalmente cría y venD. animales menores como cerdos, patos y pavos.

Norma desea realizar actividades D. mantenimiento D. su cultivo D. limón para asegurarse una buena producción, por ello ha creído pertinente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1200 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra D. fertilizantes, D. modo que pueda lograr su objetivo.

Norma es una mujer trabajadora y que siempre da lo mejor D. si para sacar adelante a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para brindarle a sus hijos la oportunidad D. tener algun tipo D. estudo superior.
texts.en:
Norma is 53 years of age. She is married and has two children. She lives with her family in the La Coruña settlement , a rural zone that belongs to the district of TambogranD., which is an agricultural district dedicated chiefly to the cultivation of fruit which belongs to the province of Piura and is located in the region of the same name, over three hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. She has been dedicated to agriculture since she was very young, Like most of the farmers of the zone, she is dedicated to sowing fruit-bearing trees. She sows lemon in a small plot of land. When she harvests it, she offers them for sale to the various food processing plants of the zone, which manufacture their products in order to export them to foreign countries. This is an important source of income for their family. Additionally she raises and sells animals such as hogs, ducks and turkeys. Norma wants to maintain her lemon orchard to be assured of good production. Because of this she has requested a loan of 1200 new soles from Edpyme Alternative for the first time that she plans to invest in the purchase of fertilizers, so that she can achieve her objective. Norm is a hard-working woman who always gives the best of herself to move her family ahead. Her greatest dream is is to continue working to offer her children the opportunity of having some type of higher education.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to improve her lemon crop

loans.name: Silvia Yaquelin

texts.es: La Sra. Silvia, se dedica a la comercialización de productos como té, flan, gelatinas, refrescos y otros, viene trabajando hace 10 años en el rubro de forma autónoma desde hace 4 años, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo tienen 4 hijos de los cuales 2 trabajan y estudian y los otros 2 solo estudian y dependen de sus padres, los productos que comercializa los trae de la ciudad de La Paz ya que la distribuidora con la que trabajaba la señora Silvia se mudo para esa ciudad y es desde allá que hace traer sus productos. La comercialización de sus productos los realiza en los mercados de La Ramada y Primavera teniendo clientas fijas, también distribuye sus productos en algunas otras provincias como Montero y Guarayos. Con el esfuerzo de su trabajo ya logro comprarse un terreno donde a construido su modesto hogar. En un futuro quiere que su negocio crezca mucho mas, para lo cual necesitara un vehículo mas grande, actualmente tiene una vagoneta Corolla en el cual distribuye todos sus productos con la ayuda de su esposo, el dinero del credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia como gelatina refrescos, sopas instantaneas, etc.
texts.en:
Silvia's work is selling products such as tea, flan, gelatines, soft drinks and others. She has worked in this field for 10 years, and independently for 4 years. Her husband supports her in her work. They have 4 children: two of them are both working and studying, and the other 2 are only studying and are dependent on their parents. They bring the products they sell from the city of La Paz, since the distributor Silvia works with moved that that city, and so she gets her products there. They sell their products at the markets of La Ramada and Primavera, where they have steady customers. They also distribute their products in other provinces, such as Montero and Guarayos. Through hard work and effort, Silvia has already been able to buy a piece of land where the family built their modest home. In the future, she wants her business to grow much more. For this, she needs a larger vehicle; she currently has a Corolla wagon, which she uses to distribute all of her products with her husband's help. She will use the funds from the loan to buy merchandise such as gelatine, soft drinks, instant soups, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise such as gelatine and soft drinks

loans.name: Carmen María

texts.es:
Carmen es madre soltera, tiene 51 años de edad y vive junto a su hijo, ya adulto, en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que produce principalmente frutas las cuales venden a las plantas procesadoras de la zona, que a su vez las exportan al extranjero. La zona pertenece a la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nonbre y se encuentra ubicada a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de cerveza en su domicilio, ella adquiere sus bebidas directamente de la distribuidora y las ofrece en venta a los vecinos y pobladores de la zona. Este negocio le ha permitido salir adelante y progresar a través de los años, por lo que ella siempre trata de dar lo mejor de si para mantenerse en el negocio. Debido al tiempo que lleva en el rubro y a la buena atención que brinda se ha hecho conocida en y actualmente cuenta con un grupo de clientes fieles.

Carmen desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo mas mercadería, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le permitan realizar su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer bastante trabajadora y luchadora, en la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una mujer responsable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Carmen is a single mother, aged 51. She lives with her son, who is already an adult, in the district of Tambogrande. This is an agricultural zone, mainly producing fruits to be sold to the processing plants in the area, which in turn export them abroad. The zone belongs to Piura province, in the region of the same name. It is located more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. Carmen works selling beer in her home. She buys her beverages directly from the distributor, and she offers them for sale to her neighbors and villagers in the area. This business has allowed her to get ahead and make progress over the years. She has always tried to give the best of herself to keep her business going. Thanks to her long experience in the business and the excellent service she provides, she has become well-known and currently has a group of loyal customers. She would like to expand her business and acquire more merchandise. In order to achieve her aim, she has decided to request a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa, in the amount of 1500 Peruvian new soles, which will allow her to reach her objective. Carmen is a very hard-working and determined woman. In the area where she lives, her neighbors and others who know her consider her a responsible woman who can be trusted.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying beverages to expand her business

loans.name: Emily Pilar

texts.es: La solicitante tiene 23 años es conviviente tiene 2 hijos vive en casa de sus padres se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos y su conyuge tiene una mototaxi que  la trabaja  manejando tiene experiencia crediticia y buenas referencias personales solicita dicho credito para capital de trabajo, se propone por contar  con capacidad y sobre todo voluntad de pago.
texts.en:
This borrower is 23 years old. She has a live-in partner and 2 children, and she lives in her parents' house. Her work is raising and selling pigs. Her partner has a moto-taxi which he uses to provide transport services. She has previous experience with loans and excellent personal references. She is requesting the current loan for working capital, based on her ability in her business and her determination to pay back the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: El Señor Edwin  es un cliente que ya saco varios créditos en la institución, demostró puntualidad en los pagos, el tiene la actividad de venta de DVDs en el alto específicamente tiene dos puestos uno en la avenida Panorámica y otro en la ceja eje central de la ciudad de el alto, el actualmente compra los DVDS  en la frontera del Perú a un precio muy bajo y los vende en la ciudad de el alto, el ahora quiere incursionar en el quemado de los DVDs  así ahora el produciría los DVDs desde el quemado hasta la venta, el señor Edwin es una persona muy innovadora, en la actualidad el señor Edwin no tiene pareja pero piensa en futuro para crear un buen capital para su futura familia, el crédito será invertido en la compra de una torre quemadora que lo utilizara en el quemado de los DVDs.
texts.en:
Edwin is a client who has had several loans with the institution. He has demonstrated punctuality with his payments. Edwin sells DVDs in El Alto. He has two stands; one is on Panorámica Avenue. The other is in the La Ceja, the central hub of El Alto. He currently buys the DVDs on the Peruvian border at a very low price. He sells them in the city of El Alto. He now wants to venture into burning the DVDs. That way he would produce the DVDs from the time he burns them until he sells them Edwin is a very innovative person. At the present time he does not have a life partner. He thinks about the future and making good money for his future family. He will use the loan to buy a DVD burner tower, which he will use to burn the DVDs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a DVD burner tower

loans.name: Monica Elvira

texts.es: La Sra. Monica tiene 39 años de edad ella es soltera , cuenta con casa propia de material de adobe de un piso ubicado en el Distrito de La Tinguiña. No cuenta con carga familiar. La Sra. Monica se  dedica a su negocio de la venta de hamburguesas, ella viene realizando esa actividad hace 5 años. Monica tiene muchos sueños y objetivos mas que realizar uno de ellos es poder tener un negocio de la venta de comida, con el dinero que solicita invertira en mejoras de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Monica is 39 years old and single. She has her own one-story house made of adobe, located in the district of La Tinguiña. She does not have dependent family members. Monica's work is selling hamburgers, which she has done for the past 5 years. Monica still has many dreams and goals to achieve. One of them is having a larger business selling food. With the funds she is requesting, she will invest in improving her house.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improving her home

loans.name: Katerine Yuliana

texts.es: Katerine  tiene 21 años de edad, ella vive en la casa de su cuñada. En el distrito de la Tinguiña casa de material noble de un piso. Katerine se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, se inicio ayudando. Ella es una persona muy joven con muchos sueños y objetivos uno de ellos es poder tener un negocio propio. Con el dinero que solicita realizara algunos gastos personales.
texts.en:
Katerine is 21 years old and lives in her sister-in-law's home. It is a one-story house made of solid materials, located in the district of La Tinguiña. Katerine's work is selling beauty products. She began as an assistant. She is still very young and has many dreams and goals. One of them is having her own business. With the funds she is requesting, she will make some personal purchases.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal purchases

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Angelica vive en casa con sus tres hijas, una de las cuales se encuentra culminando sus estudios superiores, motivo por el cual Angelica desea invertir en la titulación de su hija, para lo cual ella es esfuerza mucho trabajando en su panaderia-bodega que tiene en su casa, sus clientes son los vecinos de la zona quienes regresan siempre ya que ella los atiende con gran simpatia y amabilidad, el sueño de Angelica es poder expandir su panaderia y poder tener asi mayores ingresos para la munutención de sus hijas, se le otorga el crédito por contar con capacidad de pago.
texts.en:
Angelica lives at home with her three daughters. One of them is finishing her bachelor’s degree. Angelica wants pay for her daughter’s graduation expenses. In order to do that she is putting forth much effort working in her bakery-general store, which is in her house. Her customers are her neighbors in the area. They always return because she waits on them with great congeniality and kindness. Angelica’s dream is to be able to expand her bakery. She also dreams of being able to have more income to support her daughters. She qualifies for the loan because of her ability to pay.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for her daughter's graduation expenses

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto se dedica a la pesca artesanal hace ya varios años, el vive en casa con su esposa, no tiene hijos en edad escolar, el sueña con poder implementar su negocio de la pesca, para lo cual debe comprar redes que le permitan realizar su actividad y tener mayores ingresos y asi poder darle a su esposa una mejor calida de vida, se le otorga el crédito por contar con capacidad de pago y buenas referencias personales.
texts.en:
Roberto has worked as a small-scale fisherman for several years now. He lives in a house with his wife, and they do not have children of school age. He dreams of being able to expand his fishing business. For this purpose, he needs to buy nets that would let him do his work, earn a better income, and thus give his wife a better quality of life. The loan has been offered to him because he has shown that he has the ability to pay and good personal references.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying nets for his fishing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase different kinds of seeds for his farm

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita C. is a 52-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: a general store and a farming business. She lives in Sto. San Juan, Barangay Caradio-an, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. Teresita has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2001 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and farming businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 3,000. Teresita is now borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she can use it as additional capital for her businesses. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 3,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Teresita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue in its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her businesses

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: Maribel L. is a 35-year-old married woman who supports her family by engaging in dressmaking, pig fattening and a business selling soft drinks. She lives in Barangay Dakit, Bogo City, Cebu, with her 42-year-old husband, Jose L., who works as a salesman, and their two school-aged children who are 9 and 12 years old. Maribel has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her dressmaking, pig fattening and soft drinks businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 6,200. Maribel is now borrowing Php 18,000 so that she can use it as additional working capital for her businesses. This will be her 5th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 14,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Maribel aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her businesses

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.en:
Enriqueta B. is a married woman who lives in the village of Don Salvador Benedicto, Pontevedra, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a general store and a house-for-rent business. Her husband, Sofio B., is a 68-year-old retired employee who now has the time to help with his wife's business activities. They have eight children who are 24 to 45 years old.

Enriqueta joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she hoped for something better for her family. With the help of her past seventeen loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, thus uplifting her family's standard of living.

This time, for her 18th loan, Enriqueta is borrowing PHP 12,000 which she intends to use to buy additional items for her general store so that she can continue to save for future business expansion.

Enriqueta is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 


About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue in its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: To buy additional items for her general store

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es:
María tiene 57 años D. edad, resiD. en el Municipio D. Berlín, departamento D. Usulután, es casada, vive con el esposo, tiene venta D. Frutas, Verdura y productos D. primera necesidad.
El negocio lo tiene en el mercado Municipal D. Berlín y su horario D. atenderlo es D. 6:00am a 5:00pm, tiene 20 años D. manejar el negocio.
Ella necesita un préstamo para comprar arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, tómales, cebolla, repollo, plátanos, manzanas y uvas, esto contribuirá para mejorar el negocio lo ayudara a fortalecerlo.
Las aspiraciones son mejorar las aspiraciones empresariales, mejorar el sistema D. vida D. la familia.
texts.en:
María is 57 years old, she is married and she lives in the Berlín community, located in the Usulután department. She sells fruits, vegetables and groceries. She has a stall in the municipal market of Berlín, and her working hours are from 6 am to 5 pm, and she has been running it for 20 years. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy rice, beans, oil, sugar, toilet paper, támales (a traditional Latin American dish maD. of dough and steamed or boiled in a leaf wrapper), onions, cabbages, bananas, apples and grapes: this will help her improving and strengthening her activity. She wishes to achieve her entrepreneurial dreams and to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different varieties of products to sell.

loans.name: Fany Karina

texts.es:
Fany tiene 33 años D. edad resiD. en el Municipio D. San Elena, Departamento, D. Usulutan, es casada, vive junto con el esposo con sus dos hijos D. las edades D. 2 y 7 años, tiene una venta D. pupusas y antojitos.
El negocio está ubicado en la casa D. habitación el horario D. atención es D. 4:00am - 9:00pm es una persona emprendedora que le gusta el trabajo que realiza, ella necesita un préstamo para compra D. materiales para elaboración D. pupusas, como son quesillo, chicharrón, maíz, yuca, plátanos, aceite, esta inversión contribuirá al crecimiento del negocio, mejorar la ventas, tener más clientes, mejorar los ingresos.
Los sueños esta tener un negocio que le permita ofrecer productos nuevos para atraer a los clientes, para apoyar a la familia mejorándoles el sistema D. vida.
texts.en:
Fany is 33 years old and lives in the municiipality of San Elena, in the Department of Usulutan. She is married and lives wtih her husband and two children ages two and seven. She sells pupusas (stuffed corn tortillas) and appetizers. Her business is located in her home and she works from four in the morning until nine at night. She is an enterprising person who likes her job. She needs a loan to buy the ingredients to make pupusas like cheese, corn, yuca, plantains, and oil. This loan will contribute to the growth of her busienss, increase her sales, increase her clientel, and increase her earnings. Her dream is to have a business that allows her to offer new products to attract more custoemrs in order to support her family and improve their way of life.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy: cheese, corn, yuca, plantains, and oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of shirts, pants, women's dresses

loans.name: Esmeralda Elizeth

texts.es:
Esmeralda tiene 34 años D. edad, es casada, vive con el esposo y tiene tres hijos Luis, Alejandro y Daniela, ella se dedica a venta D. productos lácteos.
 El negocio está ubicado en la casa D. habitación, venD. D. queso, crema, quesillo;  los clientes son en mayoría los vecinos y personas que circulan por la zona, actualmente  ella solicita  un préstamo para compra D. materiales D. reparación D. techo y canal D. drenaje D. agua lluvia, ya que por las fuertes lluvias se inunda D. agua la casa. Esto contribuirá a mejorar las condiciones D. la casa y evitar riegos mayores.
Las aspiraciones son cuidar la salud D. los hijos, apoyarlos con los estudios para realicen una carrera universitaria, mejorar las condiciones D. vida D. la familia.
texts.en:
Esmeralda is 34 years old. She is married, lives with her husband, and has three children; Luis, Alejandro, and Daniela. She sells milk products from her home, including cheese, cream, and milk curd. Most of her customers are her neighbors and other people who pass through the zone. She is asking for this loan in order to buy building materials so that she can repair her roof and rain water drainage system, because the heavy rains cause her house to flood. This will improve their living conditions and reduce risk. She wants to care for her children’s health, and support them in their schooling, so that they can attend university. She also wants to improve her family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Roof repair

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es:
Marta tiene 57 años, es casada, resiD. en San Miguel, vive con el esposo y una hija, ella fabrica ropa.
