texts.es: La solicitante tiene 37 años tiene 1 hijo  vive en casa alquilada se dedica a la crianza y vta de cerdos hace mas de 2 años , cuenta con buenas referencias personales y experiencia crediticia solicita dicho credito para capital de trabajo se propone por contar con capacidad y sobre todo voluntad de pago.
texts.en:
The applicant is 37 and has 1 child. She lives in a rented home and has raised and sold hogs for over 2 years. She has good personal references and credit history. She is requesting this loan for working capital. She is able and above all willing to repay it.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Sakponou

texts.fr: F. est marié et père de 3 enfants, il est vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d'adidogomé qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille il s'est lancé dans le commerce de produits d'alimentation générale. il s'approvisionne dans les marchés locaux de lomé. son stock de marchandises est en baisse, il voudrait se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 3 cartons de savons, 6 cartons de pâte alimentaires, 3 cartons de détergents, 7 cartons de boites de conserves et divers.
texts.en:
Mr. F. is married and the father of three children. He lives with his family in the Adidogomé neighborhood, which is on the outskirts of the city of Lomé. To meet his family's needs, he has started a grocery business. He obtains his supplies in Lomé's local markets. As his supply is getting low, he would like to re-stock and is asking for a loan from WAGES to buy 3 cartons of soap, 6 cartons of pasta, 3 cartons of detergent, 7 boxes of canned food, and more.

Translated from French by Sarah Puchner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy general grocery products

loans.name: Sixto Aguado

texts.es: Sixto tiene 23 años de edad el es soltero vive en la casa de sus padres, casa de  material noble ubicado en el distrito de La Tinguiña. El se dedica a prestar servicio de transporte en vehiculo alquilado, el viene realizando esta actividad hace 2 años, cuenta con licencia de conducir a dos.  Sixto es un joven emprendedor y muy activo tiene muchos sueños y objativos uno de ellos es poder adquirir su propio vehiculo, con el dinero que solicita realizara algunos gastos personales.
texts.en:
Sixto is 23 and single. He lives in his parents' home, a well-built home located in the La Tinguiña district. He offers a transport service in a rented vehicle. He has been doing this for 2 years, and he has a class 2 driver's license. Sixto is a young and very active entrepreneur. He has many dreams and goals, one of which is to be able to acquire his own vehicle. With the requested loan he will cover some personal costs.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: personal costs

loans.name: Ebekalawoe

texts.fr: K. s'est lancée en 2003 dans le commerce de  fiperie, ce commerce marche bien au togo et elle réalise de bonnes recettes surtout en cette période de vacances où les jeunes aiment s'habiller pour les sorties. face à la demande élevée d'une clientèle composée pour la plupart de jeune, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 5 balles de friperie. elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants.
texts.en:
K. is married, with two children. She started her business with second-hand clothing in 2003. This business works well in Togo and she makes good profit, especially during the holiday season, when young people like to dress up to go out. Facing the growing demand, above all from young people, she requests a loan from WAGES to purchase five packages of used clothing.

Translated from French by Monica Urban, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of used clothing

loans.name: Afiavi

texts.fr: S. exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits de beauté. elle fait ce commerce depuis 2006 dans sa propre boutique qu'elle a appelé "LYDIC BEAUTY CENTER", sa clientèle se compose de femme de tout âge; elle exercee seule cette activité dans son quartier ce qui lui fait bénéficier d'une situation de monopole et d'avoir une forte demande. cette demande l'oblige à gonfler son stock de marchandises pour pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle avec 3  cartons de produits de beauté, 4 cartons de mèches, 24 perruques et divers.
texts.en:
S. makes a living selling beauty products. She began her business in 2006 with her own store called "Lydic Beauty Center". Her clients are women of all ages. She is the only one in her neighborhood, so that she monopolizes the business and faces a very high demand. She requests this loan to increase her stock of products in order to satisfy her customers' demand. She will buy three boxes of cosmetics, four boxes of hair extensions, 24 wigs and several other products.

Translated from French by Monica Urban, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products

loans.name: Kanlé

texts.fr: cette dame fait elle même des biscuits de façon traditionnelle qu'elle vend en gros à des revendeurs et revendeuses; elle fait ce commerce de puis 10 ans déjà. ses biscuits sont faite à base de farine de blé et sont très appréciés. elle voudrait construire un autre four  pour pouvoir faire plus de biscuit et satisfaire tous ses clients raison pour laquelle elle sollicite du crédit de WAGES. ce prêt lui servira également à acheter la farine de blé.
texts.en:
This woman hand makes cookies in the traditional manor wholesale that she then sells to retailers. She has been doing this for 10yrs already. Her cookies are made from a wheat flour and are very well liked. She would like to build another oven to bake more cookies and meet the needs of all of her clients. It's for this reason that she is asking for a loan from WAGES. This loan will also allow her to purchase more wheat flour.

Translated from French by Colleen Creegan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wheat flour and the construction of an oven

loans.name: Koboyodou

texts.fr: S. est une femme  célibataire, pour subvenir à ses propres charges, elle s'est lancée en  2000 dans la vente de boissons alcoolisées appelé tchoucoutou faite à base de sorgho. le stock de sorgho dont elle dispose est épuisé, elle sollicite un prêt pour se réapprovisionner avec 4 sacs de sorgho au nord du togo dans la ville de ketao et assurer le transport de la marchandise.
texts.en:
Koboyodou S. is an unmarried woman. In 2000, she began selling alcoholic beverages made from sorghum called tchoucoutou to support herself. As she has run out of her stock of sorghum, she is requesting a loan to re-stock with 4 bags of sorghum from the north of Togo in the town of Ketao and to provide for the transport of the merchandise.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of sorghum

loans.name: Endem Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité ENDEM est créé au 18è cycle du Banc Villageois de GADAPARA, 3ans plus tard après son inauguration. Il est composé de 07 femmes du même quartier. Elles ont formé leur groupe par proximité et par affinité. 

Madame KADIDIATOU ALIOU D. à l’extrême droite de la photo, de grand boubou jaune vêtue avec un sac main, est âgée de 41 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. 

Elle vend au marché de son quartier des produits alimentaires, tels des légumes, des crustacés etc. 
Avec son nouveau prêt elle va augmenter son niveau d’approvisionnement en marchandises afin d’accroitre ses bénéfices

Elle a comme objectif de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille. Elle compte également renforcer son niveau d’épargne
texts.en:
The solidarity group has been created at the 18th cycle of the Banc Villageois of Gadapara, 3 years after the Banc’s inauguration. The group is composed of seven women all living in the same neighborhood. They are neighbors and friends who decided to form a group together. Mrs. Kadidiatou Aliou D., to the far right in the photo, wearing a yellow outfit and holding a handbag, is 41 years of age. She is married and the mother of five children. She sells foodstuffs at the local market, for example, vegetables, seafood etc. With this new loan, she would like to expand her stock and increase her revenue. Her goal is to help her husband provide for the family. She also plans to boost her savings.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing vegetables and seafood

loans.name: Kashenyi Kwetungura, Kihihi Group

texts.en:
S. Benard, aged 43, has come a long way with his timber selling business. He started with the savings he got from small-scale tea growing in his home area of Kashenyi, Kihihi. Having had determination and a vision to change for the better, the married father of 7 children invested in the timber sales business. He gained confidence from his friends who were in the business and gave him the idea.


He supplies to timber dealers from the big city centers with large stores. This has seen him earn 360,000 Ugandan shillings on a monthly basis. His main intention is to expand but he is facing long odds in implementing this as he lacks capital input. With this loan, he will buy more trees for cutting timber and thus be able to generate more sales revenue to enable him to meet his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy more trees for timber cutting

loans.name: Fouladou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité FOULADOU est créé depuis l’inauguration du Banc Villageois de GADAPARA il y a de cela 11 ans. Il est composé de 06 femmes issues du même quartier. Des femmes qui se sont organisées par voisinage et par affinité. 

Madame AWA B., debout à droite sur la photo, de blanc vêtue, est la responsable du groupe de solidarité. Elle est âgée de 56 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants en charge. 

Elle est vendeuse de légumes au marché central de Kolda. Elle mène cette activité depuis plusieurs années, environs 10 ans. 

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va acheter des légumes en quantité plus importante que d’habitude afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. 

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins financiers de la famille. Par exemple la nourriture et la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
The FOULADOU solidarity group was created after the GADAPARA Banc Villageois was established 11 years ago. It is composed of 6 women who come from the same neighborhood. They are organized by neighborhood and kinship. Mrs. AWA B., standing at the right in the photo and dressed in white, is the leader of the solidarity group. She is 56 years old, married and the mother of 5 dependent children. She sells vegetables at the Kolda central market. She has operated this business for around 10 years. With her new loan, she is going to buy vegetables in larger quantites than usual so as to better satisfy her customers. Her goal is to help her husband provide for the family’s financial needs, such as the food and the children’s schooling.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay farm laborers and to buy firewood for burning bricks

loans.name: Nubia Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Nubia del socorro R., tiene la edad de 45 años es casada y tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad, los que habitan de manera independiente y apoyan a sus padres, la señora labora como maestra de primaria en un colegio público, desde hace mas de 15 años, siendo este una de las fuentes de ingresos más importantes de la familia.

Ellos habitan en el Barrio San Antonio en una humilde casa, es para su hogar que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción, que le permitan llevar a cabo la construcción de un cuarto, esta inversión le traerá mejores comodidades para el buen vivir de la familia.
texts.en:
Miss Nubia del socorro R. is 45, married and has 3 grown children who live independently and support their parents. She has worked as an elementary school teacher in a public school for over 15 years. This is one of the most important sources of income for the family. They live in the San Antonio neighbourhood in a modest home. She is requesting this loan for her home, for the purchase of construction materials. This will allow them to carry out the construction of a room. This investment will provide them with greater comfort and living standards for the whole family.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to build a room

loans.name: Jean Franklin

texts.es:
Jean tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a un familiar en el sector Pacangilla, un centro poblado pequeño ubicado en el distrito de Pacanga, una zona agrícola pertenciente a la provincia de Chepén, ubicada en la región La Libertad, situada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para realizar actividades de transporte) el brinda su servicio dentro de su centro poblado y del distrito donde vive, adicionalmente transporta petróleo para las diversas maquinarias agrícolas que operan en los centros poblados de la zona. Con los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades el solventa sus gastos personales y apoya a sus familiares con el sostenimiento de la economía familiar.

El contínuo uso brindado a la mototaxi que maneja y el estado accidentado de los caminos que suele transitar han hecho que su unidad móvil empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento, para realizar esta acción el ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles.

Jean es un joven bastante emprendedor y que siempre da lo mejor de si para salir adelante y poder progresar, en la zona donde vive sus vecino y conocidos le consideran una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Jean is 20, single and lives with a family member in the Pacangilla sector, a small, crowded center located in the Pacanga district. Pacanga is an agricultural zone belonging to the Chepen province, located in the La Libertad region, one hour from the city of Chiclayo. Chiclayo is the capital of the Lambayeque region. Jean offers a transportation service for cargo an passengers in a mototaxi (a motorized vehicle consisting of a motorcycle with an attached cabin for transport activities). He offers his service in the populated center of the city in which he lives. He also transports oil for the various agricultural machinery that operate in the area. With his income he covers his personal costs and supports his family members with household costs. The constant use of the mototaxi that he drives and the rough state of the roads on which he drives have caused some problems for his mototaxi that require urgent repair to guarantee proper functioning. In order to do this he has requested his first loan with Edpyme Alternativa: 1200 soles. Jean is a very enterprising young man who always gives his best to succeed and progress. In his neighbourhood his neighbours and acquaintances consider him to be a calm and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: repair and maintenance costs for a mototaxi

loans.name: Maria De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La señora Maria de los Ángeles A. H. es un joven casado de 27 años que habita en el barrio El Rodeo, se dedica al comercio y tiene un hijo pequeño por el cual esperan mejorar la calidad de vida para el bienestar de su familia.

Ellos se dedican a la venta de frutas y verduras y es para su negocio,  que solicitan un préstamo para la compra de abarrotes, que aumente  el volumen de ventas de los señores con el objetivo a futuro de remodelar la infraestructura de su hogar para beneficio de su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Miss Maria de los Ángeles A. H. is a young married woman of 27 years. She lives in the El Rodeo neighbourhood, is a merchant and has one small child for whom she desires a better quality of life for the well-being of their family. They sell fruits and vegetables and are requesting this loan for their business, for the purchase of groceries, which will increase their sales volume. Their goal for the future is to remodel the infrastructure of their home for the benefit of their small child.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of groceries

loans.name: Gladys Victoria

texts.es:
Gladys tiene años D. edad y vive junto a su familia en el distrito D. Chepén, una zona agrícola D. regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia del mismo nombre, dentro D. la región La Libertad, la zona se encuentra situada a una hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desD. hace doce años a la venta D. verduras D. modo ambulante dentro D. uno D. los mercados D. la ciudad en donD. vive, ella ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo D. verduras frescas todos los dias desD. tempranas horas en la mañana. Debido al tiempo que lleva trabajando en el negocio y al buen trato que ofrece, actualmente cuenta con un grupo D. clientes fieles que siempre acuden a adquirir los productos que ofrece. Los ingresos que percibe los utiliza para ayudar a sostener económicamente a su familia.

Gladys desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. mas verduras para seguir ofreciéndolas a sus clientes, por ell ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden con la realización D. sus objetivos.

Gladys es una mujer bastante empeñosa y con ganas D. seguir trabajando para mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia, durante el tiempo que lleva trabajando se ha ganado la confianza D. sus compañeros D. trabajo, los que la consideran una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Gladys lives with her family in the Chepen district, an agricultural zone with regular commercial activity which is located in the province of the same name, in the La Libertad region. This zone is an hour from the Chiclayo city, the capital of the Lambayeque region. For twelve years she has sold vegetables in one of the street markets in the city where she lives. She offers her customers all types of fresh vegetables every day, starting in the early morning hours. Given the time she has worked in this business and the good service that she offers, she now has a group of loyal customers who always purchase the products that she offers. The income that she earns is used to help with her family's finances. Gladys wants to expand her business with the purchase of more vegetables to continue offering them to her customers. For this reason she has decided to request her first loan with Edpyme Alternativa: 1500 soles, which will help her to achieve her goals. Gladys is a very hard-working woman who wants to keep working to improve the quality of life of her family. During the time that she has worked, she has gained the confidence of her co-workers, who consider her a calm and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of vegetables

loans.name: Petra Del Carmen

texts.es:
Petra de 59 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado), ella tiene una tienda de víveres desde hace 6 años cuando murió su esposo. 

Ella comenzó a vender huevos en cubetas, arroz y leche en un puestito que tenia en la calle, poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo readecuar su casa y ubicar la tienda que siempre quiso, por esa buena decisión ahora ella trabaja en su propia tienda desde muy temprano, vende arroz, bebidas, lácteos, carnes etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, azúcar y aceites para su negocio. En el futuro quiere, terminar de construir su casa y poder alquilar cuartos para tener mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Petra, 59, lives along Guayaquil’s Perimetral Highway (in the city outskirts, surrounded by a salt marsh). She has had a grocery store for six years, since her husband died. She began to sell eggs, rice and milk from a little post that she had in the street. Little by little, with effort, she was able to readjust her house to accommodate the store that she had always wanted. Because of this good decision, she now works in her own store, beginning very early in the day, selling rice, drinks, dairy, meat, etc. With the loan, Petra wishes to buy rice, sugar and oil for her business. In the future she wishes to finish construction on her house and rent rooms in order to earn more income.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, oil

loans.name: Luis Edgardo

texts.es:
Luis es un padre de familia de 41 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en el sector Vallecito Bajo, una zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola dedicada principalmente al cultivo de frutas para exportación, se encuentra ubicado en la región Piura, a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde hace que era joven. El cuenta con un pequeño terreno de cultivo en donde suele sembrar maracuyá y mango, las frutas que cosecha las vende a las plantas procesadoras de la zona que preparan las frutas para luego exportarlas en el extrajero, esta actividad es la principal fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta por lo que siempre trabaja de la mejor manera posible para mantenerla.

El desea adquirir algunos fertilizantes que le permitan brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de modo que pueda obtener una buena cosecha, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 600 nuevos soles.

Luis es una persona alegre y que gusta mucho de la labor que realiza, por ello pone mucho empeño en las actividades que lleva a cabo. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Luis, age 41, lives with his wife and their three children in the Vallecito Bajo sector. It is a rural area in the Tambogrande district. It is a farming area, where they primarily grow fruit for export. It is located in the Piura region. It is over three hours from the city of Chiclayo, which is the capital of the Lambayeque region. He has done agricultural work since he was young. He has a small piece of land where he plants passion fruit and mangos. He sells the harvested fruit to a processing plant in the area. They prepare the fruit and then export it to foreign countries. This is his primary source of income. He always works the best way possible to maintain it. He wants to get some fertilizers, which will allow him to provide maintenance to his crops. That way he will be able to get a good harvest. To achieve this objective he has seen the need to request, for the first time, a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 600 soles. Luis is a happy person who really likes the work he does. Therefore, he puts a lot of determination into the work he does. His neighbors and acquaintances in his area consider him to be a level-headed and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer for maintenance of his mango and passion fruit crops

loans.name: Maria Martina

texts.es:
María de 54 años, vive en Primavera de Duran (con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil), ella tiene un puesto de venta de repuestos de bicicletas desde que se separo de su esposo. 

Hace 5 años atrás cuando se quedo sola, comenzó a comprar herramientas para vender de bicicletas poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo tener su propio local, ahora ella tiene un pequeño puesto donde vende herramientas y también infla las llantas de las bicicletas. Trabaja de lunes a domingo. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar herramientas para su negocio, en el futuro quiere termina de construir su casa y tener mas personas a su cargo.
texts.en:
Maria is 54 years old, and lives in Primavera de Duran (on the outskirts of Guayaquil, in an area that is deteriorating). Since separating from her husband, she has had a stand where she sells bicycle parts. For the last 5 years, when she has been alone, she has begun to buy bicycle tools to sell, and with struggle on her part, she was able to have her own location. She now has a small stand where she sells tools and also inflates bicycle tires. She works from Monday to Sunday. With the loan, she would like to buy tools for her business. In the future, she wants to complete construction of her house, and have more employees under her.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tools, tubes

loans.name: Arsenio

texts.es:
Arsenio es un padre de familia de 51 años que vive junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en el sector Guaraguaos, una zona rural del distrito de Tambogrando, un distrito agrícola dedicado principalmente al cultivo de frutas, las cuales son exportadas a diversos países, pertene a la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, situada a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Al igual que la mayor parte de hombres de la zona, se dedica desde joven a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura, actualmente cuenta con pequeño terreno de cultivo en donde siembra Mango, cuando cosecha esta fruta, la ofrece en venta a las plantas procesadoras de la zona que preparan este producto para ser vendido al extrajero. Esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingresos por lo que siempre se esfuerza al máximo para sacar adelamte su cultivo.

Arsenio desea adquirir algunos fertilizantes con los cuales planea brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo para poder obtener una buena producción, para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

El es una persona que durante todo este tiempo ha estado trabajando arduamente para sacar adelante a su familia, en la zona donde vive lo conocen como alguien tranquilo y entregado a su familia.
texts.en:
Arsenio is 51 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the Guaraguaos sector, a rural area in the Tambogrande district. This is an agricultural district where they mainly grow fruit that is exported to different countries. He lives in the Piura province, in a region that goes by the same name, three hours from Chiclayo. Like many of the other men in this region he has been working in agriculture since he was young. Currently, he has a small plot of land where he grows mangos. When he harvests the fruit he sells it to the processing plants in the region that prepare it to be sold abroad. This work provides him with his main source of income and he always works hard to get the most out of his crop. Arsenio wants to buy fertilizer that he will use to maintain his crop to obtain a good harvest. To achieve this he has requested a loan, for the first time, from Edpyme Alternativa of 1000 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency). He is a person that has always worked very hard to provide for his family. In the area where he lives he is known a being a peaceful and devoted family man.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to maintain his mango crop

loans.name: Luz En Desarrollo 2 Group

texts.en:
Juana is the coordinator of her group, Luz en desarrollo 2 (Developing light). She lives in a simple structure with her long-term partner and child. She says that her most difficult challenge is improving her business. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying to sew and to learn more about it.

Juana is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for over two years. She started sewing small pieces at home and then a friend talked to her about Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business. She makes and sells curtains, sheets, quilts and tablecloths. She will buy fabric, needles, thread and other materials. She will use the profits to invest in her business. She is planing to operate her own local business. 

Juana's story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Los Arcarizos, a dusty industrial area north of the capital where free trade zones are common. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other supplies

loans.name: Mujeres Bendecidas 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Jaqueline is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres Bendecidas 1 & 2 (Blessed Women). She lives in a simple structure with her long-term partner and 3 children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to build a concrete foundation for her house. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying to work for community progress.

Jaqueline is excited to be taking her 3rd loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for over a year, starting with her first Esperanza loan. Her friend and neighbor, Mirina, invited her to be part of the group. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying wallets, perfumes for men and women and three pounds of chicken. She sells the chicken at home for her neighbors to prepare lunch. She will use the profits to invest in her business and to buy some things her children need.
 
This Esperanza associate joined us because she was invited by a neighbor to join a group to start doing the business activities she had in mind. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally, her group is located in L, the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: to buy wallets, perfumes and three pounds of chicken

loans.name: La Bendición Group

texts.en:
The communal bank “La Bendición” consists of 15 associates from Santiago's La Florida district. These individuals' livelihoods consists of sales including completos (traditional Chilian hot dogs, served on freshly baked bread with tomatoes, chucrut (sauerkraut), avocado and mayonnaise), American clothing, gold- and silver-plated jewelry, paintings, wooden crafts and plastics. 
Elena is in the photo in the second row and third from the left. She sells school supplies outside a school near her home. Elena is also inventive and handmakes accessories and decorations, primarily on wood (signs for rooms, frames and gift boxes), but also plaster masks and mirrors. She also has a knack for making delicious chocolates. She learned these crafts on her own. 
Elena will use her loan to purchase materials (such as wood and plaster) needed to produce accessories and decorations, with the purpose of making merchandise in preparation for the Christmas fairs in December. In addition, she will also purchase some school supplies for resale. Elena's dream is to one day open a workshop studio geared to providing single mothers with a venue to make their crafts and provide open hours for the public at large. Elena wants to focus on single mothers because she knows that many of them do not own property. Her own experience, as a single mother of an eleven-year-old son and taking care of her seven-year-old nephew, inspires this dream. 
Elena has enjoyed working with Kiva partner, Fondo Esperanza, as it has motivated her interaction with other entrepreneurs within the communal bank. 
La Florida is a community located in the southeast of Santiago (the capital of Chile). The community is quite diverse, representing all sectors of socio-economic levels. La Florida has an active commercial life, which is manifested in the existence of several new shopping centers. In recent years, this sector has experienced explosive growth.

loans.use: To purchase craft materials and school supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Cement and Stones

loans.name: La Nueva Luz Group

texts.es:
L. SRA. ROSALVINA, TIENE 52 AÑOS, TIENE DOS HIJOS QUE YA SON MAYORES D. EDAD. ELL. ES SOCIA DEL GRUPO "L. NUEVA LUZ" INTEGRADO POR 8 PERSONAS TRABAJADORAS RESIDENTES D. L. ZONA DEL SEÑOR D. LOS MILAGROS EN EL DISTRITO D. COMAS. SUS COMPAÑEROS D. GRUPO L. ELIGIERON COMO PRESIDENTA D. L. JUNTA DIRECTIVA DEL GRUPO.

HACE QUINCE AÑOS, ELL. SE DEDICA A PRESTAR SERVICIO D. COSTURA D. FORMA DEPENDIENTE EN DIFERENTES EMPRESAS, INICIÓ CONFECCIONANDO TODO TIPO D. CORTINAS Y BLUSAS ESPECIALMENTE PARA  NIÑAS.
CON SU TRABAJO HA LOGRADO COMPRAR SUS ARTEFACTOS, APOYAR CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR.
LE GUSTARÍA MUCHO INDEPENDIZARSE Y TENER SU TALLER PROPIO EN SU CASA.

EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ UNA PARTE EN L. COMPRA D. MATERIALES PARA PODER IR AVANZANDO L. AMBIENTACIÓN D. UN PEQUEÑO TALLER D. COSTURA EN SU CASA Y L. OTRA PARTE COMPRARÁ TEL. PARA L. CONFECCIÓN D. SECADORES.
texts.en:
Rosalvina is 52-years-old and has two children who are now adults. She is a member of the group “L. Nueva Luz” (The New Light) which is maD. up of 8 hard-working residents of the “Zona del Señor D. los Milagros,” or the Zone of Our Lord of Miracles in the Comas District. Her fellow group members elected her to be be president of the Board of Directors of the group. Fifteen years ago, she began working as a seamstress in various businesses. She began making all kinds of curtains and blouses, especially for girls. With her work she has been able to buy her tools and help support the household expenses. She would very much like to become more independent and have her own shop in her house. The loan she is requesting will be invested in part in the purchase of materials in order to be able to advance her goal of having a small sewing shop in her house. The other part will be used for the purchase of cloth for making towels for drying.

Translated from Spanish by Anna Ruby Waxham Blackwell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in the purchase of construction materials to enable my sewing workshop and cloth to make drying towels.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying a security gate to protect his home

loans.name: Migdalia

texts.es:
En el barrio las colinas    Municipio de Somotillo la señora L. F. realiza su trabajo de venta de comida en un tramo ubicado en el mercado municipal de Somotillo.
Ella nos dice que el crédito será utilizado Compra de mercadería variada para su negocio de venta de comida.
Este es el segundo   crédito que nos solicita y nos dice que el primero la beneficiara a reparar su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
In the “Las Colinas” (Hills) neighborhood of the Somotillo municipality, L. works selling food in a section of the municipal market of Somotillo. She told us that the loan will be used to purchase various merchandise for her food-selling business. This is the second loan that she has requested from us and she tells us that the first benefited her by allowing her to repair the home she lives in.

Translated from Spanish by Anna Ruby Waxham Blackwell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various merchandise for her food-selling business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of materials for his shoemaking workshop such as leather, insoles, nails, etc.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: La Sra. Luz Marina R. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria en la comarca las Mercedes desde hace 15 años. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda. Lo solicita para la compra de cemento, arena, piedra y pago de mano de obra.
texts.en:
Luz Marina R. is originally from the town of El Sauce, she has held the post of primary teacher in the Mercedes District for the last 15 years. This is the first loan that she has requested from Ceprodel. Her objective is to improve her house. She is requesting it for the purchase of cement, sand, stones, and payment for workers.

Translated from Spanish by Anna Ruby Waxham Blackwell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sand, stones, cement, and payment for workers.

loans.name: Oswaldo Ramón

texts.es:
En el barrio Carlos Fonseca   Municipio de Somotillo el  señor C. L. Realiza su trabajo como productor agropecuario en una finca ubicada en la comarca conocida como la ceiba atendiendo su ato ganadero y sus cultivos.
El nos dice que el crédito será utilizado Compra de una vaca parida para aumentar su ato ganadero.
Este es el curto crédito que nos solicita y nos dice que los primeros créditos la beneficiaron para dar mantenimiento a su finca y la compra de 4 vacas paridas.
texts.en:
In the Carlos Fonseca neighborhood of the town of Somotillo, C. L. works as an agricultural producer in a farm located in the district known as “La Ceiba” (a type of tree). There he tends his cattle herd and crops. He tells us that the loan will be used to purchase a cow that has recently calved to improve his herd. This is the fourth loan that he has requested from us and he tells us that the first loans benefited him with the maintenance of his farm and the purchase of four cows that had recently calved.

Translated from Spanish by Anna Ruby Waxham Blackwell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a recently calved cow to improve his cattle herd.

loans.name: Camino Seguro Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. TRINIDAD TOMASA, TIENE 47 AÑOS, ESTA CASADA Y TIENE 5 HIJOS D. LOS CUALES 2 AÚN ESTAN EN ÉTAPA ESCOLAR. ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO "CAMINO SEGURO" FORMADO POR 10 PERSONAS RESIDENTES DEL DISTRITO D. COMAS. 
HACE 6 AÑOS LA SRA. TRINIDAD TOMASA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA D. PRODUCTOS NUTRICIONALES, CON UN POCO D. DINERO QUE TENÍA AHORRADO INCIÓ SU NEGOCIO, SU TRABAJO ERA OFRECER EL PRODUCTO TODOS LOS DÍAS D. CASA EN CASA, COMO YA SE HABÍA HECHO D. UN STOCK, PRÁCTICAMENTE DEBÍA SALIR A DIARIO PARA PODER RECUPERAR EL DINERO INVERTIDO; POCO A POCO NOTÓ QUE LE IVA BIEN EN LAS VENTAS ASÍ QUE CONTINÚA TRABAJANDO EN LA VENTA D. PRODUCTOS NUTRICIONALES; PARA OBTENER OTRO INGRESO HACE UN AÑO SE DEDICA TAMBIÉN A LA VENTA POR CATALOGO D. PRODUCTOS D. BELLEZA.
CON ÉSTE TRABAJO HA PODIDO CUBRIR LOS GASTOS D. LA EDUCACIÓN D. SUS HIJOS Y EL PAGO D. UN TERRENO QUE ELLA ADQUIRIÓ Y SOBRETODO ÉSTE TRABAJO LE BRINDA LA OPORTUNIDAD D. PASAR MAS TIEMPO CON SUS HIJOS YA QUE ELLA PUED. DECIDIR SOBRE SU HORARIO Y TIEMPO QUE LE DEDICA A SU TRABAJO.
EL PRÉSTAMO RECIBIDO LO INVERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA D. PRODUCTOS NUTRICIONALES PARA PODER FORMAR UN STOCK CONSIDERABLE.
texts.en:
Mrs. Trinidad Tomasa is 47, married and has 5 children, 2 that are still of school age. She is a member of the group “Camino Seguro”, maD. up of 10 residents of the Comas district. 6 years ago Trinidad Tomasa began selling nutritional products. With the little money that she had saved she began selling the products door to door every day. Since she had stocked up on the products, she practically had to go out daily to be able to recuperate her investment. Little by little she saw that she was doing well in sales so she continued selling the nutritional products. So as to have another income, last she year she also started selling beauty products through a catalog. With this work she has been able to cover her children’s school expenses and to pay for a piece of land that she acquired. This work especially offers her the opportunity to spend more time with her children since she can now make her own schedule and deciD. how much time to spend on the business. She will use the loan to buy nutritional products so that she can build up a good stock of the items .

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nutritional products to have a good stock

loans.name: Fátima Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Fátima es madre soltera de 30 años de edad, el pequeño estudia la primaria, ella se dedica  a la venta de cosméticos, y así mismo es asalariada de una zona franca, con sus ahorros fue que consiguió el dinero necesario para empezar su pequeño negocio el cual hoy en día le representa un ingreso importante en su vida.

Ella habita en una casa humilde que ha construido de su esfuerzo propio, pero las limitaciones económicas no le permiten terminar las edificaciones de las regeneraciones de su vivienda, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción, esta inversión le beneficiara al desarrollo optimo de su pequeño hijo sobretodo que no tiene a ningún familiar que le apoye económicamente.
texts.en:
Fátima is a thirty-year-old single mother. Her little one is studying in primary school. She works selling cosmetics and is employed in a tax free zone. With her savings she was able to begin her small business which today represents an important part of her income. She lives in a humble house that she has built of her own initiative, but her economic limitations do not allow her to complete the building or the repairs to her home. This is why she is requesting a loan for the purchase of construction materials. This investment will benefit the development of her young son above all else because he has no family members who support him economically.

Translated from Spanish by Anna Ruby Waxham Blackwell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall, construction materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of two dairy cows

loans.name: Juana Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Juana Mercedes R. R., tiene la edad de 44 años es madre soltera vive en el barrio de Buenos Aires, tiene 2 hijos adolecentes que estudian la secundaria, ella es agricultora desde hace mas de 15 años siendo esta la actividad que la ayudado a sustentar a sus hijos, fue gracias al apoyo de su papa que logró adquirir su finca.

En lo que va del año ha trabajado para erradicar una plaga que se ha acabado con las cosechas, razón por la cual solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales agrícolas que permitan una mejor producción y a corto plazo la recuperación del capital invertido, esto para fines que vengan a mejorar la economía de su familia, debido  a que sus hijos pronto irán a la Universidad y ella espera poder apoyarlos en ese gasto, debido a que no tienen ningún familia que le apoye en la crianza de sus pequeños.
texts.en:
Juana is 44-years-old and a single mother who lives in the Buenos Aires neighborhood (of Managua, Nicaragua). She has two adolescent children who are in secondary school. She works in agriculture where she has worked for more than 15 years. This work has helped her to support her children and it was thanks to the support of her father that she was able to acquire her farm. So far this year she has worked to eradicate a pest that has destroyed the harvest. This is why she is requesting a loan for agricultural materials that will permit her to produce more and in a short period recuperate the capital that is invested. This is all toward the goal of improving the economy of her family so that her children can go to the University soon and she will be able to support them with the expenses because she has no family members who support her in raising her children.

Translated from Spanish by Anna Ruby Waxham Blackwell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improvement of crop harvest

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase four tires for his public transportation vehicle

loans.name: Reina Concepcion

texts.es: Reina Concepción tiene 55 años, su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de costura. De esta manera ésta actividad se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos, y con la ayuda de su máquina de coser ofrece buenos acabados en las prendas que cose. Sus clientes son en mayoría algunas madres y amistades que tiene cerca de su domicilio, su mayor obstáculo es no contar con material suficiente, perdiendo oportunidades de hacer más trabajo y de ganar más. Su mayor anhelo es comprar más inventario al por mayor. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará telas e hilos de diversos colores, zipper, agujas y tijeras para continuar con su trabajo de costura.
texts.en:
Reina Concepción is 55 years old. Her economic activity is providing tailoring services. This business has become her main source of income, and with the help of her sewing machine, she offers excellent attention to detail in the garments she sews. Most of her customers are mothers and friends who live near her. Her main obstacle is the lack of sufficient material, so that she loses opportunities to take on more work and earn more. Her greatest desire is to buy more inventory on a wholesale basis. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy fabrics in a range of colors, zippers, needles, and scissors to continue with her tailoring work.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
La señora María Teresa R., tiene la edad de 35 años, es casada y con su esposo y su hijo de 10 años habitan en el Barrio Los Ríos, ellos son agricultores, que con el apoyo de su mama lograron la adquisición de su finca, siendo ahora una fuente fuerte de sustento para la familia.

Uno de los principales problemas que afecta la producción son los gases que emanan el volcán, y por tal razón esperan a futuro realizar un estudio que conserve el suelo para futuros proyectos, por ahora solicitan un préstamo para la compra de insumos vegetativos, fertilizante, y pesticidas, que permitan un mantenimiento más optimo para los nuevos sembradillos, y que favorezcan  a la economía del hogar en la inversión de nuevos fuentes de ingresos o proyectos familiares y/o personales.
texts.en:
María Teresa R. is 35 years old and married. She lives with her husband and her 10-year-old son in the Los Ríos neighborhood. They are farmers; they were able to acquire their farm with her mother's help, and now it is a solid source of support for the family. One of the main problems affecting their production is caused by the gases emanating from the volcano. For this reason, they hope in the future to be able to undertake a study that will lead to soil conservation for future projects. For the present, however, they are requesting a loan to buy planting supplies along with fertilizer and pesticides which will provide optimal maintenance for their new plantings. This will boost their household economy and favor their investment in new sources of income or family and/or personal projects.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Providing optimal maintenance for her crops

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es: Felicia, tiene 57 años, de su primer compromiso tuvo 6 hijos, quienes trabajan de manera independiente en la ciudad de Lima. Actualmente comparte su vida con Julio de 49 años, juntos tiene a su hijo Michael de 22 años, y viven en su casa propia, fabricado a base de madera. Hace más de dos años se dedica en la venta de comida en su restaurante ubicado en un espacio de sus casa, denominado cariñosamente “El Moreno”, también en las tardes prepara dulces y mazamorras que ofrece en la calle, además algunos días ayuda a su esposo con el cultivo de las plantaciones de palta, café y plátanos de la variedad isla, pues ambos llevan 19 años practicando en la agricultura. Ella, lo que más ama es cocinar y vender lo que prepara, ya que sus ganancias le permiten vivir cómodamente, por eso ahora quiere construir su casa de material noble,  ampliar su local, incrementar bebidas en su restaurante  y plantar más café y ser una reconocida e importante productora de estos granos, dentro de su zona. Esta es la séptima vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y esta gustosa de continuar laborando en su banco comunal, porque está integrado por personas buenas, solidarias y muy cumplidas como ella. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono, que esparcirá sobre sus cultivos de plátanos.
texts.en:
Felicia is 57 years old. She has 6 children from her first marriage, who are all working independently in the city of Lima. Currently, she is sharing her life with Julio, age 49, with whom she has a 22-year-old son, Michael. They live in their own house which is made of wood. For more than two years, Felicia has worked selling food in her restaurant located in a space in her house. The restaurant is affectionately called "El Moreno" ["Brown-Skinned Man"]. She also prepares sweets and mazamorras [corn puddings] in the evenings, which she offers on the street. In addition, some days she helps her husband cultivate his crops of avocado, coffee and bananas, since both of them have worked in agriculture for 19 years. What Felicia loves most is cooking and selling what she prepares, since her earnings allow the family to live comfortably. For that reason, she now wants to construct a house of solid materials, expand her restaurant, add beverages to her offerings, and plant more coffee so that she can become a recognized and significant producer of this crop in her area. This is her seventh loan with MFP, and she is enthusiastic about continuing to work with her communal bank, because it is made up of good people who have a strong sense of solidarity and are very dependable, like she is. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy several sacks of fertilizer or compost which she will spread on her banana fields.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase three calved cows.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es: Dolores, de 31 años, es una madre de familia muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en la casa de sus padres junto a su esposo Joel de 29 años y sus 2 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Los arduos días de trabajo que Dolores tiene en su chacra, le han servido para mejorar sus cultivos y hacer más productivas sus tierras, junto a la mayor de sus hijas trabaja desde muy temprano por la mañana, cultivando papas y habas, productos que posteriormente llevara a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y ver como sus cultivos van creciendo, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus campos agrícolas de los cultivos. Con el tiempo, espera comprar más tierras y así ampliar la cantidad de su producción. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, en su primer crédito fue muy puntual con el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. En su grupo comunal es una social muy alegre, motivo por el cual es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Dolores, who is 31 years old, is a simple and hard working mother. She lives in her parents' house with her 29 year old husband, Joel, and their 2 beloved children, to whom they want to give a better quality of life. The arduous work days that Dolores has spent on her small farm have served to improve her crop and make her land more productive. She works together with her older daughter starting very early in the morning. They cultivate potatoes and beans, products that she will later bring to the wholesale market in the city of Tarma to sell. What she likes best about her work is sowing her land and seeing her crops grow. She has been in this business for 5 years and feels that the most difficult part is taking care of the crops on her farmland. With time, she hopes to purchase more land and increase her production quantity. This is her eighth loan with MFP. She was very timely in the repayment of her first loan, and she expects to be so now as well. She is a very happy member of her communal bank, which is why she is well liked by the rest of the members. With the 3000 PEN ($1075 USD) that she is requesting, she will purchase more fertilizer to improve her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purhcase more sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Santos Demetrio

texts.es:
El señor Santos Demetrio M. H., es un hombre de edad avanzada, que con su esposa habitan en el Barrio Los Amadores, ellos tienen 7 hijos, que están casados, y habitan independientemente y sobreviven bajo sus propios ingresos, apoyando económicamente a sus padres, él es agricultor desde hace ya más de 30 años y fue gracias a su esfuerzo propio que adquirió su finca, la cual ha sido el sustento de toda su familia.

Un problema de plagas amenaza con las buenas cosechas de sus tierras, por esta razón solicitan un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes, pesticidas, e insumos vegetativos que fortifiquen las siembras y permitan una mejor cosecha que a futuro favorezca en el volumen de las ventas y el bienestar de la familia, sobretodo que desea mejrar su patrimonio para heredarsselos a sus hijos y nietos.
texts.en:
Señor Santos Demetrio M. H. is an elderly man who lives with his wife in the Los Amadores neighborhood. They have 7 children who are married, live independently and support themselves, as well as their parents, financially. He has been a farmer for more than 30 years. Thanks to his own hard work he acquired his farm, which has been the means of support for his whole family. The problem of a plague threatens a good harvest of his land, which is why he is requesting a loan. He wants to purchase fertilizers, pesticides and agricultural supplies to fortify his crops and allow for a better harvest that, in the future, will grant a greater volume of sales and help the well being of the family. Above all else, he wants to improve his wealth in order to leave it to his children and grandchildren.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Crop maintenance

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis, de 49 años, es un padre de familia muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa María de 49 años y sus 4 menores hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo que realiza Luis es el cultivo de ruda, toronjil y granadilla, todas las mañanas junto a su esposa comienza sus días cultivando y regando sus tierras, los ánimos que posee lo ayudan mucho en esta labor, ya que es una actividad que necesita de esfuerzo físico, pero él sabe que ningún esfuerzo esta de más con tal de brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus productos, ya que siente que los meses de trabajo lo están recompensando, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Con el tiempo, desea juntar el dinero necesario y comprarse un auto, con el cual pueda transportar sus cultivos. Este es el sétimo crédito con MFP, sabe que el crédito lo ayudará mucho en el desarrollo de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable y motivo por el cual es muy respetado por sus compañeras de grupo. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono para poder mejorar la productividad de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Luis is 49 years old. He is a very straightforward and hard-working father, who lives in his own house with his wife María, age 49, and his 4 young children, whom he would like to provide with a better quality of life. The work that Luis does is cultivating rue, lemon balm and sweet granadilla. Every morning, together with his wife, he starts his days cultivating and watering his fields. His positive spirit helps him greatly in this work, because it is an activity that requires physical effort, but he knows that no effort is too much when it comes to doing his best for his family. What he likes best about his work is harvesting his crops, since he feels that he is being compensated for the months of work. He has done this work for 15 years, and he thinks the hardest part is transporting his crops to the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. With time, he wants to save up the necessary money and buy himself a car which he can use to transport his crops. This is his seventh loan with MFP, and he knows that the loan will help him greatly in carrying out his work. In his communal bank, he is a very responsible member, and for this reason he is highly respected by his fellow members. With the three thousand Peruvian new soles he is requesting, he will buy fertilizer to improve the productivity of his fields.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fertilizer

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina, D. 60 años, es una mujer que siempre a luchado por sobre salir en la vida, vive en su casa propia junto a su querido nieto Henry D. 14 años y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila. Con mucho esfuerzo Marcelina pudo poner un cafetín en el poblado D. Huayounioc, con la ayuda D. su fallecido esposo pudo equiparlo y poco a poco lo convirtió en un lugar muy conocido y concurrido. La comida que sirve es muy buena, es por eso que es muy visitada por sus vecinos. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es tener su negocio limpio. Lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener atender a tantas personas a la vez, ya que sola no se da abasto. Para más adelante, espera mejorar las instalaciones D. su negocio y así brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, si es que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias D. su banco comunal, en donD. ha sido muy bien recibida. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará los ingredientes que necesita para elaborar los platillos que venD. en su cafetín.
texts.en:
Marcelina, 60, is a woman who has always fought to get ahead in life. She lives in her own home with her dear grandson Henry who is 14, and what she wants the most is to live peacefully in her old age. With a lot of effort Marcelina was able to set up a small cafe in the village of Huayounioc. With the help of her deceased husband she was able to fit it out, and little by little she turned it into a very well known and popular spot. The food that she serves is very good, this is why her neighbors visit a lot. What she likes the most about her work is to keep a clean business. She has had her business for 10 years and what she considers the most difficult is to look after so many people at a time, as she cannot cope alone. In the future, she hopes to improve her business facilities and so proviD. a better service to her customers. This is the fifth loan with MFP, she knows that she has to pay all her installments on time, as she doesn't want to cause problems for the members of her communal bank, which has been very well received. With the thousand nuevos soles that she is requesting, she will buy the ingredients that she needs to make the dishes that she sells in her little cafe.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Cenelia Del Carmen

texts.es: Cenelia del Carmen tiene la edad de 36 años. Es madre soltera. Tiene 5 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta y elaboración de tortillas. Es así que se genera los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su hija, Siempre disfruta de su trabajo porque le gusta cocinar, además que le ayuda cubrir los gastos educativos de sus hijos. Afirma que este negocio es rentable y siempre está dispuesta a continuar trabajando, en adelante desea tener un restaurante grande. Este es su préstamo numero 7 y está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, agradece a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de sus ricas tortillas.
texts.en:
Cenelia del Carmen is 36 years old. She is a single mother. She has 5 children in her care. Her economic activity is selling and making tortillas. This is how she generates the necessary income to support her daughter. She always enjoys her work because she likes to cook, and also because it helps her to cover her children's education expenses. She reports that this business is profitable and she is always ready to keep working. In the future, she would like to have a big restaurant. This is her 7th loan and she is very pleased to know that she has financial support. She has always shown herself to be responsible with her repayments, and she is grateful to the people who will be managing her loan, as it will be very useful for the development of her business. With the requested loan, she will invest in the purchase of ingredients for making her delicious tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for tortillas

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es: Mariluz, de 33 años, es una madre muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su querido hijo Kyo de 3 años, a quien desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El negocio al que Mariluz se dedica es la venta de productos naturales, los cuales vende en la ciudad de Lima, es una vendedora muy persuasiva y siempre consigue vender todos sus productos, ya que si no lo hace siente que la venta del día no fue fructífera y que al siguiente día tendrá que trabajar el doble. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientas sobre los remedios que necesitan, lleva 12 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de ventas, es por eso que anhela tener con el tiempo una tienda donde pueda vender con más tranquilidad y comodidad. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, en su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable y solidaria. Con los setecientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más productos naturales, para ofrecerle a sus clientes una mayor variedad.
texts.en:
Mariluz, who is 33, is a very loving and hardworking mother. She lives in her own house with her beloved son Kyo, who is 3 years old, and to whom she wants to offer a better quality of life. The business in which Mariluz works is the sale of natural products, which she sells in the city of Lima. She is a very persuasive salesperson and always succeeds in selling all her products, since if she doesn't, she feels that the day's sales weren't fruitful and that she will have to work twice as hard the next day. What she likes most about her work is advising her customers about the remedies that they need. She has had this business for 12 years, and for her, the most difficult part is having to remain all day at her market stall. For this reason, she dreams of having, in the course of time, a shop where she can sell with more peace and comfort. This is Mariluz's second loan with MFP, and she expects to be very punctual in her payments. In her community bank, she is a very responsible and community-minded member. With the 700 PEN that she is applying for, she will buy more natural products, in order to offer her customers a greater variety.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more natural products to offer her customers.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, de 39 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Abel de 40 años y sus 2 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor educación. En el poblado de Huayounioc, Sonia tiene un pequeño puesto donde vende combustible, con el cual abastece a la gran mayoría de vehículos que pasan por la carretera con destino a la selva central del país, su puesto es muy concurrido y por lo general acaba con todo el combustible que vende. Tiene 9 años en este negocio, el cual le ha dado las ganancias suficientes para alimentar a sus hijos y pagar sus estudios, pero siente que el dinero que gana no será suficiente para correr con los gastos de los estudios secundarios de su mayor hijo, es por eso que desea poner una tienda con el que pueda incrementar sus ingresos económicos. A ella le gusta conversar con sus clientes, disfruta mucho haciéndolo, pero le es muy difícil permanecer todo el día en su negocio, ya que el olor del combustible es muy fuerte y termina mareándola, aun así no decae en su afán de salir adelante y esta dispuesta a trabajar mucho para lograrlo. Es el séptimo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y esta dispuesta hacerlo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su grupo comunal, en el cual es muy responsable. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más combustible, para generarse mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Sonia, who is 39, is a very straightforward and hardworking woman. She lives in her own house with her husband, Abel, who is 40, and their two beloved children, to whom she wants to offer a better education. In the town of Huayounioc, Sonia has a small stand where she sells fuel, which she supplies to the great majority of vehicles which pass by on the highway going to the tropical forest in the center of the country. Her stand is very busy, and in general she sells all the fuel she has. She has been in this business for 9 years, and it has given her sufficient earnings to feed her children and pay their school expenses, but she feels that the money she earns will not be sufficient to support the secondary school expenses of her older son. For this reason, she wants to set up a store where she can increase her income. She likes to chat with her customers, she likes doing it very much, but it is very difficult for her to remain at her business all day, since the odor of the fuel is very strong and she ends up feeling nauseated. Even so, this doesn't diminish her desire to move forward, and she is ready to work hard to achieve her goals. This is her seventh loan with MFP, and she knows that she has to make all her payments on time and she is ready to do that, since she does not want to cause problems for the members of her community bank, in which she is very responsible. With the 3000 PEN that she is applying for, she will buy more fuel to generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock up on fuel

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es: Alejandrina, de 46 años de edad, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Dese hace 5 años, se dedica a la preparación de chicharrones y caldos de gallina, que son platillos que tiene mucha demanda en el Perú. Es así que atiende todos los días desde su casa o de manera delivery a diversos puntos de la zona en la que vive. Sus clientes potenciales, son los policías de la comisaría  y aquellos que tienen algún comercio cerca de su casa y ante tanta afluencia de gente, termina por vender todo antes del medio día. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que  lo realiza; tan solo por las mañanas y el resto del día se dedica a sus hijos. Para más adelante piensa ampliar su negocio, y para lograrlo seguirá trabajando como hasta ahora con el fin de brindar una calidad de vida saludable a sus hijos. Es su décimo crédito con MFP, y  se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo. Alejandrina  tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado, en la compra de un juego de ollas, cubiertos y platos en  general, y de esa manera seguir atendiendo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 46 years old and lives in her own home, together with with her husband and their two children. For the last 5 years, she has made chicharrones [fried pork rinds] and caldos de gallina [chicken soup], dishes that are very popular in Peru. She sells them everyday, from her house or by delivery to various points in the area where she lives. Her potential customers are policemen at the police station and people who own shops near her house. With such an influx of people, she ends up selling everything by midday. Her favorite thing about her work is that she only does it in the mornings, and is able to dedicate the rest of the day to her children. In the future, she is thinking about expanding her business. In order to achieve this, she will continue working as she always has, with the goal of providing her children with a healthy quality of life. This is her tenth loan with Microfinanzas Peru and she promises to make all of her repayments on time. Alejandrina is planning to invest the requested loan in the purchase of a set of pots, covers, and plates in general, so that she can continue serving her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a set of pots, covers, and plates

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es: Alexander se dedica a la actividad económica es la venta de semilla de jícaro.  Este no es el primer financiamiento  pues siempre está pendiente de lo que su negocio necesita. El trabaja todos los días por darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, Alexander tiene que levantarse muy temprano para ofrecer sus productos a lugares muy lejanas. El deseo de él comprar un caballo que le sirva como medio de transporte para el traslado de la semilla ya si ofrecerla a la ciudad. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima necesaria para su negocio.
texts.en:
Alexander's economic activity is selling semilla de jícaro [a type of drink, also called horchata]. This is not his first loan since he is always considering what his business needs. He works everyday to give his family a better quality of life. He has been working in this business for more than six years. Alexander has to get up very early to offer his products in very far-away places. His wish is to buy a horse that would serve him as a means of transport for carrying the semilla de jícaro if he would like to sell in the city. The loan is for purchasing raw materials that are needed for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Gumercindo

texts.es:
El señor Gumercindo E. M. es padre de 3 hijos a los cuales quiere ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida. Él quiere terminar de construir un cuarto de su vivienda que ha estado realizando poco a poco con ahorros; se encuentra en la etapa de la losa de concreto, para ya habitar ese cuarto y así tener más espacio.
Gumercindo y su esposa trabajan en una maquiladora para poder cubrir los gastos y dar un buen estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mr. Gumercindo E. M. is the father of 3 children to whom he wants to offer a better quality of life. He wants to finish building a room that he has built little by little with savings. He is currently working on puttinga concret floor down to use the room and thus have more space in his home. Gumercindo and his wife work in a factory to be able to cover expenses and give a good education to their children.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Elabaración de la losa de concreto del cuarto.

loans.name: Tamara Valeska

texts.es:
La señora Tamara Valeska C. D., es  casada y de 35 años de edad con su hijo pequeño habitan en el Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, él labora como contador apoyándole en el gasto que se incurre mensualmente, ella es agricultora  y así mismo apoya a los gastos del hogar y vela por su pequeño hijo, habitan en una casita muy humilde que  futuro esperan tener los recursos económicos para mejorar la infraestructura del hogar debido a que amenaza con la seguridad de los miembros de la familia, y así mismo no es un lugar digno donde desarrollarse.

Es para sus terrenos que solicitan un  préstamo para la compra de materiales agrícolas que le permitan mejorar la producción de sus cosechas, con el crédito comprara fertilizantes, fungicidas, insumos vegetativos, etc. Esta inversión le traerá mejores condiciones económicas para la inversión a futuro de las remodelaciones de su hogar, esto en beneficio de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Tamara Valeska C. D. is 35 years old and married, with a young son. They live in the Juan Ramón Padilla district. Her husband works as an accountant and helps her with the monthly expenses. She is a farmer, and thus she also helps with the household expenses as well as taking care of her young son. They live in a very humble home; in the future, they hope to have the economic resources to improve the home's infrrastructure, since it threatens the safety of the family members, and it is not suitable for a child's development. The reason she is requesting a loan is for her fields; she will buy agricultural supplies which will permit her to improve the production level of her crops. With the loan, she will buy fertilizers, fungicides, planting supplies, etc. This investment will improve her economic conditions, so that in the future she can invest in remodeling her home, bringing benefits to the whole family.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Providing better maintenance for her crops

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es: Adelaida P. es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora desde hace 9 años cuenta con negocio de abarrotes llamado “Miscelánea Oyuky” en el que ofrece mejor calidad y bajo precio. La señora desea surtir el negocio de papelería para tener más variedad en su local y de esta manera pueda recibir más ganancias.
texts.en:
Adelaida P. is a hard-working and enterprising woman. For nine years she has had a grocery business called “Miscelánea Oyuky”. She sells good quality for a low price. She wishes to stock her business with stationery in order to have more variety in her place. This way she will be able to get more income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María Magdalena T. y su esposo son una pareja muy trabajadora y responsable ello cuentan con un negocio llamado “Miscelánea Popeye” con una antigüedad de 4 años. 
El negocio es muy buena fuente de ingresos ya que de este es como suplen sus gastos, por tal motivo es que ellos desean surtir más su negocio para seguir generando ganancias.
texts.en:
María Magdalena T. and her husband are a very hard-working and responsible couple. They have had a business called “Miscelánea Popeye” (Popeye General Store) for four years. The business is a very good source of income, which is how they cover their expenses. That is why they wish to stock their business more in order to keep generating income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock their business

loans.name: Ana Bertha

texts.es: Ana Bertha S. C. es una mujer que prefiere estar en el hogar para cuidar a sus hijos, es por ello que desde hace 13 años opto en poner un negocio en su propia casa; lo cual es llamado “Miscelánea Claudia” donde ofrece todo en abarrotes, refrescos, botanas, dulces y mas. El crédito que requieren es para comprar más mercancía y ofrecer a sus clientes calidad. Esta familia es agradable que ha demostrado ser muy responsable ya que con este crédito será el segundo.
texts.en:
Ana Bertha Sanchez C. is a woman that enjoys being at home to take care of her children. For this reason she has been running her business out of her home for the last 13 years. Her business is called "Mescelanea Claudia" where you can buy groceries, soft drinks, snacks, candy and more. She is requesting this loan so that she can offer more products to her clients and continue to offer quality service. Ana has proven to be very responsible, this is her second loan she has taken out with FVP.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock the business

loans.name: Damaris Del Carmen

texts.es: La Señora Damaris del Carmen tiene 5 hijos y todos trabajan de manera independiente. Tiene la edad de 45 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación, por lo que tiene más de 5 años en este negocio  esta no es la primera experiencia que tiene con financiamientos, por lo que han sido muy gratificantes.  Pues todos los días se levanta temprano para realizar los quehaceres del hogar y atender a sus clientes que asisten a su pulpería. El crédito será utilizado para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, galletas y granos básicos.
texts.en:
Damaris del Carmen has 5 children who all work independently. She is 45 years old, and her source of income is a small grocery store, which is located in the house where she lives. She has been working in this business for more than 5 years, so this is not her first experience with loans, which have been rewarding. Every day she wakes up early to do her household chores and help the customers who come to her store. This loan will be used to buy candy, sodas, bread, cookies, and grain.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Elvis Yamil

texts.es: El señor Elvis Yamil L. F., es casado y con una única hija habitan en el municipio de Nandasmo, la señora labora como cajera y le apoya en los gastos del hogar, él trabaja como secretario en una empresa privada desde hace mas de 10 años, ellos habitan en una casa humilde que por sus limitados recursos económicos, no han podido comprar materiales de construcción para la remodelación de su hogar, es por esto que solicitan un préstamo para la compra de cemento, bloques, ceramica, en fin materiales variados que lleven a cabo este objetivo y mejore la calidad de vida de toda la familia, sobretodo para el pequeño que empieza a caminar y el  piso de su hogar no presenta condiciones salubres.
texts.en:
Mr. Elvis Yamil L. F. is married and he and his wife live with their one daughter in the municipality of Nandasmo. His wife works as a cashier and helps with household expenses. He has worked as a secretary in a private business for more than 10 years. They live in a humble house and, because of limited economic resources, they haven't been able to buy construction materials to remodel their house. That is why they are requesting a loan to buy cement, blocks, ceramic tiles, and various materials to meet their goal and improve the quality of life of their family. In particular, their little one is starting to walk, and the floor of their home is unsafe.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fixing the floor

loans.name: Simeamativa

texts.en:
Simeamativa C. W. is 35 and married with eight children. She owns a business venture, operating a retail shop in her home village. She has one year of experience in this business. Simeamativa is requesting a loan of 1,000 WST to purchase more goods for her shop. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 WST per week) to improve and expand her business.
In 2010, Simeamativa joined Kiva partner, SPBD. This is her first loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Simeamativa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and, since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD. Visit http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase more goods for her shop

texts.en:
