Telesia is requesting a loan of 1,000 WST to purchase weedkillers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 160 WST per week) to improve and expand her business.
In 2010, Telesia joined Kiva partner, SPBD. This is her first loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Telesia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Melba Yesenia

texts.es: Melba tiene 22 años, vive en casa con su  hijo de 5 años a su cargo. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a vender prendas de vestir, ofreciendo a personas que en su mayoría son conocidas o familiares, eso le garantiza el pago de la mercadería que vende. Afirma que este negocio es muy rentable porque compra a un precio módico las prendas y puede ofrecer a un buen precio a sus clientes, es así que se abastece de mercadería Una de sus metas es mejorar sus ingresos para realizar mejoras a su vivienda. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de más mercadería en pantalones, camisas, faldas, ropa interior y productos en general.
texts.en:
Melba is 22 years old and lives at home with her 5-year-old son. For the past 5 years she has sold clothing items, selling to people who are mostly acquaintances or family members, which guarantees she will be paid for the merchandise she sells. She says that this business is very profitable because she buys clothing at low prices and can sell them at a good price to her customers, and then she can stock up on merchandise. One of her goals is to increase her income so that she can improve her home. With the loan that she is requesting, she will invest in buying more pants, shirts, skirts, underwear, and general products.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
Trinidad tiene 55 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos dependientes, vive junto a su familia en el caserío Lagartera, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, un distrito agrícola de regular movimiento comercial que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se que se encuentra ubicada a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a confeccionar prendas de vestir desde hace quince años, el suele confeccionar casacas, pantalones y camisas a pedido en un pequeño taller que tiene instalado en su domicilio. Trinidad confecciona sus prendas y cuando ya las ha terminado las vende a un comerciante mayorista que distribuye su mercadería en diversas ciudades del país. Esta actividad es la principal fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta por lo que siempre se esfuerza para mantenerse en el negocio y sacar adelante a su familia.

Trinidad desea adquirir mas telas y diversos materiales que le permitan seguir trabajando para sacar a su familia adelante, para lograr su meta ha creído pertinente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Trinidad es un hombre tranquilo y bastante trabajador, el desea segui trabajando arduamente para sacar a su familia adelante, las personas que le conocen en su comunidad le consideran alguien honrado y confiable.
texts.en:
Trinidad, age 55, is married and has two dependent children. He lives with his family in the Lagartera community, a rural area in the Mórrope district. It is an agricultural district with regular commercial activity. It belongs to the Lambayeque province, which is over an hour from the city of Chiclayo. He has been making clothing for 15 years. He usually makes jackets, pants, and shirts by order. He does this in a small shop that he set up in his home. Trinidad makes garments, and when they are finished he sells them to wholesale merchants who distribute his merchandise in different cities in the country. This activity is his primary source of income. Therefore, he always strives to maintain the business and get his family ahead. Trinidad wishes to get more fabric and different materials, which will allow him to keep working in order to get his family ahead. In order to meet his objective, he has seen fit to request his first loan of 1,500 soles through Edpyme Alternativa. Trinidad is a level-headed and very hard-working man. He wishes to keep working arduously in order to get his family ahead. The people in his community who know him consider him to be an honest and trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric and material to expand his business of making clothes

loans.name: Anonymous

She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 320 WST per week) to improve and expand her business.

loans.name: Maria Leanie

texts.en:
Maria Leanie A. is from the village of Balanlinao. She is 42 years old. Maria Leanie is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Maria Leanie owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Maria Leanie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Maria Leanie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Leanie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. Maria Leanie is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Maria Leanie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

Marjoren has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

Marjoren is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Marjoren from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business.

loans.use: To buy BBQ meat, ketchup, plastic plates and utensils, and coal

loans.name: Yazmin

texts.es: Yazmín R. R. y su esposo cuentan con negocio de la venta de hamburguesas el cual tiene un año. La venta la realiza los día Jueves, Viernes, Sábados y Domingos ya que son lo días qua mas se vende su producto. La joven pareja aun no cuentan con dependientes económicos pero quieren prepararse antes de tenerlos para ofrecerles una mejora calidad de vida. El crédito que solicita es para comprar una estufa para poder dar rapidez a su venta y así los clientes estén satisfechos por el servicio.
texts.en:
Yazmín R. R. and her husband have relied on a business selling hamburgers for the past year. They sell on Thursdays, Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays, since those are the days when they can sell the most. The young couple do not yet have any dependents, since they want to be prepared before having them in order to offer them an improved quality of life. The loan that they are requesting is to buy a grill to be able to increase the speed of preparing the hamburgers for sale and improve customer satisfaction with their service.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a grill for their hamburger sale business.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Roció M. M. tiene un negocio de la venta de ropa usada desde hace 1 año el cual se ubica en lugar muy concurrido, donde se observa prosperidad. Ella es madre de tres hijos a los cuales quiere ofrecerles una mejora calidad  de vida. En este momento ella requiere de un préstamo para surtir su negocio; comenta que su hermana va salir a la ciudad donde ellas compran la mercancía por pacas y quiere aprovechar el viaje adquirir mas mercancía.
texts.en:
Roció M. M. has had a business selling used clothing for the past year which is located in a busy and prosperous part of the town. She is a mother of three children, who wants to offer them an improved quality of life. At this time she requires a loan to supply her business. She comments that her sister is going to travel to the city where they buy the merchandise wholesale and she wants to take advantage of the trip to acquire more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more used clothing wholesale

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es: Ernestina P. Alcalá es costurera profesión que desempeña por mas de  5 años, cuenta con su taller en su misma vivienda; donde realiza trabajos como Vestidos de novias, Quinceañeras, levantar bastillas, alguna confección en particular depende de lo que desee el cliente. En este momento Ernestina requiere un préstamo para comprar telas ya que viene la temporada escolar  cuando mas requieren de su trabajo y quiere estar preparada por eso pide el apoyo.
texts.en:
Ernestina P. Alcalá has been a professional seamstress for more than 5 years. She relies on her workshop in her home, where she makes clothing such as wedding Dresses, dresses for girl's 15th birthday celebration (Quinceañeras), raising hemlines, and custom tailoring at the request of the client. At this time Ernestina requires a loan to buy fabrics since the school season is approaching when there are more demands for her work. She wants to be prepared, therefore she asks for the support.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric to make clothing to sell.

loans.name: Losivale

texts.en:
Losivale M. is 45 and married with five children. She owns a business venture baking and selling puddings in the local community and has one year of experience in this business.

Losivale needs a loan of WST 1,800 to rent baking equipment. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 150 talas or approximately US$60 per week) to improve and expand her business.

In 2007, Losivale joined SPBD and this is her 3rd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are her only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To rent baking equipment

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es: La señora Yanet A. se desempeña como Diseñadora de alta costura profesión que aprendió de su madre y estudios que realizo para poder perfeccionar sus trabajos. Ella cuenta con su propio taller al que le esta faltando una maquina con el nombre Recta para que sus trabajo queden mejor. Ella hace costuras de todo tipo como vestidos, pantalones, subir bastillas, poner cierres y más. Yanet y su esposo tienen una hija por la que quieren que tenga un mejor patrimonio y un buen estudio.
texts.en:
Yanet A. works as a high fashion designer. She learned this profession from her mother. She also studied to be able to perfect her work. She has her own shop. She needs a Recta sewing machine so that the clothing she makes fits better. She does all types of sewing like making dresses and pants, hemming, putting in zippers, and more. Yanet and her husband have a daughter, and they want her to have a better legacy and a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a sewing machine
